Cita T. S., 36, who sells clothing and shoes.
Faustina Nicolás Martínez, 31, who makes and sells tamales.
Azucena M. E., 34, who sells medicines.
Carmelita Pérez Nicolás, 36, who sells groceries. 
Yolanda A. Hernández, 21, who sells clothing.
Jerónimo V. C., 71 , who raises livestock.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Mirna Ruth

texts.es:
Doña Mirna, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su madre y una hermana, está soltera y tiene 41 años de edad, es empleada desde hace dos años, trabajando de 8:00am a 5:00pm, actualmente solicita un préstamo para mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que se encuentra deteriorado y teme que llegue el invierno y cause algún accidente domestico.
Dicho préstamo solventara su necesidad y ayudara a mantener la vivienda en buenas condiciones, donde su familia pueda estar más segura y vivir en condiciones dignas.
texts.en:
Mirna lives in El Transito, in San Miguel department, with her mother and a sister.  She is 41 years old and single.  She has been working as an employee for two years.  She works from 8.00am to 5.00pm.

Mirna is currently requesting a loan to improve her roof since it is in a bad state of repair and she fears that when the winter comes it will cause a domestic accident.

This loan will cover Mirna's needs and will help her to keep her home in a good condition so that her family can live more safely and in decent conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to fix her roof

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes actividades como comerciantes y empelados de fabricas.

En este lugar  conocimos a la señora Cruz, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 6, 4 años y un bebé de tres meses, el mayor  estudia en la escuela. El marido es obrero.
 
Tiene un pequeño local en el cual vende pañales, paños húmedos y otros productos para bebé, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, nos cuenta que sus ventas son muy buenas ya que es el único local que vende estos productos en su localidad, lo cual le deja muy buenas ganancias. Lleva varios años con su negocio y está muy contenta porque cada dia su negocio crece más. Sus productos los compra en Manta ya que allá consigue a muy buen precio. Le gusta su negocio porque le permite superarce económicamente y estar al tanto de sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar pañales, paños húmedos y otros productos para bebé. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio, es la secretaria del mismo y le gusta por la ayuda y los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Su sueño es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) Communal Bank meets in Manabi province at Bajo de Montecristi, a small place surrounded by much vegetation. Its inhabitants are dedicated to different activities, including merchants and factory employees.

In this locale we got to know Cruz, who is 33 years old and maintains a common law relationship from which there are 3 children, ages 6 and 4, and a baby of 3 months. The eldest studies in school. The husband is a worker.

Cruz has a small stall where she sells diapers, baby wipes, and other products for babies. She works every day from  8:30 am until 5:00 pm. She tells us that sales are very good since hers is the only stall that sells these products in that locale, thus providing good earnings. Cruz has had her business for several years and she is very content because each day, the business grows. She buys her products in Manta, since prices are good there. Cruz enjoys her business; it permits her to get ahead economically and to provide her children's needs.

This loan is to buy diapers, baby wipes, and other products for babies. Cruz has been a member of her communal bank almost from the start. She is currently its Secretary and she likes it for the help and benefits she receives from this institution.

loans.use: to buy diapers, baby wipes, and other products for babies.

loans.name: Koute Diomboulou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KOUTE DIOMBOULOU est créé le 26 mai 2001. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NIAGUIS NEMA.

Mme Aïssatou Cissé se remarque sur la photo du groupe à gauche avec un foulard vert sur la tête. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfant. Elle a aussi trois autres personnes à sa charge.

Cette femme fait un commerce modéré de légumes dans le marché de sa localité. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la région.

Ce crédit servira à acheter des légumes.

Avec ce prêt, Aïssatou Cissé espère réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices et aider son époux handicapé dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The KOUTE DIOMBOULOU solidarity group was created on May 26, 2001. It consists of ten women who are all from the same village. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of Niaguis Nema.

Mrs. Aïssatou Cissé appears on the left of the photo wearing a green scarf on her head. She is married with six children. She also takes care of three other people.

She sells vegetables at her local market. She buys her merchandise at the weekly markets of the area. She will use this loan to buy vegetables, and hopes to earn substantial profits to help her disabled husband provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 52 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 5 de ellos son independientes y 3 aún están en casa con el apoyo de la socia, ellos tiene 21, 18, 12; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de productos secos (habas, granos de maíz de todos los tipos para venderlos como semillas, papa, trigo, cebada, arvejas, moraya); la socia desea el crédito para comprar granos al por mayor, la socia tiene sus proveedores y sus clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para compra productos secos para la venta. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the “PEROLNIYOC” community bank.  She lives in Urubamba district, in Cusco department.

The borrower is 52 years old, married, and has eight children.  Five of her children live independently and three still live at home with her support.  They are 21, 18 and 12.  The borrower divides her time between her household duties and her business buying and selling dry goods (beans, corn kernels, seeds, potatoes, wheat, barley, peas and 'moraya' (freeze-dried potato)).  She would like this loan to buy grains wholesale.  She already has suppliers and customers.  She is requesting her loan to buy dry goods to sell.

The borrower appreciates the loan which she has been granted and is really grateful for it.  It will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life.  She pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy dry goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in beauty products and to improve her business premises

loans.name: Eliquia

texts.es:
La señora Eliquia tiene la edad de 52 años, solo estudio la primaria y se encuentra casada con el señor Benicno el cual trabaja de agricultor, ella nos platica que actualmente vive solo con su esposo ya que sus hijos ya estan casados, ellos vien en el estado de oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera a solo 15 minutos del ingenio azucarero don pablo machado.

Doña eliquia nos platica que ha ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar a si que hace algunos años asistio a unos cursos que impartieron en su comunidad para aprender a elaborar manualidades como son zapatos bordados, blusas, bolsas, vestidos y servilletas pintadas y bosrdadas, desde que ella aprendi a trabajar con las manualidades decidio iniciar a trabajar vendiendolas con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad para ganar un poco de dinero extra y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ellanos platica que algunas veces trabaja por pedido pero que tambien elabora sus productos y sale a ofrecerlos casa por casa en su comunidad, ella nos dice que le ha hido muy bien con su negocio y que hace algunos meses ha iniciado a vender zapatos por catalago y ahora tiene dos pequeños negocios los cuales le gustaria hacer creser dia a dia con su trabajo.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de hilos, listones, pinturas, telas, ganchos, ahugas, zapatos y catalagos para poder realizar sus ventas.

ella es una persona muy entusiasta y nos dice que no pierde la esperanza de en un futuro tener un pequeño local en el centro de su comunidad en el cual vender sus productos
texts.en:
Sra. Eliquia is 52 years old and only has an elementary school education. She is married to Sr. Benicno, who works as a farmer. Eliquia says that she and her husband live by themselves since their children are already married. She lives in the community of Tetela, which is in the State of Oaxaca. This town is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Eliquia says that she has always enjoyed working. A few years ago, she attended a few courses that were taught in her community. She learned how to make handicrafts such as embroidered shoes, blouses, handbags, dresses, and painted and embroidered napkins. Since learning how to make these crafts, she decided to start selling them to her friends and neighbors in the community to earn extra money and help her husband with the household expenses. Occasionally she produces some items from orders, but most of the products she makes are sold by going house-to-house in her community. Eliquia says that she has done very well in her business. A few months ago, she also started selling shoes through catalogs. Now that she has two small businesses, Eliquia enjoys growing in her job day after day.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of thread, ribbons, paints, fabrics, fasteners, needles, shoes, and catalogs so that she can generate sales.

Eliquia is an enthusiastic person. She says that she has not lost hope in the future of having a small shop in her community where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase thread, ribbons, paints, fabrics, fasteners, needles, shoes, and catalogs.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 24 years old and married. He is blessed with a three year-old daughter. For the past two years, he has run a kiosk (retail shop) in the Kibotany trading center. He earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

Ronald is requesting a loan of 5,000 KES from KADET LTD to purchase more stock for his business which includes tea leaves, detergents, rice, flour and many more. He anticipates that his monthly income will increase after receiving his loan as he will have more products to sell.

Ronald plans to save his profits for the future education of his children. He dreams of being a successful businessman and giving his children the best possible education.

loans.use: To purchase more stock (like tea leaves, detergents, rice, and flour) for his retail shop

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Asunción”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Estudió hasta 3ro de secundaria.
Ella se dedica a la confección de casacas, nos cuenta que sus productos los vende en la ciudad de Lima, Cusco y a veces en la localidad de Yunguyo.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace treinta ciclos, la primera vez que solicito su préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, este dinero lo invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/  1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cien metros de telas de polar para la confección de casacas para ponerlas a la venta.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando con el negocio y tener un carro para realizar servicios.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la reunión, el préstamo de los ahorros (cuenta interna) y el préstamo complementario.
texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the Virgen de la Asuncion Communal Bank, located in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the Puno department. She is 30, married, and has 3 children. She studied up to the third grade of secondary school.
She makes jackets, and tells us that she sells her products in the city of Lima, Cusco, and sometimes in Yunguyo. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuel Ramos for three cycles. The first loan that she requested was for 500 soles. She will invest this loan in her business.
With this new loan of 1500 soles, she will purchase 100 meters of fleece fabric for making jackets for sale.
Her dream is to continue working in her business and have a car for services. 
What she likes about her Communal Bank are the meetings, the loans issued against the internal savings account, and the regular Communal Bank loans.

loans.use: to purchase 100 meters of fleece fabric

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Boniface, 56, is from Migori and is married to Maria. They have seven adult children.

Boniface has a timber sales business that he has been operating for many years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to buy more timber to sell. He is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan, as it will boost it.

The profits made from this business will be used to cater for the needs of his big family. He intends to open up a big timber yard in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more timber to add to his business.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Florita is providing jeepney services and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline used for the services.

Florita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Florita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar, de 29 años es un hombre muy sencillo; hace 6 años que formó su familia junto a Erika, su esposa. Ambos tienen 2 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de San Juan. Este laborioso hombre “agricultor”, dedica su tiempo en la siembra de papa, alverja y habas en sus terrenos propios y otros arrendados; ya que existen momentos en los que arrienda más terrenos productivos para poder tener mayor producción. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es poder cuidar de sus cultivos; podando, fertilizando y mejorando la calidad de los alimentos en su proceso de maduración. Ya tiene 18 años de experiencia en el oficio de agricultor y se siente muy bien por ello. Además que comenzó con el negocio de compra y venta de semilla, los cuales lleva a la ciudad de Arequipa, donde obtiene buenas ganancias gracias a que no se produce semilla en esa parte de la costa peruana. Ahora está planeando mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos y expandir su negocio, ya que es lo que más le gusta. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete cumplir una vez más con el pago de sus cuotas. Edgar hace 2 años que compró su casa propia, por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el arreglo de las ventanas, entablado del piso, cambio de puertas y en el mejoramiento del techado.
texts.en: Edgar is 29 years old. He is a humble man who 6 years ago started a family with Erika, his wife. They have 2 children whom they are raising in their own home located in the community of San Juan. This hardworking farmer spends his time growing potatoes, peas and beans on his own land and on rented land. He rents more productive land sometimes for more production. What he likes the most about his job is being able to care for his crops trimming, fertilizer, and improving the quality of the food in the ripening process. He has 18 years experience in the farming profession and he feels very good about that. He also started a business buying and selling seeds. He takes them  to the city of Arequipa, where he makes good profit because that type of seed isn't produced in that area of the Peruvian coast. Now he is planning on improving the quality of his crops and growing his business, since that is what he likes the most. This is his eighth loan with MFP, where he hopes to have your cooperation to continue with his goals. He also promises to once more make his payments on time. Two years ago, Edgar bought his own house. That is why, if he receives your support, he will invest the money he has asked for in repairing the windows, putting in a floor, changing the doors and improving the roof.

loans.use: to repair windows, change doors and install a roof.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de maíz, ella es propietaria de las  tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz y luego lo lleva al distrito de Ollantaytambo, la socia trabaja también en una empresa de productos naturales para la salud, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de maíz y mejorar en su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the "San Rafael" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Victoria is 30 years old, married, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling corn.  She owns farmland where she grows corn which she then takes to Ollantaytambo district to sell.  She also works for a natural health foods company.  Through these jobs, she gets her children ahead in life.  Victoria would like to expand and improve her business selling corn and improve in her work.  She is requesting this loan to buy corn.

Victoria is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married with six children. She is 54 years old and lives in Ubay, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Delia runs a sari-sari store to earn a living. This is a new business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase groceries to sell.
Delia has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years old and married to Patricia. They are blessed with three children. Joseph does food manufacturing. He has been in this business for the last five years and gets an income of KES 20,000 per month.


Joseph has got a good credit history in KADET LTD and he is applying for his second loan of KES.60,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to use to buy chemicals for production, using the whole amount. 


He will use the anticipated profit to add more stock and other materials. Joseph hopes to expand his business. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy chemicals.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla is 31 years old and married with two children.

Myla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Myla has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Myla aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mwizero K1 Group

texts.fr:
Rose est une commerçante âgée de 38ans qui habite  au Quartier Mutanga de la Ville de Bujumbura. Elle vend divers produits vivriers(haricot, riz, farine,etc.) depuis 4ans. Elle vendait l'huile de palme avant de commencer cette activite.Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 8e année de l'ecole secondaire. Elle est veuve et mere de 3 enfants qui etudient.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 400,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de produits vivriers (haricot, riz, farine, etc) à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« MWIZERO 1».
texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old.  She is a retailer and lives in Mutanga neighborhood, in the town of Bujumbura.  She has been selling a range of food products (beans, rice, flour, etc.) for 4 years.  Before starting this business she used to sell palm oil.  Rose studied up to the 8th year of secondary school.  She is a widow and has three children who are in school.

Rose will use her loan for 400,000 Burundian francs to increase her capital and buy large quantities of food products (beans, rice, flour, etc.) to re-sell and make good profits.  She is a member of the 'Mwizero 1' community bank.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy large quantities of food (beans, rice, flour, etc.) to re-sell

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is 40 years old  and single.  He lives in Lebanon with his parents. He and his father work to cover their expenses and improve the family's standard of living, especially as Mostafa does not have a family of his own. 

Mostafa opened his own minimarket in 2002 and makes a good income. He is requesting a loan for $700 Ameen s.a.l, which he will use to increase his store's inventory of groceries, dairy products, and daily products. This loan will help him increase his revenues by 15%. In the future, he plans to expand his business even further.

loans.use: to increase his store's inventory of groceries, dairy products, and daily products.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while the other one is too young for school. Her husband who is a farmer contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Teresia has operated a rope-selling business for the past six years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of transporting her products from the market to her place of sale. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 5,000 she wants to purchase more stock of ropes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of ropes for resale.

loans.name: Furaha Shg Group

texts.en:
Mary is the facilitator of the Furaha SHG group. Mary and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Mary will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Furaha SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Mary with her group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Whatever is worth doing at all is worth doing well and for that reason always give a good account of yourself. That has been 42 year-old Juliet's Philosophy for two decades.  Juliet also believes that he or she who endures conquers.

With those two salutary philosophies in mind, she has by and large been riding high on success in most of her business ventures, principally her current goat sales.

The purposeful and self-esteemed mother of six has shown her worth in a business which is mostly thought of as a male preserve.

On the side, Juliet also banks on profits from a farming and Pub business.  Weekly she says her sales returns add up to UGX 50,000.

She says she will use her loan to purchase more goats and also more hard and soft beverages for her Pub.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and also more hard and soft beverages for her Pub.

loans.name: Raksmey

texts.en:
Raksmey and her husband, Chamroeun, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and have one young son.

Raksmey and her husband are farmers; they grow ginger and yams on their farmland in the village where they live.

Raksmey is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase seeds and pesticides to maintain her farm.   

Photo: Raksmey is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Nkulokoh

texts.en:
Born on the 11th of August, 1971, she is single with two children, both younger than 15. They all live in a one room house on Ben and Bros Street, a quarter in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced challenges in life such as death, a broken home, poverty and ill health.

Life had been so difficult for her until she joint GHAPE in 2009. She has borrowed and repaid two loans, which she used to to sell Irish potatoes and to buy fabrics to sew school uniforms. These activities enabled her to pay her children’s school fees, medication and house rent and to provide her children with a balanced diet. She plans to use this loan to buy fabric, cocoyams (taro) and Irish potatoes. She is very positive that her business will succeed because of her experience and better management skills. Furthermore, she sells to her customers at low prices and has good availability of products at all times to make sure the community has a regular supply of commodities.

She plans to use any profit made from this loan to pay her children's school fees, medication and house rent and to cater for other unforeseen circumstances in the family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the low interest rates, convenient installment repayments, no collateral security and training in business tactics before loan disbursement.

loans.use: To buy fabric, Irish potatoes and cocoyams

loans.name: Rohel

texts.en:
Rohel is married with three children. He is 33 years old, residing at Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines.

To earn a living, Rohel runs a food stall, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. He has been in this business for three years, and each month he earns PHP 5,600 from the business.

He requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. In 2011, Rohel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Rohel wants to save to have a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo tiene 52 años de edad y está casado con la señora Otilia la cual se dedica al hogar, desde hace dos años se dedica a la crianza de borregos y vacas y dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo porque sus papas desde muy pequeño le inculcaron el amor por los animales y por la tierra. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito para comprar borregos ya que en el mes de diciembre es cuando mejores ventas tiene por las fiestas navideñas. También comprara vacunas para que no se le enfermen y para alimento para sus animalitos. El está muy contento porque si le dan el crédito él podrá tener más animales para vender ya que se vienen las buenas ventas, también platica que una de sus metas es seguir echándole ganas y comprarse una camioneta de uso para así facilitarle el traslado de los animales ya que muchas veces no se los compran por que no tiene como trasladarlos a donde los quieren comprar. Dice que gracias a la financiera poco a poco a crecido su rebaño y eso lo tiene contento porque  quiere decir que  si ha hecho buen uso de los créditos que le han otorgado.
texts.en: Gustavo is 52 years old, and he lives with his wife Otilia. For the last two years he has worked raising sheep and cattle, and he says he enjoys his job because at a young age his parents taught him to love animals and the land. He will use the loan to purchase sheep because sales are the highest during the month of December because of the Christmas celebrations. He will also use the money to vaccinate his animals and to purchase animal feed. He is very pleased to receive this loan because it will allow him to sell more animals during the busiest season. One of his goals is to purchase a used pickup truck to transport the animals. On several occasions he has been unable to make sales because he has no way to transport the animals to where his clients are. He is thankful for the support from the bank because his flock is growing little by little, and this is proof that he has been using the loan money well.

loans.use: raise and sell sheep and cattle

loans.name: Yesenia Elena

texts.es:
Yesenia es una joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete en el distrito de Imperial con su madres y su pequeña hija de un año de edad, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeña, ya que es padre y madre para ella; lamentablemente Yesenia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con su pequeña hija.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yesenia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Yesenia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un andamio, una vitrina y mayor cantidad de golosinas; de esta manera Yesenia tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y abastecido, así pues Yesenia espera aumentar sus ventas para poco a poco poder ampliar su negocio y lograr su sueño de tener su minimarket y lograr que su pequeña sea una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Yesenia, 19, lives in the Imperial district of the city of Cañete with her mother and her young daughter, 1.  She's a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic young woman who dedicates all her effort into getting her little girl ahead because she is both father and mother to her.  Unfortunately Yesenia wasn't able to study for a career but she very much would have enjoyed being able to do so.  In her free time she likes to play with her little girl.

On her own initiative and with great effort and dedication, Yesenia works in her small business selling sweets.  Every day she starts working very early.  She can work approximately 10 hours.  She believes it's going well for her because of her dedication and the kind way she treats others.

Yesenia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy shelving, a display case, and a large quantity of sweets.  This way Yesenia's business will be better outfitted and supplied.

Yesenia hopes to increase her sales and, little by little, her business so she can realize her dreams of having a minimarket and of her daughter being a good professional.

loans.use: to buy shelving, a display case, and sweets

loans.name: Vat

texts.en:
C. Vat is a very busy single mother. She runs a business selling electricity. She generally earns about $187.50 per month from these sales, and spends about $63 on diesel, which results in an average $124.50 net income per month. She also operates a Karaoke business out of her home, which her daughter runs for her. They typically earn about $3.75 a day from this.

C. Vat is requesting a loan for $600 in order to purchase a motor bike for her son to drive to work. Her son works in a factory, and earns a salary of $70 per month. The motor bike will allow her son to get to and from work more economically and thus allow them to save more from his salary.

In the future C. Vat would like to expand her Karaoke business, to include selling food and drinks to the customers. She is very excited about being able to provide greater opportunities to her children in the future, and believes this loan will help them improve their lives.

loans.use: Purchase motor bike for son to drive to work.

loans.name: Pola

texts.en: Pola T. is a woman from the village of Levi Saleimoa, born and raised at Safotu Savaii.  She’s fifty-two (52) years of age married to a man from the village of Levi Saleimoa, where they are living with their four children.  Pola is gifted by God with the talent of sewing.  She’s doing a good job to help meet her family needs, especially her children’s fees in school.  She has more than twenty people coming to her for sewing materials, and she had done a great job satisfying her customers by giving them what they have asked for. With this loan she hopes to buy an additional sewing machine and more materials to meet the growing demand for her designs.

loans.use: Purchase one sewing machine, additional fabrics, threads, buttons and other sewing needs

loans.name: Vaimoa

texts.en:
Vaimoa is a pancake maker whose number one customers are the school children. Because pancakes are the cheapest substitute for bread and sweet cakes, it is a favorite among the school children. One of the reasons why pancakes are a high demand with schoolchildren is because not only it is affordable food, but they come in a big number also. School children with only one tala in their pockets can purchase 10 pancakes with just that amount of money.

For five days a week, Vaimoa goes around to the schools selling and earning 20 tala per day and 100 a week; her profit is 50 tala. The 40-year-old mother’s business helps her husband who works to earn the school fees for three of their children who are still attending school.

loans.use: To purchase oven, flour & oil

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
María Elsa is 41 years old, is married, and has two children. She weaves bed covers and is a street merchant, selling her bed covers and other products. She is the daughter of another weaver, from whom she learned this occupation. After she married, she continued weaving and sold her farm. She and her husband worked very hard in order to earn their daily living. María Elsa wove blankets and her husband sold them. They currently work as street merchants, selling the blankets and items of clothing in various cities of the country, such as Luque, Capiatá e Itauguá; they are able to earn a better profit this way.

Her oldest son, who is 18 years old, wants to get into sales, and to do this he needs a loan of $200.00 to buy merchandise such us t-shirts, coats, and children’s clothing, and in this way earn some capital. Her son very much wants to begin his university studies, which because of economic limitations he can’t yet start.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María Elsa tiene 41 años es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Es tejedora de colchas y vendedora ambulante de este y otros productos. Ella es hija de otra tejedora de quién aprendió el oficio, y luego de casarse continuó con esta actividad para lo cual vendió su finca. Junto con su marido trabajaron duro para poder obtener el sustento diario, ella se dedicaba a tejer las colchas y su marido salia a venderlas. Hoy día realizan la venta ambulante de su producción y a la vez de prendas de ropas en varias ciudades del país como Luque, Capiatá e Itauguá, ellos obtienen buenas ganancias. Su hijo mayor de 18 años desea incorporarse al negocio de ventas y para empezar necesita un créditode $200 para comprar mercaderías como camisas, remeras, camperas y ropa para niños y de esta forma hacerse de capital. Su hijo tiene muchas ganas de iniciar sus estudios universitarios que por limitaciones económicas no puede empezar.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, coats, and children's clothing

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
Maria Susana lives in the locality of Escobedo. She is married, and has three children. Her husband works in a professional company but as their children have grown his salary became insufficient to cover household expenses and school fees. Therefore, Maria began to sell footwear among her relatives and neighbors and has done so for ten years. Her gusto for salesmanship has helped her to develop and augment her portfolio of clients.

In order to meet the demand of her clients and improve the quality of her service Maria needs a loan for $750, which she will use in the purchase of merchandise for the new season-with which she hopes to increase her sales. She promises to repay this money in 6 months. Maria and her family thank you for your help in improving the quality of life of her family and contributing to the development of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Escobedo vive Maria Susana, ella está casada y tiene tres hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa pero al crecer sus hijos el salario de su esposo se volvía insuficiente para cubrir los gastos del hogar y las colegiaturas, así que Maria comenzó a vender calzado entre sus familiares y vecinas hace diez años, pero su gusto por las ventas le ha ayudado a crecer e incrementar su cartera de clientes.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de su servicio Maria necesita un crédito por $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía de la nueva temporada, con lo que espera incrementar sus ventas y promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Maria a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia contribuyendo al desarrollo de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.en: Marta has a successful small business: preparing and selling food.  She started her business five years ago.  In the morning, she prepares food such as spaghetti, boiled eggs, bananas with fried hot dogs or fried eggs and so on.  In the night, she sells fried chicken, broth, fried potatoes, manioc, and so forth.  With the income obtained from her business, Marta, 36, provides her two sons with a good education.  Currently, she is thinking about remodeling the locale where she operates the business.  With the loan requested, she will also purchase raw materials to prepare the food.  Given the loan, the entrepreneur hopes the remodeled local will attract new customers to her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to prepare food for her business.  Also to remodel the locale where she sells the food.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a nine-year-old son. She lives in the city of Zaporozhye and sells cosmetics in one of the local markets. Irina has been in the market for a long time. She has a rich experience working in the sphere of market trade. She owns a big vending stall and has a nice arrangement of inventory which catches the eye of every woman passing by her kiosk.

Irina’s business has grown a lot in the past six years. Today she has about $3000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is usually about $500. New items for sale have added to the success of her business. Irina would like to get a loan of $600 to increase her assortment of hair styling and manicure accessories before the big Christmas shopping season. Her responsible attitude and good credit history give us confidence that Irina will quickly repay this current loan.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Sabran

texts.en: “I am Sabran B. and live in the small town of Vehari in Pakistan. I require a loan for my own jewellery business. I sell jewellery door-to-door and in villages surrounding Vehari. I purchase my jewellery, which includes traditional bangles, from Multan and Lahore, two large cities. Fortunately, my husband and I make  enough to feed our five children.”

loans.use: Purchase jewellery to re-sell door-to-door

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan O. is a thirty one year old man who is an automobile electrician.  He opened his own shop five years ago.  Since then he has attracted a great clientele and makes enough money to support his small family of three.  His dream is that one day his son will grow into a successful adult.
He is asking for a loan in order to buy car batteries, distilled water, cable, sockets, alternators, light bulbs and other car parts.  His plans for the future are to increase his business and include his wife.  She hopes to attach a small convenience store to the auto shop.

loans.use: To buy batteries, distilled water, reels, plugs, sockets, cables, copper, alternators and light bulbs.

loans.name: Hermelinda Epifania

texts.es:
Mrs. Hermelinda Epifania V. D. Castillo is 54 years old and studied until 8th graD. of school. She has four children but none of them depend on her. She lives in the Quiñigon Ave. in the district of Mache, Otuzco province, La Libertad department in Peru.

Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle and breeding small animals such as: pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. She currently has two cows, two calves, and some pigs which she will fatten for some time to later sell them.

She became part of the communal bank, "Women of Mache" in which she received a loan for S/. 300.00 and with this money she bought two lambs.

With the loan for S/.2500.00, which she will pay in 4 months, she will buy 2 cows.

Mrs. Hermelinda is treasurer for the popular diner in her community called "Virgen D. la Puerta". She has planned to save capital to open a store in her home, because she is afraid that because of her age, in the future she will not be able to work buying and selling animals.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Hermelinda Epifanía V. D. Castillo tiene 54 años D. edad, estudió hasta el segundo año D. secundaria .Tiene cuatro hijos pero ninguno depenD. D. ella. Vive en la Av. Quiñigón del distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad - Perú

DesD. que convive con su esposo se dedica al negocio D. la compra y venta D. reses y a la crianza D. animales menores tales como: cerdos, gallinas y cuyes. Camina por las chacras y por los diversos caseríos a conseguir ganado a menor precio y así poder obtener mayores utilidades. Actualmente tiene 2 vacas, 2 terneros y algunos huachos que los engordarán por un tiempo para venderlos después.

Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. Mache” en el cual recibió su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró 2 corderos.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 el cual pagará en 4 cuatro meses comprará 2 vacas.

La señora Hermelinda es tesorera del comedor popular D. su comunidad llamado”Virgen D. la Puerta”. Se ha proyectado ahorrar y tener un capital para abrir una tienda en su casa, debido a que tiene temor que por su edad más adelante ya no pueda dedicarse a la compra y venta D. animales.

loans.use: Buying animals to sell (Con el prestamo comprara animales para su venta)

loans.name: Zumrad

texts.ru:
Zumrad A. lives in the town Tirsun-zoda. She is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband works in construction. Zumrad herself makes her earnings through food sales. She sells nuts (almonds and pistachios) and dried fruits at a market "Dehkon". She purchases the products from wholesalers and resells it in smaller quantities. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She needs financial help to purchase the inventory. Since the new crops are not yet ready and the old crops are soon going to be all used, the prices for old crops are raising every day. Zumrad wants to obtain a loan so she could purchase enough products. This will help her keep the same prices, continue receiving steady income, and give local residents a chance to purchase her products at affordable prices. She plans to pay off the credit within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Абилова Зумрад проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Ей 31 год, она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Муж зарабатывает подсобным рабочим на стройке. Сама клиентка зарабатывает на жизнь торговлей . Продает орехи( фисташки ,миндаль.) и сухофрукты на рынке «Дехкон».Скупает товар у оптовых продавцов и продает в розницу. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиентка уже 5 лет. Ей необходима финансовая помощь.Нужно закупить товар, так как нового урожая еще нет , а прошлогодний уже заканчивается и цены на него дорожают . поэтому клиентка хочет получить кредит и закупить товар.Это поможет ей сохранить цены на рынке и люди смогут покупать продукт по доступным ценам , а так же обеспечить себе стабильный заработок. А погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph O. M. Joseph runs a small general store. He is married and has 4 children. He is running out of stock.

He is asking for a loan of $525 to restock his store

loans.use: To restock a small store

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru:
Fahriddin A. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 30 years old, is married and has 2 children. Fahriddin is in business of purchasing and reselling building materials. He has a medium sized store on the Vahdat market. This business is the only source of income for his family. Right now is summer and people begin to do repair work in their homes. This is why Fahriddin would like to increase the variety of goods he has for sale and is in need of a loan. He plays to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Абдулхамедов Фахриддин житель города Вахдат . Возраст 30 лет , женат , имеет 2 детей. Образование средне-техническое. Фахриддин занимается куплей продажей строительных материалов. Он имеет небольшой магазин на рынке города Вахдат .Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Сейчас лето и люди начинают делать в своих домах ремонт. Поэтому клиент хочет увеличить ассортимент товара своей точки ,для чего ему нужны деньги. Поэтому он решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: Increase the variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S., 37, has a small store at the local market selling fish. She receives her product from her husband who is a fisherman. On average, she makes $2 each day. Sometimes her husband, Bai Chuon, catches fewer fish because he does not have enough fishing tools. To help with their business, Mrs. Chea would like to take out a loan to purchase more fishing tools for her husband to use. She thinks this investment will improve his catches and help to stabilize their income.

Mrs. Chea was not available when we visited. Her husband is pictured here working on some of the tools he uses to catch fish.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services throughout both rural and urban communities in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Bahrigul

texts.ru:
Bahrigul Kalandarova lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 26 years old, not married, and has a tech school education. She works as a dressmaker in studio #3 sewing folk style dresses to order. She cannot buy a cow from this income, and therefore wants to take out a loan to buy one. She plans on selling the cow’s milk to neighbors, which will be advantageous to her and her neighbors because her milk will sell for lower prices. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Каландарова Бахригуль жительница города Вахдат .Возраст 26 лет. Незамужем . Имеет средне – специальное образование. Работает портнихой в ателье №3 . Шьет национальные платья на заказ. На зарабатываемые деньги она не может приобрести корову , поэтому хочет получить кредит и купить дойную корову. Получаемое молоко будет продавать соседям. Это будет выгодно для нее и для соседей. Так как молоко будет продавать по более низким ценам. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Idrissou

texts.fr: M. Idrissou  est né le 10/04/1974 à Bafilo. Il est célibataire sans enfant. Dans le souci de s’affranchir des détaillants chez qui il s’approvisionne, il sollicite ce crédit pour devenir grossiste lui-même pour réduire ses dépenses et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Son crédit lui servira à passer de grosses commandes des produits divers. Il a une solide expérience en matière de commerce.
texts.en:
M. Idrissou was born on 10/04/1974 in Bafilo. He is single and has no children. Concerned about freeing himself from retailers from whom he gets supplies, he requests this loan so that he can himself become a wholesaler in order to reduce his expenses and increase his profit margin. He will use this loan to place large orders of various products. He has solid experience in trade matters.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various products

loans.name: Thouk's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thouk T., 37, decorates houses for wedding ceremonies. Her business depends on the wedding party. She earns around $3.00 per day, and cares for two children her the family home. Her husband, Mr. Sophara P., 42, is a policeman. Thouk requests a loan of $250 to purchase more decorative materials to use for her business so she can increase her income to meet her family's expenses.

Mrs. Thouk is a group leader, and her group includes two other members. They live in Ratanak Commune, Battembang Province. Mrs. Sreyaun P., 36, has houses for rent. She requests a loan of $300 to make repairs to her rental house to satisfy customers. Mrs. Hort K., 40, makes jars to sell. She requests a loan of $300 to purchase clay for making jars.

loans.use: Purchase more decorative materials for house decorations for wedding parties

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, Mme Afi N. est née en 1983 à Bégbé dans le Zio au sud du Togo. N’ayant reçu aucune formation, elle s’est également engagée dans l’agriculture à travers la culture du mais qu’elle produit et revend sur le marché. Cette activité lui permet de soutenir son mari financièrement. Le sol devenant de plus en plus pauvre, pour augmenter son rendement, elle sollicite un financement pour l’achat d’intrants notamment les engrais et les semences.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 4 children, Mrs. Afi N. was born in 1983 in Bégbé in the Zio area in the south of Togo. Having received no formal training, she farms maize which she sells in the marketplace. This work allows her to help her husband with family expenses. Her land becoming ever less fertile, however, she is requesting a loan to increase her harvest through inputs to her soil, notably fertilizer, and improved seed.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a single parent and has 5 dependents. She has received no formal education. Elizabeth sells a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey' which is made out of corn. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country. She also sells bowls and cosmetics at Yamoransa Junction near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1998. Elizabeth uses her income for the payment of school fees, utility bills and other family expenses.

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more maize as raw materials and firewood as fuel for cooking the Kenkey, and other things needed for the preparation of Kenkey. She also wants to invest in her business of selling bowls and cosmetics. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to increase the quality of education for her children.

loans.use: Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more maize and firewood

loans.name: Cony

texts.es: Cony, de 19 años de edad, soltera, vive junto a sus padres y 2 hermanas que la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en las afueras de su vivienda, desde hace 2 años atrás y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que muchas personas degustan de su buena sazón. Le es muy rentable porque su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una buena zona, muy transitada. Lo difícil es no contar con los implementos necesarios para su cocina. Es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar utensilios de cocina y desde luego implementarse con sillas  y mesas para acoger mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cony is 19 years old, single and lives with her parents and 2 sisters who are very supportive of her. For the past 2 years she has sold food in the area outside her house. What she likes about her work is that many people enjoy her good cooking. The business is profitable because it is in a good, high-traffic zone. What is difficult is that she does not have all the utensils she needs for her kitchen. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is a very punctual with her payments. With the money she requests she would like to buy kitchen utensils and of course to set up her business with chairs and tables for the comfort of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cooking utensils and furniture so she can better serve her customers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal  Perlas de Sabiduría 
Maria es casada tiene 36 años, dos hijos de 18 y 13 años ambos estudian 
Empezó hace cuatro años vendiendo truzas, medias, ahora vende cosméticos y en tiempo de colegio vende útiles para el colegio, venta choco-tejas
Desde que esta en Finca tiene mayor capital ayuda a su esposo con los gastos y a su hija con sus estudios.

Necesita un préstamo de 800 soles para invertirlos en la compra de ropa 
El sueño que tiene Maria es tener su tienda de ropa bien surtida y que sea propia.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Perlas de la Sabiduría” (Pearls of Wisdom) Communal Bank. Maria is 36 years old, married, and has two children ages 18 and 13 who are in school. Four years ago she began selling underwear and socks, today she sells cosmetics and when schools is in she sells school supplies and chocolates. Since she has been with Finca she has greater capital to help her husband with the expenses and her daughter with her studies. She needs a loan for 800 soles to invest in the purchase of clothing. Ana dreams of opening a well-stocked store of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el momento que se separó de su esposo y quedó sola al cuidado de su menor hija, fue que Elizabeth decidió empezar a trabajar por su cuenta. A raíz de las motivaciones de una amiga suya es que se anima a tener su propio negocio. Ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa según los pedidos que recibe de algunos clientes, quienes en su mayoría son personas que trabajan en un mercado.

Por otro lado, Elizabeth también maneja un negocio de repostería. Luego de haber estudiado repostería ella empezó a preparar algunos postres. Más adelante, su hijo empezó a ayudarla a vender los diversos productos que su mama cocinaba. Poco a poco ella ha ido creciendo en este rubro hasta que hoy en día, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo, ha podido comprar un hormo industrial para continuar cocinando y preparando mas postres.

Ella no es nada conformista, es por ello que junto con unas compañeras esta planeando abrir una pastelería-panadería. Además esta tomando curso de talleres de manualidades, lo que le ayudara en la realización de decorado y presentación de sus postres.
texts.en:
It was the moment that she got separated from her husband, and saw herself alone taking care of her young daughter when Elizabeth decided to start to work on her own. Motivated by one of her friends is that she decides to start her own business. She now sells clothes based on requests from some clients, who are mostly people that work in a market. On the other hand, Elizabeth also manages a bakery. After going to pastry school she started to make some desserts. Later on, her son started to help her sell the different products she prepared. Little by little she has grown this business until now, when thanks to her effort and work, she was able to purchase an industrial oven to keep baking and preparing more pastries. She doesn’t settle easily, reason why with her friends she is planning on opening a bakery and pastry store. In addition she is taking a course, which will help her do the decorating and presentation of the desserts.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing merchandise and ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade sells groceries and drugs in her shop. She learned the business in 3 years and she has been in the business for the past 10 years. Folashade is 39 years old and is married with 5 children. Folashade lives in Igbo-leren. Folashade needs a loan of N 50,000 ($350) to purchase more groceries and drugs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drugs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Bancomunal El Sembrador.
Victoria es conviviente, tiene tres hijos, todos mayores y están casados. 
Victoria es de profesión enfermera trabajo en diferentes  hospitales pero por motivos de resecion la despidieron y tuvo que optar por  trabajar independientemente.  Desde hace siete años empezó a dar desayuno  se levanta a las cinco de la mañana para prepara el desayuno.  
Desde que esta en Finca el negocio de victoria ha mejorado, ha podido comprar cosas como andamios, mesas para su negocio, para dar una mejor atención al publico.  
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para comprar víveres arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras,  para dar desayuno.
El sueño de Victoria es seguir triunfando en el negocio y dejar su negocio bien establecido para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of Village Bank El Sembrador. She and her live-in partner have three children, now adult and married. Victoria is a nurse by profession, and worked in many diffferent hospitals. She was laid off due to recession, however, and had to find work independently. Seven years ago she began selling breakfast, and gets up at 5 in the morning to begin preparation. Since joining the bank Victoria's business has improved, allowing her to buy items like shelves and tables for her business, in order to provide better service to her customers. Victoria requires a loan of 1600 soles in order to purchase supplies - rice, sugar, milk, and legumes - to prepare breakfasts. Victoria hopes to continue succeeding in order to leave a well established business to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing food for breakfast sales

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward Kwalazi is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur businessman. He runs a double business at Gongolamboto ward at Ukonga in Dar es Salaam. He runs a hardware shop from which he sells a variety of items. He purchases the items from Kariakoo city shopping center from wholesale shops and sells retail to customers. Also he receives orders from customers who want to buy wholesale. Also, he provides pick-up transport services at Gongo lamboto. He has been running the business for ten years. He needs a loan of 1,000,000 to boost the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.es: Nilsa tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas que cursan estudios técnicos. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, pero al mismo tiempo, se dedica  a la venta de comida por las noches. Su esposo es trabajador dependiente para una empresa de madera. Su motocarro ya tiene 3 años, y con este vehículo brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros por los distintos lugares de su ciudad, con un chofer que contrata para esa función. Nilsa se esfuerza cada día por darle a sus hijas lo que necesitan, es por eso que tiene dos actividades económicas, ambas indispensables para el sostenimiento de su hogar, en complemento con la remuneración de su esposo. Con MFP, tiene ya 3 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque son responsables y existe mucha coordinación entre sus compañeros. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un motor para su motocarro, que le costará 600 soles, con el resto invertirá en su negocio de comida, comprando víveres y lo necesario para la preparación de sus platos.
texts.en:
Nilsa is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and her two daugthers who are attending technical school. She owns a three-wheeler van but at the same time she sells food at night. Her husband works at a wood factory. Her three-wheeler van has three years. With this vehicle she provides transportation service to passengers who go to different places of the city, and she hires a driver for this task. Nilsa works harder every day to provbide her daughters with everything they need. For this reason, she has two jobs, both indispensible to support her home, together with her husband's salary. She has already requested for 3 other loans to MFP. She likes to work with her group because they are responsible and they are very well coordinated among their partners. She will use the money she's requesting for her van, which will cost 600 soles, and she will invest the rest in food for her business, supplies and the necessary to prepare her meals.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena L., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de un motor para su motocarro

loans.name: Maria Juris

texts.en:
Maria Juris G. owns a small sari-sari store business. She started her business using her small savings of Php 2,000. She is 28 years old and is married with one child. Her husband, Fernando G., is a construction worker. They work extremely hard to provide for all their needs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store. The loan will help Maria Juris attract more customers. In this way, she will be able to increase their income.

CEVI is not limited to offering loans to its clients. It also offers training sessions and insurance coverage to help clients grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es: El Señor José del Carmen M., vive en el barrio Jocote Dulce, en la capital de Managua casado su esposa trabaja como ejecutiva de venta tienen dos hijos ambos estudiando, su madre tiene la edad 62 años vive con ellos. sus planes es brindarle mayor comodidad y protección a su familia. Don José trabaja como operador de equipo de bombeo de agua tiene 18 años de experiencia en su ramo.Las dificultades que se le ha presentado para llevar a cabo sus planes y proyectos es la falta de mayores ingresos  y capacitación laboral.Con el préstamo que solicita en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción: cementos, hierros, perlines, zinc y ladrillos para construir un cuarto de habitación que se requiere para su madrecita señora  de una edad que se necesita cuidar y poder tenerla con mejores cuidados

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer cuarto

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Neema M. from Mbeya. She is married with 6 children, between the ages of 20 and 31. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependents because they are orphans. Neema has been running a business since 2009, making and selling baskets.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Neema currently earns about 60 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase basket material in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Neema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase basket material in bulk

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a 31-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has been working as a tailor since 2004 to cooperate with her husband to improve living conditions for her family. Today, Jennifer is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to purchase a new sewing machine to expand her work.

loans.use: purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Kaswa South Muyonje Florence Group

texts.en:
M. Florence is the group leader of the Kaswa South women's group. She is a married woman of 47 blessed with five children. Three of her children are going to school and two are married. She also looks after two dependents who are also schooling. 

She has been in the poultry business for more than 12 years. She is using the loan for purchasing chicks, chicken feed and drugs for healthy poultry, which can easily attract customers. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: Purchasing chicks, chicken feed and drugs for healthy poultry, which can easily attract the customers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.
Maria es separada, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante llamado Estrella del Mar, en un local alquilado que se encuentra cerca del Mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus 2 hijos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, carne y comprar mas muebles.
Los sueños de Maria son mejorar su negocio y apoyar en los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank, "Glorioso." She is separated, is 44, and has 2 children. She has a restaurant called "Estrella del Mar" in a rented location near the Magdalena market. She works here every day with the help of her two children. Maria needs a loan of 1050 PEN that she will invest in the purchase of rice, meat, and more furniture. Her dreams are to improve her business and to support her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, meat, and more furniture

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is forty-six years old. He is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters, who are all still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for his family. John lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. He is a school proprietor. He has from nursery to the kindergarten levels. John has been in business for barely a year now. He says he has female teachers who look after the children. John wants a loan to buy equipment like furniture and teaching and learning aids, etc. He is hopeful to develop the school to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy academic equipment

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad has been working as a carpenter for nine years. He is a 44 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Mohamad does good work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He didn’t face difficulties when he first started his business. Mohamad decided on this work to use his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding.

Mohamad requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Catalina es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Catalina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, además Catalina brinda el servicio de bordado y tejido de carteras, correas, también teje chompas a pedido.
Catalina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Catalina son mejorar su negocio y construir su casa.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz y azúcar.

loans.name: Los  Leñadores Group

texts.es:
En grupo los leñadores está integrado por Juana L. de 64 años, ella tiene 30 años vendiendo frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya, con el cual ha logrado superarse. 

Las otras integrantes son Hortensia S. quien vende cosméticos y perfumes y  Jenny C. E. que comercializa productos de la Avon. Todas ellas desean ampliar sus negocios e invertirán el crédito para lograr este objetivo.

loans.use: para comprar yaca, ayote, chilote, naranja, limon, pitaya....etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been selling poultry on a small scale to residents of Naivasha town. She is married to Elijah Njuguna and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by her friend and this will be her first loan.  With the loan, Elizabeth plans to buy more chickens, which will be ready to sell during the approaching festive season.

One day, she hopes to go into real estate and build a house for rentals on the piece of land she owns to diversify her income.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell during the festive season

loans.name: Sari

texts.en: Mrs. Sari P. is a villager in Krang Touch village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a pig breeder. Since her breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing eight more piglets and pig food. Her husband, Mr. Suon Chok, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sari P. has three children who all are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy eight more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Tserendorj

texts.en:
Tserendorj B. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in Uvs province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His 9- and 11-year-old sons go to a local school and the youngest 1-year-old stays home. Tserendorj has a small retail business with his wife. Tserendorj was a salesman in a flour-selling shop and in 2007, he decided to launch his own retail business in flour and related products. He rents a large container at the local food market, from which he retails bags of flour for locals. He mostly purchases flour from wholesalers and sell it to locals in a small bag. With the business profit, he was able to purchase an old car for his family and his family business. His family is the only source of income for his family. He says that since launching his own business, his family income has improved tremendously and he would like to expand his business as much as he and his wife can. He requests a loan to purchase more inventory bags of flour for his business.

About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

loans.use: To purchase more bags

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Marcos tiene 27 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” de la Asociación Arariwa. El tiene tres hijos y son: dos mujeres y un varón.        
 
El es técnico de automotriz y tiene su propio taller de refacción de carros. Ya son dos años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Todos los días repara y hace mantenimiento a carros malogrados, ya tiene sus clientes fijos que son muy responsables y confían en sus trabajo. Nuestro socio es un joven trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más pintura y masilla para refaccionar carros.      
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Marcos is 27 years old, lives with his partner, is originally from the city of Cuzco, and belongs to the Patron Saint of Santiago Community Bank of the Arariwa Association. He has three children: two girls and a boy.

He is an auto mechanic and has his own car repair garage. He has had his busisness for two years and it has gone very well for him, thanks to all of his hard work. Every day he does car repair and mainenance. He has regular customers who are very reliable and trust his work. Our member is a hardworking and ambitious young man who supports his family. The member requires a loan to buy more paint and putty to repair cars.

The member is thankful for this opportunity given him and he promises to complete the payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint and putty for cars

loans.name: Maria Sagrario

texts.es: La señora Maria Sagrario tiene la edad de 31 años, es madre soltera y lucha con su hijo de 14 años por sacarlo adelante. La actividad económica de Doña Maria es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que necesitaba ganar los ingresos necesarios para la sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Los propósitos de ella  son de mantener su negocio activo para seguir ayudando a su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo y así poder comprar ropa para niños, damas y caballeros, además algunos electrodomesticos, cremas, perfumes, pinturas de labios y pinturas de uñas. Ella sueña con  poseer un negocio estable para que el día de mañana sus hijos puedan administrarlo.
texts.en:
Maria Sagrario is 31 years old, she is a single mother who struggles to get herself and her 14 year-old son ahead. She has a business selling general merchandise. She has had this business for more than 4 years, as she has needed to earn extra income to cover the household expenses. She intends to keep the business active so that she can continue to help her family. This loan that she requests is for working capital, so that she can buy clothing for children, men and women, and also some household appliances, creams, perfumes, lipstick and nail polish. Her dream is to have a stable business that her children can run in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital (to purchase clothing, cosmetics and household appliances)

loans.name: Samreth

texts.en:
Samreth N. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three of her children in Takeo province. Three of her children are in school.

To earn a living, Samreth N. has raised pigs and has also sold chicken manure to local farmers since 2001. On average, she is able to make about US$5 of profit every day. Her husband is a businessman providing services trucking dirt to refill the land of clients’ houses. He typically makes about US$3 each day.

Samreth N. is asking for a loan of US$500 to reinvest in her chicken manure business.

loans.use: To reinvest in her chicken manure business

loans.name: Susana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Susana del Carmen P.es casada, tiene dos hijos los cuales son menores de edad, estos están cursando la educación primaria y secundaria, su marido trabaja en una fábrica donde se elaboran tapones, ella se dedica a la venta de Gaseosas, Pan y refrescos naturales, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en la estación de terminal de buses de esta ciudad, tiene 16 años de tener el negocio, y es del negocio y de los ingresos del marido que mantienen a su familia, con la institución trabaja desde el año 2007, en este periodo se le han entregado al cantidad de diez créditos, con los cuales ha trabajado muy responsablemente.
texts.en:
Susana del Carmen P.is married and has two children. They are minors, and they attend elementary school and high school. Her husband works in a factory where they make corks. She sells soft drinks, bread, and natural drinks. Her business is located in the city’s bus terminal. She has had the business for 16 years. The business and her husband’s income support their family. She has worked with the institution since 2007. During this period they have given her ten loans, and she has worked with them very responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business (Soft drinks, bread, and fruit to make her natural drinks)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking up enough oil to make soap

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda V., 52, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. Married to Norberto V., she is blessed with six children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. Both of them have managed their bakery for twelve years.

Minda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than four years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently.
