Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow eight times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy key ingredients for making bread. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 9,000 per month.

Now, with your help, Minda would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying flour and other key ingredients for making bread.

Minda dreams that their business will grow so that they can open another bakery store in their province.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy flour and other key ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en: Otgontsetseg is 52 years old and lives with her sibling and sibling's child in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Otgontsetseg's sibling works as a security guard at a private company and her sibling's child is a secondary school student. Otgontsetseg presently operates a handicraft and knitting business in her town. Other than knitted crafts, she makes a variety of products using decorative beads. Otgontsetseg has operated her business since 2008 and has made quick progress. She is a very forward thinking and creative woman. She is a graduate of the College of Finance and Economics and had a long career as an accountant with a telecommunication company. She started her handicrafts business when her job was cut by the company. In 2009, Otgontsetseg established a non-governmental organization called Anirguin Chimee. Its members consist of other handicraft makers. Otgontsetseg hopes to broaden her organization's activities, organize training for disabled people and create a workplace for them in the future. Otgontsetseg is a very hardworking person, and says, “I would like to purchase my own counter at which to sell my products.” She is requesting a 400,000-tugrug loan to increase her working capital and purchase necessary materials such as thread and beads for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as thread and beads for her business

loans.name: Welsa

texts.en:
Welsa G. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 60 years old. Welsa is married and has adult children. To make a living, Welsa owns & operates a business selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Welsa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Welsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Welsa is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Welsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Mrs. Moeun V., 49, is a snack seller. She sells snack food to people who are her nearby villagers, in the province of Siem Reap. She has been engaged in her business since 2009. She is married and lives with her husband and six children, while another one of her daughters is now married and works as a farmer. In addition to her current business, her husband farms crops, which he will sell when they are mature. Mrs. Moeun V. will be using her first loan to increase the financial capital of her business. She will use any remaining money from the loan to plant crops.

loans.use: To increase the financial capital of her business and to help her farm

loans.name: Galabou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Galabou est composé de neuf femmes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent  toutes  à Sakoïbougouni, village de la Commune Rurale de Sakoïba (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Les membres du groupe font le commerce  de vermicelle, de céréales, de calebasses, du bois de chauffe et de l’embouche ovine. 
Le besoin d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les motiva à s’organiser et à intégrer le programme  avec qui elles sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire. 
Madame Menta Traoré, un membre du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de farine de blé qu’elle transformera à l’aide d’une machine manuelle en vermicelle à vendre. 
Elle s’approvisionne à  Ségou sur place auprès des  commerçants grossistes. 
Pour faire du vermicelle elle pétrit une quantité suffisante avec de l’eau propre jusqu’à obtenir une pâte homogène et fine qu’elle fait passer à la machine puis la fait sécher.  
Elle revend son vermicelle à domicile, en ambulant à travers les villages voisins. La vente se fait au comptant et à  crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Menta compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 19.500FCFA à l’image des autres femmes qui sera utilisé pour, contribuer à certaines dépenses familiales et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The group Galabou is composed of nine married women in large traditional families.  The women average 37 years of age and four children all living in Sakoïbougouni, a village of the rural community of Sakoïba (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do commerce in vermicelli, grains, calabashes, and firewood, and they raise sheep. Needing to increase their working capital, the group members were motivated to become organized and to join the program. They are now on their third solidarity loan.  Ms. Menta Traoré, a member of the group, plans on using her loan for buying two sacks of wheat flour that she will process into vermacelli by using a manual machine.  She gets her supplies in Ségou locally from wholesale merchants.  To make vermicelli, she kneads a large enough amount with clean water to make a nice uniform dough, which she puts through the machine and then dries. She sells her vermicelli out of her home and door-to-door in neighboring villages.  Accepting cash and credit, she sells to a customer base composed of women and men.  Menta plans on making a monthly profit of 19,500 francs CFA, like the other women. The profit will be for helping to cover certain family expenses and increasing her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wheat flour

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia D. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old. Clemencia is married and has 3 school-aged children. Clemencia owns & operates a store selling daily use products such as can goods, sugar, noodles, food for snacks, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Clemencia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2007, Clemencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Clemencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Clemencia is now requesting her fourth loan, for 60,00 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Santina

texts.en:
Santina S. is currently in the business of selling dresses and bedsheets at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets to sell. Santina is 38 years old and is married with a husband who is a head teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy sewing machines.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Dembe Mixed Group, Mityana

texts.en:
N. Sylivia is not part of the group photo but her small photo appears in the top left corner of the main picture and she is the person that was interviewed.

N. Sylivia, a 35-year-old happily married mother of three, has been plying her retail shop business for the last four years in Wabigalo, Mityana. In a cutthroat competitive business like retail, one needs to conjure up ways and means and also one needs to strike a profound first impression with customers to get a niche in the market. Sylvia has used her good customer care skills as her business stock-in-trade.

Long before Sylivia drew up plans of establishing this business, she was more inclined to a commercial agricultural business. In the course of time, she wanted to emulate the successful businesswomen her village had produced. After second thought, she embarked on her business four years ago with a sense of determination that is essential at the threshold of any business.

In a month, Sylvia reckons she makes profits that total up to 350,000 shillings. Her husband, too, has been part of her success story as he is invariably at her beck and call in her operations. Sylvia also supplements her retail profits with the earnings from her agricultural business, which was originally her first business.

With this loan, Sylivia is intent on purchasing in bulk more retail items like beans, rice, sugar and soap which she will later resell.

loans.use: To purchase more retail goods like sugar, soap, rice, etc.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha G. is a 41-year-old married woman from Binangonan in the province of Rizal. She is blessed to have three children. All of her children are minors and need her support. She is a member of the Tayuman center of Rizal South West Branch. Editha is a very strong-minded woman, and she notes that she works hard to make their life quite meaningful. Despite challenges brought about by poverty, Editha is still strong and dedicated in her pursuit to improve her family’s standard of living. Editha’s main goal is to offer her three children a brighter future and this is what motivates her all day. 

To make a good living, she buys and sells RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes) and embarked on a rice-retailing venture for added income. She has been engaged in these businesses for 11 years. She joined ASHI, a first Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 1999. During the course of her new loan, this time in the amount of 23,000 PHP, to obtain additional stock for her RTW and inventory of rice, she is positive that, with access to additional working capital through Kiva partners, her dreams of building her own comfortable house will be achieved.

Editha hopes that one day she will be able to have her own produce stall in the market place, instead of just in her house where she sells RTW products and rice. She wishes to be able to make enough savings to pay for her children's education and dreams of the best of life for her family who lives together.

loans.use: To obtain additional stock of her RTW and to purchase inventory of rice.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y su hija en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 2 años brinda el servicio de transporte y su herramienta principal es el propio carro que han adquirido y ahora  el servicio que  brinda va por diferentes puntos de la ciudad. Es por esta razón que han contratado a un chofer, para que pueda trabajar todo el día, mientras que  Martha y su esposo trabajan como docentes en un centro educativo. Cada día el trabajo les genera la renta que necesita para la economía de su hogar, además eso le ayuda a pagar las letras de crédito que aún faltan para cancelar el carro que posee. Manifiesta que se siente muy satisfecha de tener los ingresos porque  le permite disponer para muchos gastos  que se requiere en su hogar. En adelante desea adquirir un carro más para que siga trabajando de esta modalidad. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el pago del mantenimiento mecánico y en la compra de repuestos de su carro.
texts.en:
Martha is 35 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a rented house. For the last 2 years she has been in transport services and her principal tool is a car which she has acquired. She offers service to different points in the city. Recently Martha has hired a driver to work all day, so that she and her husband can serve as teachers in an educational center. Each day the work earns them the money they need for their household economy. It also heps them to pay off what they still owe on the car. Martha feels very satisfied to have her taxi income because it permits her to cover many household expenses. In the future, she would like to acquire another car and to continue to work in the same manner. This is Martha's 1st loan with MFP. She is very content to know that she has financial help and appreciates being part of her communal group, because all the members are responsible people who offer solidarity. Martha is grateful to those who supported her loan, which will be very useful in the progress of her business. She will invest her loan in maintenance and replacement parts for her car.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO OBTAIN SPARE PARTS AND MECHANICAL MAINTENANCE FOR HER TAXI

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
el señor Florentino O. tiene 35 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Reina Marina Reyes.
juntos los dos se dedican a vender pescado y chatarra en un carro de su propiedad.
desde hace 7 años realizan este tipo de actividad con la cual estan sacando adelante la familia. la chatarra  la vende en Jicaro Galan lugar donde se la compran para reciclarla en El Salvador y luego extraer hierro, lamina, y otros metales.
El pescado lo sale a vender en los barrios y colonias de san lorenzo.
 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar chatarra para vender un poco mas ya que para este negocio se requiere de capital para comprar a los recolectores la chatarra diariamente y comprar mas pescado para no tener que viajar tan seguido a la playa.
texts.en:
Florentino O. is 35 years old and is married to Reina Marina Reyes. Together they sell fish and scrap metal out of their car. They have been doing this for seven years and they have been able to move their family ahead. They sell the scrap metal in “Jicaro Galan,” a place from where it it taken to El Salvador for recycling and where the iron, steel, and other metals are extracted. They sell the fish around various neighborhoods and sections of San Lorenzo. They will use the money from this loan to buy more scrap metal in order to have more to resell. His business needs working capital to be able to buy it from the collectors. He also wants to buy more fish so that he does not have to travel to the beach as often.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Scrap metal and fish

loans.name: Naranhuu

texts.en:
Naranhuu J. is 46 years old and lives with her husband in Tuv province, central Mongolia. The couple live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband works at a pawnshop as a guard and his monthly salary is 150,000 MNT.

Naranhuu operates a business selling secondhand consumer goods at a local market in the city. She began her business in 2007 and rents a working place in front of the market where she sells her products. She has previous business experience related to this trade.

Naranhuu is a very modest and gentle woman who says "I want to expand my business so that I can afford to take care of my own and my husband's health." She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase products at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase products at wholesale prices

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia O. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old and is married with three adult children. Delia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Delia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Diamantina

texts.es: La señora Diamantina es es una persona muy trabajadora, quedo viuda desde hace varios años, ella tiene tres hijos mayores los cuales ya están casados por eso vive sola, la señora Diamantina necesita de este crédito para la compostura del techo de su casa, ya que esta muy dañado por  las lluvias.
texts.en:
Diamantina is a very hard working person. She was widowed several years ago and has three adult children who are married. She lives alone. Diamantina needs this loan to repair the roof on her house because the rains have damaged it a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For roof repair.

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en: Varditer D. is married and has two children in school. She has been in the trading business since 2000. She sells women’s clothing and underwear from a rented trading booth at Malatia market. Although Varditer’s husband works hard, the family's main income comes from Varditer’s business. Varditer has applied for the loan to purchase new inventory.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

For over nine years, she has operated a retail shop and coconut sale business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, coconut supplies are scarce at the market. She hopes to start another business selling goat meat in the future.

She decided to join Yehu because it empowers small entrepreneurs through enhanced accessibility to sustainable financial services. With the loan of Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cooking oil, maize flour and coconut oil for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, maize flour and coconut oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more charcoal and water for resale

loans.name: Lelith

texts.en:
Lielith Bandivas owns a small (1-hectare / 2.5-acre) rice field. She tills the land and shares her harvest with her two sons. Most of the products of her farm are used for family consumption. The rest are sold to rice traders. In addition to a rice farm, she also wants to explore other income areas.

Funding from CEVI will help her to buy fertilizers and seeds. It will also help her to expand her business. She chose CEVI as her MFI because it has a micro-insurance coverage program for all its clients.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nyirahabimana

texts.fr: Nyirahabimana Goreth est notre client depuis l’an 2009 elle a deux enfants entre 3 et 4 ans, son niveau d’etude est primaire. Elle a 36 ans , le prêt qu’elle sollicite est pour acheter 15 sacs de pommes de terre car elle fait ce type de commerce a nyabugogo et elle a un depot.son ambitio est de creer la confiance avec la bank en payant a temps et resolliciter ’autres credits  pour augmenter sa capital.
texts.en: Nyirahabimana Goreth has been our client since 2009. She has two children, 3 and 4 years old. She has finished primary school. She is 36 years loan. The loan she is seeking is for purchasing 15 bags of potatoes, for this is what she sells in Nyabugogo. She has a warehouse. Her goal is to build a relationship with the bank paying her loans on time and continue taking out loans in order to increase her capital.

loans.use: Purchasing 15 bags of potatoes for retail

loans.name: María

texts.es: María de 42 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 2 pequeños hijos; sola ha tenido que sacar adelante a sus hijos; es por esta razón que tiene muchas ganas de progresar. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica, desde hace 15 años, a la fabricación de toda clase de bijouteria, elaborada a base de diversas semillas de la sierra y selva de su país. Le gusta mucho su labor pues mientras trabaja puede educar a sus hijos sin problemas; cuando deja a su pequeño en el colegio inicial regresa a su casa a empezar a trabajar y así continua todo el día, de lunes a sábado. Además como su producción de aretes, collares y pulseras se exporta a otro país, también les ha brindado trabajo a algunas amigas de la zona donde vive, y les entrega de a pocos las semillas que compra para que acaben con  los grandes pedidos que tiene a tiempo. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un restaurante de comidas típicas, pero sabe que con mucho esfuerzo lo logrará. Es el 13avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues como es un cliente antiguo no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de semillas, para concretar un pedido que tiene pendiente, de esta manera espera continuar adelante para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and lives in her own house beside her 2 small children. She has had to advance her children alone; that's why she has much desire to progress. This enterprising woman has been dedicated for some 15 years to making all kinds of trinkets, using diverse types of seeds from the mountains and jungles of her country.

She enjoys the work, since while working, she can educate her children without problems. After dropping off her youngest at school, she returns home and begins to work, and so it is from Monday until Saturday. In addition to making earrings, necklaces, and bracelets, which are exported to other countries, she has provided work for some of her friends in the zone where she lives. They bring her the seeds that she needs in order to fulfill her large orders on time. Since she is an enterprising woman, her future plans include installation of a restaurant serving typical local foods. And she knows that with much effort, it will be achieved. 

This is her 13th loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually. Since she is an frequent client, she does not wish to create a bad impression on the people who made possible this opportunity to continue working in quest of progress.

Maria plans to invest the solicited loan in buying a quantity of seeds to fulfill an order she has pending. In this manner, she hopes to forge ahead, complying with her goals.

loans.use: TO BUY SEEDS FOR MAKING EARRINGS, NECKLACES AND BRACELETS TO SELL

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Ou S. has been in the farming business since she was a single woman. Presently, she and her family live together in a small house in Kompong Tom province. She and her husband have been the local farmers since 1980. This couple has given birth to three children: two of the children are married and one is single. 

Ou S. and her husband grow rice and peanuts on their own farmland. They always get a great result from their planting. This is the second step for this couple to plant peanuts, but they don’t have enough money to support their farming yet. So Ou S. is seeking a loan to purchase a pumping machine and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase a pumping machine and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, vive con sus dos hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad, es madre soltera, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos negocio que inicio con ayuda de su madre, no tiene un horario definido, y esta es la actividad económica que provee para ella y sus hijos, la edad de María es de 34 años de edad.
En la actualidad necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, comprando cerdos para engordarlos y destazarlos para comercializar su carne, con esta ayuda estará aumentando su número de cerdos en la granja y tener siempre a disposición para destazar y realizar las ventas.
Sueña en convertirse en una gran comerciante y estabilizar sus ingresos económicos para ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios y brindarle lo mejor.
texts.en:
María lives in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel department, with her two children who are 11 and 7 years of age.  She is a single mother who works raising pigs, a business she started with her mother’s help.  She does not have a set schedule.  This economic activity provides for her and her children.  María is 34 years old.

She needs a loan currently to invest in the business buying pigs to fatten up and butcher to sell the meat.  With this help she is increasing the number of pigs in her farm so that she always has them available to butcher for sale.

She dreams with becoming a great merchant and stabilize her income to help her children with their studies and provide them with the best.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Saribel

texts.es:
Saribel  de 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo en comarca Ceiba en Nueva Guinea, el trabaja como agricultor, explotando el terrenos con cultivos de reices y tuberculos, los cuales son comercializados; ayudando de esta manera con los gastos basicos del hogars, Saribel se desempeña  como docente de primaria en la Escuela Alfonso cortes desde hace 11 años, es una mujer dedicada y responsable, bien querida pos sus vecinos, compañeros de trabajos y alumnos, ha venido mejorando sus condiciones de vida con credito y esfuerzos propios.  

Espera ser beneficiada nuevamente con Kiva en este credito donde pretende continar con las mejoras de su casa, realizando anexos de techo de su casa.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral y que su familia no le falte lo basico en el hogar .
texts.en:
Saribel, 36, lives with her husband in Nueva Guinea’s Ceiba settlement.  He works as a Farmer growing roots and tubers to sell helping thus to meet basic household expenses.  Saribel has been working as an Elementary School Teacher at Alfonso Cortes School for the last 11 years.  She is a dedicated, responsible woman who is well liked by her neighbors, coworkers and students.  She’s been improving her living conditions with loans and through her own efforts.

She hopes to be a Kiva recipient again and use this loan to continue with home improvements, adding additional roofing to the house.

Her greatest dream in life is to have job stability and that her family has all the basics at home.

loans.use: To repair her roof.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: El señor Eleuterio se dedica a la cría de ganado lechero  y es productor lechero; el crédito lo utilizará para la compra de una vaca lechera de buena calidad para mejorar su volumen de producción de leche; también es albañil constructor y su esposa le ayuda con las actividades agrícolas, tienen cinco  hijos   y estas actividades son la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir gastos de su familia. Vive  en casa  propia ubicada en la Localidad de Akerana en la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz. Es la primera vez que obtiene un préstamo en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Eleuterio's business is raising dairy cows.  He is a milk producer.  He will use his loan to buy a good-quality dairy cow to improve the volume of milk he produces.

Eleuterio is also a builder and his wife helps him with his farm work.  They have five children and these business activities are their source of income which they use to cover their family expenses.

Eleuterio lives in his own home which is located in the town of Akerana, in Omasuyos province, in La Paz department.  This is the first time that he has had a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production and improve his income

loans.name: Samen

texts.en: Samen is a married woman who has a two-year-old child. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land where she grows rice. She sells part of the rice crop and the family uses some of it. Her husband, Ran, is a firewood seller and a farm laborer. Though this couple tries to work a lot, they can earn only a little income. So to improve this condition, Samen is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, de 33 años; es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de sus padres: Dionisio y Justina, a los que cuida y apoya en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Su principal sustento económico se centra, en la siembra de arveja y papa en gran cantidad. Ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es lanzar semillas sobre la tierra. En todo este tiempo de trabajo incansable; pudo comprar sus terrenos propios y muy bien ubicados, pues están al alcance del río, logrando que Jesús pueda regarlos constantemente. Como sus cultivos maduran con mayor rapidez, contrata peones ocasionalmente para que le ayuden en el mantenimiento y cosecha de sus productos. El mayor problema que afronta, es la falta de capital de trabajo, pues hace un año fracasó en su cosecha, ya que salió a destiempo. Ahora está pensando ahorrar para poder incrementar su producción de tal manera que pueda comercializarlo en la capital del país. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por la oportunidad que le dan en la renovación del trabajo realizado en su asociación. Jesús, tiene sembrado gran cantidad de papa y arveja, por ello con el crédito comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico los cuales esparcirá entre sus sembríos.
texts.en: Jesús is 33 years old, hard-working and single. He lives with his parents, Dionisio and Justina, whom he cares for and supports, in his own home located in the hamlet of Bellavista Huaracayo. He has made a living planting peas and potatoes in large quantities for the past 10 years, and what he likes most about his job is tossing the seeds on the land. In all this time of tireless work he was able to purchase his own lands that are very well located within reach of the river, allowing Jesús to constantly bring in water. As his crops mature faster, he occasionally hires laborers to help him care for and harvest his products. The biggest problem he faces is the lack of working capital, since a year ago his crops failed, which came at a bad time. Now he's planning on saving so he can increase his production in such a way that he can sell his products in the country's capital. He belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” community bank, and this is his second loan with Kiva partner MFP. He feels grateful for the opportunity to revitalize his work. Jesús is planting large quantities of potatoes and peas, and with the loan he plans to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer to spread throughout his fields.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Hector Arely

texts.es:
Don Héctor, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de jarcia (lazos, pitas) tiene 55 años de edad, vive con esposa y una hija, tienen casa propia y él atiende el negocio de jarcia, cultivo de maíz y crianza de ganado.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en preparar el terreno para la siembra de maíz, con este dinero comprara tratamiento para la tierra, fertilizantes y abonos, además que si alcanza comprara unos terneros para aumentar su ganado.
El tiene como objetivo trabajar por mejoras el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor lives in El Transito, in San Miguel department.  He is 55 years old and lives with his wife and daughter.  They own their own home and Héctor works selling rope, growing corn and raising livestock.

Héctor is currently requesting a loan to invest in preparing his land for sowing corn.  He will use this money to buy treatments for his land: fertilizers and manure.  If the money stretches far enough, he will also buy some calves to increase his herd.

Héctor's goal is to work in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Darlene

texts.en:
Darlene L. makes an all-purpose luggage case for students and professionals needing durable, practical, yet attractive bags. What differentiates Darlene’s bag from others is its design. Divided into compartments that are stacked like shelves, it is ideal for storing books, electronics, clothes and more. Set on wheels, the bag is easy to transport.

The idea of creating an ultra-efficient luggage case came to Darlene when her daughter, a sophomore in college, complained of not having an efficient bag for carrying her belongings around campus. Soon after, Darlene came up with the bag’s initial design as she was driving back from a conference in Mississippi. Now, nearly a year later, Darlene has a provisional patent and a prototype (see picture) that she is in the process of refining.

Darlene has hired a product design firm to help her finalize the bag’s layout and composition materials. A manufacturing company will make the bag, which she hopes will begin final production within the next three to six months. This loan helps Darlene finish refining the bag’s design and allows her to manufacture samples that can be physically tested. The loan also provides her with the capital to manufacture a very small initial batch of the final product.

Darlene is originally from New Orleans’ Lower 9th Ward. She works nights as a bridge operator, which she likes because it frees her to work with her manufacturer and design consultant during business hours. Previously, she worked at a community health clinic for the city of New Orleans, but the clinic closed after Hurricane Katrina. She is a published author, having written <u>Spend Your Last Dollar: God’s Plan of Salvation</u>, a book that draws lessons from the Bible and applies them to everyday life. Darlene is married with three grown children.

loans.use: to pay for designing and manufacturing luggage cases.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer  de 35 años de edad. Tiene tres hijos a su cargo uno de 18, otro de 12 y el último de 8 años de edad.  Esta familia vive  en la provincia de Chiclayo- Lambayeque.

El esposo de Maritza  se encuentra lejos de casa, debido a su trabajo en el rubro de construcción civil que desempeña en el departamento de Cuzco. Sin embargo, éste le manda semanalmente una pequeña suma de dinero para sus gastos. 

Maritza cuenta con una mototaxi, la mototaxi es un servicio de transporte público muy común en el Perú, sobretodo en las pequeñas comunidades, consta de una moto con una cabina en la parte trasera  donde se pueden transportar pasajeros. Esta mototaxi es utilizada por el hijo mayor de Maritza, que trabaja para ayudar a su madre con los gastos de la educación de sus pequeños hermanos.

Maritza solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles que los destinará al mantenimiento de la unidad vehicular de su hijo y para mejoras en su hogar, específicamente el arreglo de su piso.
texts.en:
Maritza is a 35 year-old woman.  She has three children in her care: one is 18, one is 12 and the youngest is 8.  The family lives in Chiclayo - Lambayeque province.

Maritza's husband is away from home owing to his work in the civil engineering trade which he carries out in Cusco department.  However, he sends home a small sum of money each week to cover their expenses.

Maritza owns a motorcycle taxi.  Motorcycle taxis are a very common means of public transport in Peru, particularly in small communities.  They consist of a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers.  This motorcycle taxi is used by Maritza's eldest son who works to help his mother with his younger siblings' education expenses.

Maritza is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to have some maintenance work done on her son's vehicle and also to have some improvements carried out at home, specifically fixing her floor.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on her vehicle and to lay flooring in her home

loans.name: Carlos Gualberto

texts.es:
Carlos Gualberto tiene 36 años, es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería tiene solar, siembra papas, maíz, arveja en terrenos arrendados tiene 5 borregos y 4 cerdos . Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar el negocio.

Le gusta  festejar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Carlos Gualberto is 36 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the Cantón  Guaranda Bolivar Province.  He has 5 children.

The members of the  V.R.C. Pucara Group are located in the neighborhood of Pucara Parroquia Guanujo at a distance of 15 minutes from the office of the cooperative.  This group is comprised of 22 partners engaged in agriculture, livestock sales and marketing of vegetables.

Carlos works in agriculture and livestock.  He has a plot of leased land where he plants potatoes, corn, and peas.  He also has 5 sheep and 4 pigs. He purchases his goods ​​in the Guaranda market and sells in the wholesale market in the same city.

Carlos is requesting a loan to purchase supplies and animal feed.  This support would help financially meet their needs.  He faces challenges such as pests and diseases and the variety of weather. His dream is to improve the business.  He also likes to celebrate the festivities of carnival.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Elisabet

texts.es: Elisabet tiene 24 años vive en la ciudad de Huancayo donde esta radicando desde hace 10 años, vive al lado de su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Desde hace 1 año decidió que la mejor opción para generarse un ingreso es a través de su propio negocio de ferretería en un local arrendado donde también vive y junto a su esposo atienden a su público consumidor. Su esposo consigue el abastecimiento de nueva mercadería a fin de que haya rotación constante de su capital de trabajo, actualmente los precios de los diversos productos que vende son estables. En este corto tiempo su negocio ha estado incrementando sus ventas por lo que ha decidido incursionar en la venta de agregados, es decir arena y piedras de río que es indispensable para la construcción de casas. Por medio de una invitación personal decido solicitar un crédito y solucionar sus problemas de liquidez ya que su negocio requiere constantemente de una cantidad de dinero  que le permita renovar la mercadería que tiene para mejorarla. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP y se siente más tranquila de haber encontrado lo que ella considera, una fuente de financiamiento confiable y un aliado para lograr sus objetivos financieros, Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que se concrete sus planes. En esta ocasión podrá comprar al por mayor baldes de pintura y mas arena al por mayor.
texts.en:
Elisabet, 24, has lived in Huancayo for the past 10 years with her husband and little son.  A year ago she decided that her best option for earning an income was to have her own hardware business in a rented stall where she also lives, and together with her husband, they deal with the customers.  Her husband gets supplies of new merchandise since there is always a rotation of working capital.  Now prices of many of the products that they sell are stable.  In the short time that they have had their business sales have been increasing with the new products that they have decided to sell, like sand, and river stones that are necessary for house contstruction.  A personal invitation was extended to them to request financing and help with their cash problems since their business always requires an amount of money to replenish their merchandise and improve it.  This is the first loan with MFP and she feels more relaxed to have found a source of trustworthy financing and assistance to succeed with her financial goals.  That is why Elisabet is hoping that each one of you will help her with her plans.  
 She will use this money to buy more buckets of paint and sand wholesale.

loans.use: To buy sand and buckets of paint

loans.name: Ronafe

texts.en:
Ronafe is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Ronafe has a retail shop that sells biscuits, breads and canned goods. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy snacks, noodles, detergents and biscuits. Ronafe is a new member of HSPFI.  

In the future, Ronafe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, noodles, detergents and biscuits

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a hardworking 33 year-old man with three children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has dreams of constructing rental houses on the plot of land he acquired two years ago and buying more land. Innocent rides a motorcycle for a living and has been in service for eight years now despite challenges of the increasing price of fuel and mechanical breakdowns. His desire is to own at least three motorcycles and buy land in the outskirts of town for farming.
Innocent intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: To purchase land for farming.

loans.name: Raziyya

texts.en: Raziyya is only 24, but she is already a very experienced young entrepreneur. She is not married, and she lives with her parents. The knowledge acquired from her parents and grandparents has contributed to Raziyya's work raising cattle in a special space in her home. Raziyya's work in animal sales generates a good income for her family. Currently, she has two cows in her house. She would like to increase little by little the variety of her animals and is seeking a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 31 years old, married, and they have three children between ten and two years of age. He runs a retail shop business at a local market in Kakamega. He has been in this business for two years now. He says the business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is financial constraints.

Patrick plans to use this loan to purchase flour, rice, sugar, detergents and beverages to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business to a wholesale trade. He also has hopes of buying a plot of land in which he will put up rental houses. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase flour, rice, sugar, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Flordelyn

texts.en:
Flordelyn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Flordelyn has a retail shop that sells dried fish. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more dried fish to sell.

Flordelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Flordelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 31 años, es una mujer muy feliz; pues vive junto a su esposo Freddy con quien tiene 2 hijos: Brayan y Cielo, en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Cachunayo. Desde sus cortos 18 años comenzó en el noble oficio de la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de alverjas, maíz y demás hortalizas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el apoyo que recibe de su esposo, pues le ayuda en los constantes cuidados que le brinda a sus sembríos. Además de tener los terrenos cerca al río lo cual le beneficia en el crecimiento inmediato de sus cultivos. “Ahora estoy en la cosecha de alverja, donde obtendré buenas ganancias”, afirma. Su principal problema son los gastos de los estudios de su hijo mayor, pues comenzó a estudiar y ahora minimiza los gastos de mantenimiento de sus cultivos. Más agradece el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja como taxista en el trasporte público; cubriendo las rutas Tarma – Palca, donde obtiene un dinero extra. Por ello más adelante está pensando comprar su propia casa, y de esa manera aliviar los gastos de arriendo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Luzmila de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 20 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus sembríos de maíz de 10 parcelas.
texts.en: Luzmila, age 31, is a very happy woman; she lives with her husband Freddy, with whom she has 2 children: Brayan and Cielo. They live in a rented home in the Cachunayo locality. She has worked in the noble office of agriculture from the young age of 18. Her main crops are peas, corn and other vegetables. What she most enjoys about her work is the support she receives from her husband, who helps her to offer constant care to the crops. As well, they have their lands near to the river, which benefits the crops' growth. "I am now harvesting the peas, and I will make a good income", she says. Her main problem is her oldest son's education fees, as he is starting his studies. She is trying to minimize the cost of maintaining her crops. She is even more grateful for her husband's support. He works as a taxi driver in public transportation, covering the Tarma-Palca route and making an additional income. Because of this, they are thinking of buying their own home in the future, thus freeing themselves from the cost of renting. Luzmila belongs to the "Senor de Muruhuay" communal bank, and this is her tenth loan with MFP. She is grateful for the support that she is recieving. Furthermore, she promises to be punctual with the payment of her quotas. Luzmila, upon receiving your support, will invest the requested loan in the purchase of 20 bags of natural fertilizer to spread on the 10-parcel field where she has sown corn.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana  de 58 años de edad vive en Arjona, cerca a la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, con su esposo y su hijo  en la edad  de 21; desde allí desarrolla su actividad comercial, pues es  propietaria de un negocio de variedades, que inició hace 9 meses, con la compra de vitrinas y mercancías, las ubicó en  su casa,   sitio estratégico donde le ha ido muy bien, porque además del potencial comercial que tienen sus alrededores,  aplica su vocación de servicio, en  la atención de su comunidad. Su meta es lograr un mayor surtido de mercancías, porque quiere continuar mejorando sus ingresos, con tal de ayudar a que su hija logre estudiar en la universidad y convertirse en una profesional de éxito. Su mayor desafío es lograr el capital de trabajo que se requiere para hacer compras al por mayor, con las que logre un stock de mercancías visibles que roten permanentemente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará papelería, ropa, cosméticos y  perfumes, con estos productos sus clientes se sentirán satisfechos y acudirán con mas frecuencia a su miscelánea, especialmente en esta época de septiembre, en la cual repuntan las ventas por acercarse la celebración del día del amor y de la amistad, momentos de gran despliegue comercial , que impactan los negocios grandes y pequeños. Ana trabaja  en su negocio generando una utilidad bruta del 41,69%, una ganancia neta del 39,5% desde la cual auguramos su potencial éxito en su inversión
texts.en:
Ana, 58, lives in Arjona near the city of Cartagena de Indias with her husband and 21-year-old son.  She carries out her commercial activity there.  She opened a variety store nine months ago with the purchase of display cases and merchandise.  She set it up at home, a strategic spot where she’s done very well because aside from the commercial potential that exists in her environs, she also applies a service attitude taking care of the community.  Her goal is to have a wider selection of goods because she wants to continue improving her income in order to help her son go to university and become a successful professional.  

Her greatest challenge is having sufficient working capital needed to make purchases at wholesale that will allow her to have stock inventory that constantly turns over.  This is the reason why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy paper goods, clothes, cosmetics and perfume.  With these products, her customers will feel satisfied and will come by more often to her variety shop especially during the September season when sales tend to increase due to the approaching Day of Love and Friendship which is a time of increased commercial activity that impacts businesses both large and small.  Ana manages her business with gross sales of 41.69% and a net profit of 39.5% so we are able to predict a potentially successful investment.

loans.use: to buy paper goods, clothes, cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie is married and has three children. Emie is 54 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte.

Emie is a farmer and grows rubber to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase four sacks of fertilizer.

Emie has been a member of PMPC since 2011. In the future, Emie hopes to expand her rubber farm to plant other seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 47 years old and married to Naomi. They have been blessed with two children who are in secondary school. He operates a hardware shop where he sells construction materials to constructors and builders. He has been in this business for the last three years and gets an income of 15,000 KES per month.

Stephen was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. He is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase more timber and other materials. He will use the anticipated profit to purchase a pick-up for delivery.

Stephen hopes to have a big hardware store with a pick-up for delivery. He is very hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase timber and other materials.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a shell crafts business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her shell crafts business. In the future, Angelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell crafts business

loans.name: Santos Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio de 58 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía.

Eusebio desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y cabras), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un peso y una talla ideal para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar animales de otras especies y su alimento respectivo, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta de sus animales puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Eusebio es una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es poderle brindar comodidades a su familia y que tenga mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 58 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children. They do not receive basic services. Eusebio resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its businesses that involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Eusebio has been raising domesticated animals (sheep and goats) for five years. The pens are located in an area behind his house and are spacious and of the appropriate size. His animals are fed a diet of balanced feed and natural grasses. When they have reached the ideal size and weight, the animals are offered at different markets in the area. This allows Eusebio to earn a very good income so that he can cover his daily household expenses.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that he can buy other types of animals and the appropriate feed. The income he generates from the sale of these animals will be used to repay his loan and improve his quality of life. Eusebio is a hardworking and responsible person whose only wish is to provide comforts for his family and to have a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy different types of animals and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Siata S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Mary is the facilitator of the Siata S.H.G. group. Mary and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Mary takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to have access to One Acre Fund's low prices, to ensure food security for her family, and, later, to educate them. In the 2011 season, Mary had a good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Mary will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Siata S.H.G. group will each plant maize plots between ½ and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maguatte

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme âgé, père de douze enfants dont les quatre sont à l'école.Il travaille dans le commerce de tissus depuis plus de vingt ans.Il s'est installé en centre ville ou il embrasse une grande clientèle à travers toute la ville.Son activité lui a permis de construire sa maison, de nourrir sa famille et de s'occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants.Il a pu également épargner et acquérir des biens avec les bénéfices obtenus.Pour renforcer son fond de commerce en cette période de forte demande, il sollicite un prêt de 250000f pour acheter des tissus, des cravates et des garnitures.Son ambition est d'ouvrir d'autres boutiques pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Maguatte is a man in his later years and the father of 12 children, 4 of whom attend school. He has been working in the fabric trade for over 20 years. His shop is in the town centre, where he serves a large clientele of people from all over town. His business has enabled him to build his house, feed his family and pay his children's educational expenses. He has also been able to save some money and use some of his profits to acquire possessions.

Maguatte is requesting a loan of 250 000 francs to invest in his business during the current period of high demand. He will use the money to restock on fabrics, ties and accessories. His ultimate goal is to open more shops for his children.

loans.use: to restock on fabrics, ties and accessories.

loans.name: Julia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Julia Elizabeth tiene 21 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de res años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría. 

Julia se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de mercadería y agriaultura, Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Guayaquil.

Solicita el crédito para poder tener capital para la agricultura, Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudará a tener un beneficio más.

El sueño es poder tener una casa en los tiempos libres realiza quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Julia Elizabeth is 21 years old.  She lives in a common law marriage and has a son.  She lives with her husband and three-year-old son in the Ventanas Canton in the Province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank "LUCHANDO JUNTOS" ["Striving Together"], is located in the new Zapotal district in Ventanas Canton.  The majority of its members work in retailing.

Julia has been working selling merchandise and farm produce for the last two years.  She makes her purchases and sales in Guayaquil.

She is requesting the loan to have capital for buying produce.  The loan will help her to have better profits.

Her dream is to be able to have her own home.  In her free time, she takes care of the household.

loans.use: to have capital for buying produce.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
As Napoleon said, the truest wisdom is a resolute determination. This proverb somewhat resonates with 31-year-old Agnes, an assiduous retail business woman, plying her trade in Ntungamo. Agnes says a sense of purposefulness has been invaluable the last three years as she has built her business.
She deals in general merchandise used by most people in her community: sugar, salt, maize flour, bread, beans, rice, etc. Agnes also earns supplementary income from teaching. Her monthly retail shop sales are approximately 100,000 UGX.

Agnes is upbeat about the future prospects of her business. She anticipates growth and expansion. She is hoping this Kiva loan will come in handy to serve this purpose. She intends to use her loan to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. For 5 years, Rizalina has had a food shop that sells balot, or hard-boiled duck eggs. Rizalina has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more duck eggs to make balot to sell. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her business. Rizalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

loans.use: to buy duck eggs for making balot to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is fifty years old and a married woman with four children. She lives in Napo, a part of Tudela in Misamis Occidental Province in the Philippines.

Elizabeth sells dressed beef, chicken and pork in the local community to earn a living. She has been in business for three years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP through this type of work.

Elizabeth is been a member of GDMPC for three years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP for additional capital for her dressed meat business. In the future, Elizabeth wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to obtain additional capital for her dressed meat business.

loans.name: Walisuma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WALISUMA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Fanny es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, ladrillera, venta de fruta, tejido de mantas, costura de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Fanny es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, que inicio con el primer préstamo que hizo en nuestra institución y que en la actualidad le está resultando muy fructífero.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo, arroz, azúcar, etc.) que comprará de los almacenes de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente los comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive con su madre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The “Walisuma” Community Bank will start its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. It is composed of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors; Fanny is the secretary of the group. The members engage in different economic activities, such as running a neighborhood store, brick making, selling fruits, blankets weaving and clothes sewing.

Fanny is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. Fanny says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for one and a half years, and that she has been invited to enter by a friend who was already a member of this institution. She currently runs a neighborhood store, an activity she has started thanks to the first loans she has received form Pro Mujer and which is currently being very profitable.

The loan she is currently requesting will be used to increase her working capital buy buying noodles, rice, sugar and other products. She will buy them in the stores of the town of El Alto to then sell them in her shop. She lives with her mother, and this type of activity helps her earning money to support her family as much as she can.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she enjoys the health clinic.

loans.use: To buy noodles, rice, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Beth wants to buy 4 bales of first class used clothes.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman H. lives in Agsu city where he owns a booth at the local bazaar selling women's clothing and shoes. He is 48 years old, married with five children. He has owned his store for 12 years. With this money he wishes to open up a second location at the bazaar selling food products.

loans.use: to open another business location selling food products

loans.name: Lagomau

texts.en: Logomau grows more than just the usual bananas and taro on her plantation. She also plants pineapples and as a result of experimenting with different types of crops, helps her plantation by attracting different customers.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and shovels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her fruit salad and juice business

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma T. X., 29, is a member of a women's loan group where every one of the women weaves huipiles, the traditional Mayan women's top. In this village they weave the huipil of relatively simple cloth, but then embroider it richly. Irma can make 2 huipiles in 15 days, and then she sells them in the market in Chimaltenango for about US$65 each. She'll invest this loan, as she did the previous one, in the yarn she needs for weaving and in embroidery thread. She says that having a bit of capital via the loan just makes things a little easier – it's not a big problem trying to get money together to buy yarn, which used to be the case. In fact, she still has a little left from her last loan, which is completely paid off.

Irma's dream is to build a house and buy some land. She currently spends about $200/year to rent a little 20 by 40 meter plot where she grows corn, the staple food of the people here. Buying a 20 by 20 meter plot would cost her about $2000.

Irma, like several other women in her village, reports that the children under age 2 are very regularly sick, with fevers, headaches, and stomach aches. It seems to clear up a bit when they get to age two, but it's a challenge that all the young families here seem to face.

Here is a video of the women of Irma's group at their loan meeting. The entire group, without exception, weaves and embroiders huipiles, and you can see them here working away while the loan terms and obligations are being explained.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving and embroidery thread.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
MARIANA is 57 years old and has nine children. Her husband used to work in the countryside, but he suffered an embolism and is now unable to work. Ever since then Mariana has taken over as head of household by making handmade tortillas and selling them among the people of her community as tortillas are the core of any meal. She belongs to a group called San Dionisio 7 and the other members of the group are: Marta Gómez Velasco (convenience store owner), Guadalupe Gómez Velasco (convenience store owner), Blanca Martínez Jiménez (tortilla maker) and Ms. Lidia Gómez Velasco (convenience store owner). With the loan, three of them will invest in the purchase of merchandise in order to better supply their stores, the other two women will purchase corn, firewood and other instruments in order to make their tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIANA, tiene 57 años , 9 hijos , su esposos trabajaba en el campo pero sufrió una embolia que lo dejo imposibilitado para trabajar y por lo tanto ella se hizo cargo de la manutención del hogar dedicándose a hacer tortillas a mano y las vende entre las personas de su comunidad ya que son la base de cualquier alimento..Pertenece al grupo San Dionisio 7 y las otras integrantes del grupo son: Marta Gómez Velasco (tienda De abarrotes), Guadalupe Gómez Velasco (tienda de abarrotes), Blanca Martínez Jiménez (hace tortillas) y doña Lidia Gómez Velasco (tienda de abarrotes). Con el préstamo tres de ellas invertirán comprando mercaderías para abastecer mejor sus tiendas, en cambio las otras dos compraran maíz, leña e implementos para la fabricación de sus tortillas.

loans.use: TORTILLA SALES

loans.name: Kokoudavi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokoudavi K. was born in 1981 in Ahonlogoé and he still lives in the same village. He is married and the father of three (03) children. He is a farmer and grows corn, manioc and sweet potatoes. The selling of his produces make up his principal income. This income, however, is not sufficient to provide for his family’s needs and to afford the schooling fees for his children. He is requesting a loan of $200 to buy fertilizers in order to improve his yield and increase his income.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Né en 1981 à Ahonlogoé, Monsieur K. Kokoudavi réside actuellement dans ledit village. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il est agriculteur de profession et cultive du maïs, du manioc et des patates douces. La vente de ses produits constitue sa principale source de revenu. Mais ce revenu est insuffisant pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants. Ainsi il sollicite un crédit de $200 qui lui permettra d’acheter de l’engrais afin d’améliorer son rendement et augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Djamafar

texts.en: Djamafar (her sister is pictured) is the mother of one child. She was born in 1953 and lives in Khachmaz town. She has been in the business of cattle breeding for a year. Now Djamafar needs a loan of $1,200 to buy a cow in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy one cow

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María Silveria, 47 years old, has been selling groceries from her home for a short time. She, along with her husband Gustavo, decided to take on the challenge of opening a grocery store with the best service for their community. They want to keep moving forward and in time convert the store to a minimarket. María Silveria is mother to five children, four of whom are independent professionals, which leaves her with the company of her youngest child, fifteen years old, who she hopes will follow in his siblings’ footsteps. She turns to your generous hearts to raise the quantity that she needs in order to expand and implement her small grocery store, and little by little turn it into the most visited minimarket, with the best service, in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Silveria de 47 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio desde hace poco tiempo, ella junto a su esposo el señor Gustavo se plantearon el reto de aperturar una bodega con el mejor servicio para su comunidad, quieren seguir adelante y con el tiempo convertirlo en un minimercado. Maria Silveria es madre de cinco hijos, de los cuales cuatro de ellos ya son profesionales e independientes, quedándose con la compañía del más pequeño de quince años y espera que siga el camino de sus hermanos. Acude vuestro generoso corazón para acopiar la cantidad que necesita para ampliar e implementar su pequeña bodega y poco a poco ir convirtiéndola en el minimercado más visitado y con el mejor servicio de su ciudad.

loans.use: Improve her small grocery store

loans.name: Merta Nadi Group

texts.id:
Merta Nadi is a group of pig farmers located in the village of Candikusuma where the majority of people are Hindu. The name Merta Nadi was chosen by the members of the group because Merti means "immediate" and Nadi means "prosperity" and Nadi is also the name of the street they live on. With all of their enthusiasm, Merta Nadi approached Denari to help them make raising pigs the right way easier. Merta Nadi is asking for a loan to purchase high-quality pig feed, to help their sick pigs get well and to unsure that the control of their money is good in order. After creation and training, Dinari now feels that the Merta Nadi group is ready to receive funding. Merta Nadi consists of leader Ni Komang Santiani, secretary Ni Ketut Suari dan treasurer Ni Ketut Kongsi. Merta Nadi has a total of 11 members. The loan will be used to purchase a high quality boar and quality pig feed. With these improvements the pigs they raise will be much higher quality than the pigs typically raised in their village. All along, the members of Merta Nadi have been very diligent in their work. With the help from the loan they receive the members of Merta Nadi believe that their business undertaking will be a success and really take off.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Merta Nadi sebuah kelompok ternak Babi yang berlokasi di desa Candikusuma dimana sebagian besar masyarakatnya memeluk agama Hindu. Nama ini diberikan atas persetujuan anggota karena mempunyai arti bahwa Merta itu berarti Rejeki atau berkat sedangkan Nadi merupakan suatu jalan kehidupan. Sehingga Merta Nadi diberi arti oleh anggota kelompok kehidupan yang dipenuhi rejeki. Dengan keyakinan inilah anggota akhirnya mengajukan permohonan kepada Yayasan Dinari untuk mendapat pembinaan mengenai beternak babi seperti bagaimana cara beternak babi yang baik dan benar,cara pemberian pakan yang bagus, mengatasi penyakit babi secara cepat dan tepat,serta pengaturan keuangan yang benar agar modal untuk pakan ternak tidak habis untuk biaya dapur. Setelah pembinaan dan pelatihan dirasa cukup maka Yayasan Dinari memberi pinjaman modal kepada anggota kelompok Merta Nadi. Kelompok ini diketuai oleh Ni Komang Santiani ,Sekretaris Ni Ketut Suari dan Bendahara Ni Ketut Kongsi. Dengan jumlah anggota sebanyak 11 orang. Pinjaman modal yang diberikan oleh Yayasan Dinari dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit unggul dan pakan ternak yang berkwalitas,maksudnya agar hasil yang diperoleh akan lebih bagus daripada memelihara babi lokal, yang selama ini mereka tekuni. Dengan adanya pembinaan dan dukungan modal dari Yayasan Dinari maka kelompok Merta Nadi berkeyakinan bahwa usahanya akan sukses dan berkembang bagus.

loans.use: to purchase a high quality boar and quality pig feed

loans.name: Zokirova

texts.ru:
R. Zokirova is 47 years old. She is married and has 4 children. R. has a high school education. She became a client of MicroInvest in 2006. Back then she sold men’s and women’s underwear in different places around town. Now she has a fixed spot at the market, higher inventory and purchases products for cash which lets her purchase them at a cheaper price. In the future she plans to transition to wholesale sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Зокирова Рафоат – 47 лет .Замужем, мать четверых детей .Образование среднее. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ Микроинвест-е с 2006-го года. Тогда она продавала мужские и женские белья в разных местах города. Теперь у нее определенное место деятельности в рынке, увеличенный товарооборот и покупает товар за наличные, что позволяет ей приобрести подешевле.В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу товара.

loans.use: Increase inventory and transition to wholesale sales

loans.name: Phoem

texts.en: Phoem C., age 52 years old, is a widow and has resided in Kampong Cham with her two children since they were born. Mrs. Phoem C. works as a house wife and stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family. Her daughter, Sim Phally, age 23, owns a plot of farmland growing yams. On average, she makes around $2.50 a day. The other child is married and lives away from home. To make their business produce more output, she would like to take out a loan from Kiva to purchase good yam seeds to grow in the next season and the remaining loan to hire a farm worker to grow the yams. (Picture: Mrs Phoem C. and her daughter)

loans.use: To purchase good yam seeds

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married with two daughters. He’s a businessman from Novaya Kahovka where he sells women’s footwear in the city market. Yuryi is very enterprising, has vast experience working as a vendor and is full of creative ideas. A reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service has always been priorities in his work and have helped to ensure the success of his business. Yuryi has a perfect record as a client with HOPE Intl-Nadiya Ukraine, having promptly repaid each loan he has received.

Yuryi has been running his business for seven years. Currently, he has about $6000 invested in the business. His monthly income is about $300-400. Yuryi is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to increase his inventory. He believes that having this additional turnover capital will help him minimize his sales risk and provide stable financial support for his family. Moreover, it will help him get closer to his ultimate goal of purchasing a big store of his own one day.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Saer

texts.fr:
Mr N. is a young man living in Thies. He is a member of UIMCEC’s Jammy Xaléyi fund in Thies. His main business is metalwork, which he has been doing for over a decade. With the sum he is requesting, he wants to buy raw materials so that he can meet his delivery deadlines.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

mr N. est un jeune homme qui vit à THIES .c'est un sociétaire de la caisse de jammy xaléyi de UIMCEC DE THIES .sa principale activité c'est la tolerie qu'il pratique depuis une dizaine d'année .avec somme qu'il demande il veut acheter des matières premières afin de respecter ses délais de livraison.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for metalwork

loans.name: Negmat

texts.ru:
Negmat R. lives in Shahrinav. He lives with his family. He is married and has four children. He has a secondary education. He works as a businessman. He buys rice and other kinds of grains wholesale from farmers. He then brings them to Dushanbe and, with a small markup, sells them wholesale. He has been doing this for 26 years.
