The business is well established. Harvest time for the new crops is coming soon, and he wants to increase his sales. The loan will help him to buy the goods for a lower price. He will repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Раджабов Негмат житель района Шахринау. Живет со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Работает бизнесменом. Покупает у дехкан рис и другие виды круп –оптом. Привозит в город Душанбе и с небольшой наценкой продает, так же оптом. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 26 лет. Бизнес налажен. Но скоро сбор нового урожая и он хочет увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет ему скупить товар по более низкой цене. Погашать кредит он будет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Gastin Yadema

texts.fr: Marié et père de deux (02) enfants, monsieur Gastin Yadema B.  est né en Novembre 1983 à Lomé. Sa femme est une ménagère à la maison. Donc il est seul à faire face aux charges de la famille. Malgré ses efforts il n’arrive pas à sortir du cercle vicieux de la pauvreté. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acquérir un local pour en faire une boutique d’alimentation générale. Actuellement il travaille dans le cafétéria. Ce crédit lui permettra de disposer de ses propres outils de travail.
texts.en:
A married father of two, Mr. Gastin Yadema B. was born in November 1983 in Lomé. His wife is a housewife, so he alone is responsible for the family expenses. Despite his efforts, he is unable to get out of the vicious circle of poverty. He is seeking this loan to get a place to set up a general food store. He currently works in a cafeteria. This loan will allow him to have his own work tools.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to open a general food store

loans.name: Zikusooka Women's Group

texts.en:
Christine N. is chairperson of Zikusooka women's group in Nkokonjeru, Lugazi. She has made a living selling nets to fishermen at two landing sites since 1985, and is well known for her work. Christine says that there are 25 types of nets on the market, but about 5 have been suspended by the Ministry of Trade and Fisheries. She sells the remaining 20 types to her customers, who live as far away as seven miles from her home.

Christine is married and has seven children, but also cares for three relatives and an orphan. She started getting loans seven years ago, and they have changed her life dramatically. She has been able to join with her husband to buy several plots of land for farming, build a small house, and make plans to complete a larger one that can accommodate everyone.

Christine says her business is doing well -- recently the lake was not in a good condition, but thank God it is now in great shape and everyone is happy. Christine dreams of one day opening up a retail shop that will sell cold drinks, soaps and cereals so that she can work in one place as she grows older and her legs become more painful. She is thankful for her husband's help in raising their children and helping them become educated. She will use her potion of the loan to buy more fishing nets to sell.

loans.use: To buy more nets to sell to local fisherman.

loans.name: Mrs. Ro Sarim Group

texts.en:
The group leader of five is Mrs. Ro S., age 28, and all of the members live in Thmey Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand and has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more grocery products for her inventory.

Her husband has two hectares where he cultivates rice to earn money for the family. Mrs. Ro S. is the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other, age two, is too young to work or study.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to increase the store inventory.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La sra. Flora M. es una cliente muy antigua trabaja con nuestra institución desD. el año 2004.
Es nacida en la provincia Florida D. Santa Cruz, y actualmente vive en el Barrio 6 D. mayo, municipio el Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia.
Es dueña D. casa vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, los cuales ya son mayores D. edad.
Su esposo se dedica a la actividad D. albañilería desD. hace 10 años. La actividad principal D. la Sra. Flora es la panadería la cual cumple muy bien desD. hace 21 años y el préstamo que será otorgado será para la compra D. insumos y mejoramiento D. un galpón en el que trabaja.
texts.en:
Flora M. is an old client who has worked with our institution from 2004. She is a native of the provice of Florida in Santa Cruz, but now lives in the "6 D. Mayo" suburb in the town of Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. She is the lady of the house, living with her husband and her four children, who are already adults. Her husband has worked for the last ten years in construction. Flora's principal activity is baking, a task she has undertaken with great skill for the last 21 years. The loan which will be authorised will be for the purchase of ingredients and the improvement of a warehouse where she works.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital injection

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer lives happily with his wife Norma and their 18-year-old son Eugi, who is now in college. Elmer hopes to have a progressive life through his farming business. In order to do this, he needs to improve his rice and corn crops for a better yield. He therefore asks for a loan amounting to PHP15,000 (USD$325) to assist him financially.

To learn to be contented in life is the guiding principle of Elmer. He does not complain on what life brings him. He is thankful for giving him a family, even though they are not wealthy, because they are always in good health.

Part of Elmer's dreams is to have their house renovated and to have electric supply. He knows that he will be able to fulfill these dreams when he has enough resources to utilize.

loans.use: Additional working capital for his farm.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal San Juan
Carmen  es casada tiene  44 años, tiene una hija de 17 años que estudia
Tiene un negocio de bazar de regalos, dulces empezaron hace seis meses en el mercado de Pamplona  invirtió 5.000 soles y ha duplicado su  inversión a  10.000 soles   
Ella necesita 800 soles  los va invertir en su negocio de bazar de regalos, dulces    
Carmen tiene un sueño es tener otro negocio para su hijo.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the community bank San Juan. She is married and is 44 years old. She has a 17 year old daughter who is studying. She has a business selling gifts and sweets that she began six months ago in the Pamplona market. She invested 5.000 soles and she has doubled her investment to 10.000 soles. She needs 800 soles that she would invest in her business of gifts and sweets. Carmen has a dream of having another business, for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business of gifts and sweets

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El señor Miguel tiene un empleo como guardia de seguridad de una empresa, con una antigüedad de 3 años, su esposa la señora Pompeya trabaja como empleada domestica de una residencia, su hijo el joven Denny labora para una maquiladora como operador de línea. Ellos como una familia unida están solicitando este crédito ya que tiene un proyecto el cual es la construcción de una barda y la impermeabilización del techo de su casa ya que en temporada de lluvias se daño mucho el techo.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel is employed as a security guard for a company that has been in business for 3 years. His wife, Mrs. Pompeya, is employed as a maid in a residence, and his son Denny works as a line operator. They are united as a family requesting this loan for a project to build a wall and waterproof the roof of their house since in rainy season there is much damage to the roof.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall and waterproof the roof

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana, married with two children, has been selling women's robes and underwear at one of the markets in Nikopolfor for eight years. An honest and hard working person, she knows that having a large assortment of good quality products is one of the keys to business success.

Svetlana is now requesting a loan of 7,000 UAH to purchase a kiosk for a second business location. Her goal is to develop this enterprise further so she can help her daughter to cover her university tuition.

loans.use: To purchase a kiosk for a second business location.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 38 años, vive solo en una casa arrendada, es separado y tiene una hija de 10 años. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos al por mayor y menor, viaja a distintas ciudades de su país para venderlos. La facilidad de Luis es que trabaja en una fábrica de zapatos y además de recibir un sueldo por su mano de obra, puede obtener su mercadería a un bajo costo y obtener ganancias de sus propias ventas. Los viajes que realiza son los fines de semana, viajar y vender es una actividad que lo distrae y relaja. Sus ganancias lo animan a seguir trabajando, pero tiene un gran anhelo que desea cumplir, que es tener su propia fábrica de zapatos y producir sus propios diseños. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, quiere forjar un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal y ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando es para abastecerse de mayor cantidad de mercadería, Luis tiene planes de viajar a nuevas ciudades en busca de nuevos mercados.
texts.en:
Luis is 38 years old. He lives alone in a rented house. He is separated, and has a daughter of 10. He sells shoes for adults and children. He travels to specific cities of his country to sell them. Luis works in a shoe factory, and beyond his base salary, he may buy his merchandise at a low cost and then obtain earnings from his own sales. The trips that he makes are on the weekends. Travelling and selling are activities that keep him entertained and relax him. His earnings motivate him to continue working, but his greatest yearing that he wants to fulfill is to have his own shoe factory and to produce his own designs. This is the first time that he is asking for a loan with MFP. He wants to forge a working relationship in his comunal bank, and be punctual in his payments. The money that he is asking for will be to stock up on the highest quantity of merchandise. Luis has plans to travel to new cities in search of new markets.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Creciendo Hacia El Futuro 6 Group

texts.en:
The members of this Bank of Hope group, group 6, have requested their sixth loan through Esperanza International. They've been clients for the last 3 years. These loans have allowed them to make their businesses more sustainable. Their business activities include clothing and accessories sales, and an internet cafe.

Marisabel P. is the group representative. She's married and has 3 children. She has a "fantasia" in her house. This is a store where mostly, you can purchase accessories like hair pins and ponytail holders, and personal care products like deodorant and shampoo. You can also find small school supplies like pencils and paper.

Marisabel wants to provide her children with the best education and quality of life so that they can excel. This is why she works so hard in her business and tries to keep it well stocked and interesting, and to achieve the financial stability that allows her to support her children's education.

Please help us support these entrepreneurs through this loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase personal products for resale

loans.name: Marixza Del Socorro

texts.es: La joven Marixza del Socorro H. Martínez tiene la edad de 37 años, su estado civil soltera. Marixza se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de mariscos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella pasa muchas horas al día vendiendo en la calles de manera ambulante sus productos. Los propósitos de Marixza son de mantener activo su negocio ya que esto le permite obtener la fuente de ingresos necesaria para su familia. Como todo negocio en desarrollo necesita el apoyo de un financiamiento destinado para su capital de trabajo y así comprar camarones, pescados, langostas y conchas. El deseo de Marixza es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que el día de mañana sus hijos no tengan problemas.
texts.en:
Marixza del Socorro H. Martínez is a single 37-year-old woman. Marixza makes a living selling shellfish. She has been in this business for 9 years. She spends much of the day selling her products in the streets as an ambulatory vendor. Marixza wants to keep her business active since this provides her family with a source of income. As with all developing businesses, she needs financial support that will be used as working capital so she can buy shrimp, fish, lobster, and scallops. Marixza hopes to make some improvements to her home so her children won't have problems in the future

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita R. is 34 years of age, married with two children, and presently residing at Sto. Niño, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She generates her income through her sari-sari store.

She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000.00. She will use this amount to purchase stock for her sari-sari store. She also plans to add a connecting door to her store for easy passage to her house. In addition, she plans to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: To expand and improve her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Unidas Para Crecer, Group 2

texts.en:
Rafaela Z. is the group coordinator for these five entrepreneurs. She and her friends will be taking their second loan with Esperanza International. Their first was a great help in setting up their businesses and they hope that with these second loans they can expand both their sales and their profits.

Rafaela has three children ages 7, 9 and 12. She sells jewelry which she buys, most of the time, at the commercial district in Santo Domingo, the capital city. She will use this loan to buy a large inventory, expecting her jewelry sales to pick up with Mother's Day coming up on May 31st.

Rafaela has not always sold clothes. She once had a chemical products manufacturing business. She used to make cleaning products and personal care products like shampoo and soap. Rafaela hopes to invest her jewelry profits into setting up her chemical factory again. She would like to be admired in her community as a hard-working woman full of creativity and always looking to grow as a person.

Pleas help us support this group with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase jewelry for resale

loans.name: Bahrullo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Бахрулло Рахимов  занимается изготовлением и продажей кисломолочных продуктов. В ассортимент его товара входят такие продукты как кефир сметана и курут. Наверняка вы спросите что такое курут? Курут это кисло-соленные молочные шарики, которые изготавливают сам Бахрулло и его отец. Эти шарики сушат и потом продают. Изготвление курута происходит в домашних условиях. На снимке Бахрулло на фоне своего товара. Этот товар и есть курут.
В самом начале своей деятельности Бахрулло и его отец варили набот. Это сахарный сироп в виде кристалов.Затем продавали его на рынке.Но перейдя на продажу кисло молочных продуктов, он поняли что это более доходный бизнес.
Каждый день Бахрулло изготавливает 50кг курута. Кредит хочет получить для изготовления курута.
texts.en:
Bahrullo R. makes and sells products from processed milk. In his assortment of merchandise there are products such as sour cream, buttermilk and kurut. You are probably wondering what is kurut? Kurut is sour and salty milk balls which Bahrullo and his father make themselves. These balls are then dried and sold. They make kurut at home. On the photo Bahrullo is pictured with his product in the front which is kurut. In the beginning of their business Bahrullo and his father were making nabot which is a syrup made of sugar in forms of crystals. They sold it on the market. After they started selling processed milk products and realized that it's a more profitable business. Every day Bahrullo makes 50 kilograms of kurut. He wants to get a loan to produce more kurut.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To produce processed milk products

loans.name: La Fe, Group 7

texts.en:
Carmen M. is 64 years old and lives in the Kilometro 5 community outside of El Seybo, Dominican Republic. She is the group coordinator for the Bank of Hope called La Fe (The Faith), Group 7. Carmen's experiences with Kiva and Esperanza International are typical of those of her fellow borrowers in La Fe, Group 7.

Carmen runs a small grocery store (called a colmado) in the rural sugarcane-cutting community (called a batey) of Kilometro 5. She is looking to take out her fourth loan with Kiva so she can buy additional merchandise, including juice, bananas, chicken, and vegetables, to sell in her store. Carmen reports that she has had no major problems running her business over the many years that it has been in operation; she can't remember exactly how long ago it was she opened the colmado. Carmen's goals for her business are simple: she wants to sustain her business and keep paying back her loans so she can help support her large family, which includes 12 children and 40 grandchildren!

Carmen is pictured on the far right of the attached photo. Her fellow group members from La Fe are pictured in the front row of the photo.

loans.use: New food items for small grocery store

loans.name: Maria Adelaide

texts.pt:
Maria Adelaide M. nasceu na cidade da Matola, tem 49 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos. Parou de estudar na 5 classe quando o seu pai faleceu deixando lhe sem condições financeiras para poder continuar. Maria tem todos os filhos a freqüentar escola o mais velho tem 15 anos e estudam nas escolas publicas locais.

Maria vive com o seu marido, pensionista militar. Aprendeu a fazer negocio em boane e tem mais de 18 anos de experiência. Vende roupa diversa e produtos alimentares como  arroz, produto base para alimentação da maioria, pratica preço de quase um dólar americano o kilo. Em media rende 700,00MT por dia e consegue poupar algum no final de cada mês.

Maria nunca solicitou empréstimo, nem com outras instituições, e este é o seu primeiro no valor de 25.000,00MT para compra e venda de produtos de primeira necessidade. Maria não tem enfrentado dificuldades para aquisição de produtos, vive a 15 km da cidade de Maputo. Descobriu o escritório da Hluvuku-Adsema quando passava e tendo na semana seguinte aproximado. Propõe se a pagar sem problemas para poder aceder a novos créditos que serão para compra de mais produtos assim como uma viatura para ajudar no transporte de mercadoria para o negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Adelaide M. was born in the city of Matola. She is 49 years old, married and the mother of five children. She left school in grade five when her father died, leaving her without the financial wherewithal to continue. All her children to go to school – her oldest is 15 years old. They attend local public schools. Maria lives with her husband, who is a military pensioner. She learned her business skills in Boane and has more than 18 years of experience. She sells various clothes and food items such as rice, the dietary staple for most people. The actual price is almost $1 US per kilo. On average, she earns 700 MT per day, and manages to set some aside at the end of every month. Maria has never asked for a loan before, and never with another institution. This, her first loan for an amount of 25,000 MT, is to purchase and sell basic necessities. Maria does not face any difficulty in acquiring these goods, living 15 km. from the city of Maputo. She discovered the offices of Hluvuku-Adsema when she passed by and the following week she approached them for a loan. She intends to pay the loan without trouble in order to be able to accede to new loans, which will be to purchase more products such as a vehicle to help in transporting merchandise for her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Rita Ingrid

texts.es:
La señora RITA INGRID C. D. C., tiene 46 años, vive en el distrito D. Moche , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Las Delicias II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º D. secundaria, tiene 4 hijos D. 38, 32, 21, 18 años y solo los dos ultimos depenD. económicamente D. ella porque se encuentran estudiando.
RITA se dedica a la venta D. ropa, en el mercado D. Moche.
El crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invertio en la compra D. mas ropa, D. la ciudad D. Lima para venderlo en su puesto y en su casa.
Este credito D. 800 lo invirtira en la compra D. mas ropa (para niños, damas y caballeros)D. la ciudad D. Lima . RITA sueña con hacer crecer su negocio para obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
46-year old Señora Rita Ingrid C. D. C. lives in Moche district in Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She is a member of the Banco Las Delicias II and has completed 5th graD. of high school. She is a businesswoman and has four children aged 38, 32, 21, and 18, but now only supports the two youngest as they are still studying. Rita earns her living by selling clothing in the Moche market. Her previous loan of 300 soles was used to buy more clothing from Lima to sell from her stall and also from her home. This loan of 800 soles will be used to buy additional clothing (for children, women, and men) from Lima. Rita’s dream is to expand her business and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more clothing from Lima

loans.name: Julia Margarita

texts.es: Doña Julia R. de 30 años de edad, reside en el barrio Vila roma en la capital de Managua, madre soltera de dos hijos, vive junto con su madre el cual tienen en sociedad una pulpería que administran desde hace diez años, inicio con poco productos y poco dinero, pero han logrado salir adelante. Entre otros productos vende leña, frutas y verduras. Con este crédito lo quiere para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción del área del negocio para dar una mejor presentación y tener mejor comodidad. Sus planes es seguir invirtiendo en la venta, apoyar siempre a su mama y a sus hijos. Da las gracias a la institución por dar la oportunidad de mejorar sus vidas económicamente.
texts.en:
Ms. Julia R. is 30 years old and the single mother of two. She lives with her mother in the Vila roma section of the capital city of Managua. They’ve been running a general store together for the past 10 years. They started their business with little money and a few items, but have managed make it successful. She sells a variety of products, including firewood, fruits, and vegetables. She will use this loan to buy construction materials to make her place of business more comfortable and improve its image. She plans to continue to invest in her business and to always support her mother and children. She is thankful for giving her the opportunity to help her improve their lives economically.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Materials

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 54 year old and married with 6 children. She sells drinks and has been in the business for the past 28years. She hopes for the loan amount of N150000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora María Auxiliadora R. G. es socia del Banco Comunal Dapreydi en Tosagua un cantón de la provincia de Manabí,  está casada desde hace 16 años tiene dos hijos de 15 y 30 años.

 María Auxiliadora se dedica a la preparación de alimentos,  tiene un restaurant en el centro de la ciudad donde  ofrece desayunos, almuerzos, y platos típicos de la región como caldo de gallina criolla, viche, seco de gallina, además es  ella la que se encarga de la sazón y cuenta con la ayuda de una señora.

María Auxiliadora  viene realizando esta labor desde hace muchos años, atiende de lunes a sábado de 6:30 a 15:00, el tiempo que le queda de la tarde lo dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a  dejar  adelantando su trabajo para el día siguiente, cuenta que durante estos años ha logrado mantener clientes fijos que llegan ya  a cuarenta.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para invertir  en su negocio en la compra de víveres para preparar sus comidas y para adquirir menaje de cocina para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

El sueño de María Auxiliadora es tener un local bastante amplio para su restaurant y que sea de su propiedad,  así como incursionar en la venta de ropa y cosméticos  ya que es un negocio muy rentable.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora R. G. is a member of Dapreydi community bank in Tosagua, part of Manabí province. She has been married for 16 years and has two children, ages 15 and 30. María Auxiliadora prepares food; she has a restaurant in the city center where she offers breakfast, lunch, and typical regional dishes such as caldo de gallina criolla (traditional chicken broth), viche (thick fish soup with plantain), and seco de gallina (chicken stew cooked in a sauce of beer, onions, garlic, peppers, tomatoes, herbs and spices). She also manages the restaurant and employees an assistant. She has done this work for many years. Her restaurant is open Monday through Saturday from 6:30 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. During the rest of the afternoon she does housework and prepares for the following day's work. Over the years she has gained many loyal customers. The loan she is requesting will be invested in her business for the purchase of food supplies and kitchenware, so that she can offer the best service to her customers. María Auxiliadora's dream is to own a space that is big enough to have her restaurant in as well as to venture into clothing and cosmetics sales, which are both very profitable businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food supplies and kitchenware.

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: A. Françoise est née en 1965 au Bénin. Mariée et mère de six enfants, Françoise n'a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Françoise  a suivi une formation en couture, mais n’a pu l’achever faute de moyens financiers. Françoise s'est mise très tôt dans le petit commerce. Françoise a débuté avec la vente de bouillie, et depuis 15 ans déjà, elle s'est lancée dans la vente de riz et de sacs de jute. C’est à Dantokpa, marché internationale du Bénin que Françoise fait ses provisions. Pour augmenter le volume de son activité et capitaliser plus d’économie, Françoise sollicite un prêt auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de riz et sacs de jute

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita B. is a 38 year-old woman who lives in Tangal with her husband and one son and one daughter. Both her children are now studying.

Mrs. B. opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. She makes school uniforms for boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like kurta salwar, blouses, ladies’ long dresses, and other such clothes. Before starting her own business she trained In tailoring for six months.

Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of 30000 NPR to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en: Satenik G. lives in Yerevan and her only son lives and works in Russia. She worked in the National Library as a librarian until 1996. Then she rented place at the trade fair and began her business. She sells women’s and men’s clothes: blouses, pullovers, dresses and jackets. With the income of her business, Satenik was able to repair her apartment. She wants $3,000 to buy winter clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita A. is from the village of Bonbon Catarman, Camiguin. She is 39 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies, such as "bibingka", a typical Filipino rice cake, in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Mercedita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia CLORINDA tiene 32 años, es madre soltera, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia Clorinda tiene dos hijos: William tiene 15 años y Kayle tiene 7 años ambos estudian en el colegio.         
 
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de peluches. Ella vende sus peluches en las ferias dominicales en las plazas del Cusco. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más peluches y para esta época del año es cuando más vende.  
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
CLORINDA, 32, is from Cusco. She is a single mother of two sons: William, 15, and Kayle, 7; both are students. She is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” communal bank. She alternates her domestic responsibilities with the sale of stuffed toys. She sells them in the Sunday markets in Cusco's squares. She has been in this line of work for several years now and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working, enterprising woman who struggles to get her family ahead in life. She needs financing to buy more stuffed toys to stock during this high volume selling season. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stuffed toys.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El señor Edgar Rodriguez Diaz, paraguayo de estado civil soltero de 26 años de edad de profesión comerciante posee su comercio de celulares hace dos años vive en casa de sus padres en el barrio San Miguel del distrito de Cambyreta solicito el crédito para compra de mercaderias (accesorios y celulares)y tener un buen stock de mercaderias para este fin de año, también vende celulares y accesorios en las Colonias Unidas y cuenta con clientela formada y viaja hace ya cuatro años a vender sus mercaderias hacia las Colonias Unidas.
texts.en:
Mr. Edgar Rodriquez is single, 26 years of age, and lives in his parents' house in the Barrio San Miguel, District of Cambyreta. He is a merchant and has had his own cellular phone shop for 2 years.

Edgar is soliciting a loan to buy merchandise (accessories and cell phones), in order to have a good stock of merchandise for the end of the year. He also sells cell phones and accessories in Colonies United and can count on a dependable clientele. He has traveled to Colonies United for 4 years to sell his merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CELL PHONES AND ACCESSORIES TO SELL

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Va S., 48, is a widow and lives with her two children in Dangkao, Cambodia. S. is involved in the business of sewing clothes, purses, and wallets. She is able to earn an income of USD $10 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been engaged in this business since 2003. S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their business as well. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy a new sewing machine to expand her current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Maggi Isabel

texts.es:
Maggi Isabel B. tiene 20 años, llegó con sus padres y su hermano hace alrededor de 15  años desde Casacará, Departamento del Cesar; desde muy niña la necesidad la hizo pensar en generar ingresos porque no pudo seguir viviendo en el pueblo donde naciò, ya que el miedo de muchos de sus habitantes entre los que se cuentan su familia, los llevò a abandonar su tierra natal para llegar  a  Soledad, donde  encontrò instituciones internacionales que en su infancia le estimularon el habito de estudio, cuando le regalaron utiles escolares y libro de cuentos.  En ese entonces su madre apoyaba las campañas de alfabetizaciòn y ayudaba a mujeres en el cuidado y la complementacion de actividades acadèmicas de sus hijos, para generar algunos ingresos con el apoyo de Maggui; ese precisamente fuè el origen de un pequeño colegio en proceso de normatizaciòn  de su madre en el barrio Nuevo Milenio del Municipio de Soledad y donde Maggi tambien trabaja parte de su tiempo, pues es una joven muy productiva.   
Maggi tiene su propio negocio que iniciò con la ayuda de un programas de gobierno  el cual iniciò con un computador que aprendiò a operarlo; luego accediò a un crédito con la misma entidad para comprar otros equipos mas y aceder a la red de internet para luego gradualmente adicionar una fotocopiadora, una máquina reveladora y una máquina fotográfica. Al principio con un computador en su casa y muchos libros pestaba servicios bibliotecarios de consulta en el barrio,a estudiantesen en su barrio, donde la mayoria de vecinos son desplazados por el conflicto armado como su familia. Aunque parece que para Maggi eso es hoy parte de la historia, porque ella no quiere regresar a Casacará, como han hecho muchos de sus habitantes apoyados por el estado para su retorno;dice  que con sus negocios, ella y su mamà han logrado salir adelante, ayudar a su hermano menor y apoyar el ingreso de su padre al hogar, lo cual le ha proporcionado cierta estabilidad.
Maggi, al mismo tiempo que trabaja siempre ha estudiado y desde el nivel de educaciòn secundaria se ha enfocado en la pedagogia; actualmente estudia licenciatura en eduaciòn bàsica en la Universidad del Atlàntico; ella està en la busqueda de ganarse un escalafon en el sistema Educativo formal y por eso dia a dia se esfuerza por estudiar, asi como lo hizo cuando con su mami a clases, preparandose juntas para tener herramientas pedagogicas aplicables a su trabajo en el colegio; permitiendole a su madre cuidarla de cerca pues terminò el bachillerato a los 15 años. 
Maggi es una joven polifacètica le encanta el arte de fotografiar, por eso en su local ademàs de hacer fotomontajes, fotos para documentos y de tipo social, por ejemplo fotografias de bautizos, cumpleaños primeras comuniones etc. ayuda a la gente a acceder a la tencologia de internet y a hacer trasncripciones para presenter curriculos de trabajo, o para averiguar informaciòn de algun programa al que estan aplicando,  ya que en  esta comunidad  no es muy usual que la gente conozca el manejo de las herramientas de informatica y mucho menos tenga una red de internet personal a su disposicion y es menos comun saber acceder a ella. 
El negocio principal de Maggi es una sala de internet, donde ademas presta el servicio de fotocopiado, fotografia, fotomontaje, colajes para los niños, redacciones y transcripciones. Ella es una joven ejemplar, por su gran sentido de responsabilidad, su capacidad de trabajar y estudiar desarrollada desde muy niña  y su disposicion para acceder a los servicios que fortalecen su crecimiento personal y empresarial; asi fuè cuando le recomendaron ir a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo para obtener un crèdito que incrementara su capital de trabajo y para recibir asesorìa para formalizar su pequeño negocio a lo que ella inmediatamente accediò y en la actualidad su asesor Milgen Sanchez la està asesorando en este tràmite .
Con el actual y su primer credito por valor de $1.500.000, Maggi planea ampliar su negocio adecuando su sala de internet para tomar fotografias, hacer pendones publicitarios, con el fin de ser mas conocida por otras comunidades  cercanas. Ella considera que su negocio es muy estable, no tiene competencia en el barrio, por eso sus clientes muchas veces esperan en su puerta hasta que otro termine de acceder al servicio por el que vino al negocio.
Su principal desafio que es el de todos en la familia, trabajar intensamente para apoyar el tratamiento de su padre que sufrio un Accidente de trabajo y su programa de salud no alcanza a cubrir los medicamentos  que requiere para superar la situaciòn. De igual manera sueña con ayudar a su hermano a que desarrolle sus potencialidades y estudie en la universidad la carrera que le guste; mientras tanto ella sueña con subir de escalafon  en el sistema educativo y legalizar el colegio de su madre
Maggi  y su mama, describen su barrio, Nuevo Milenio, como una comunidad donde la mayoria son  desplazados, pero muy por encima de eso son gente solidaria y trabajadora; explica  que tuvieron que organizarse para que sus calles pasaran de ser un basurero a lo que es hòy,  ya que fuè producto de una invasion que el estado esta legalizando; sostiene que entre todos han contribuido a poner servicios publicos comunitarios  y  que a travès de su negocio contribuye a llevar tecnologia a los hogares mas pobres, pues son muchos, los que aun no tienen posibilidades de acceder a la redes de Internet y de conocer el manejo de la informatica.
texts.en:
Maggi Isabel B. is 20. She arrived from Casacará in the Cesar department with her parents and brother about 15 years ago. Ever since she was a little girl necessity make her think of generating income. She could not continue living in the town where she was born because of the fear of some of its inhabitants. This caused her to abandon the place where she was born and go to Soledad. There she found international institutions that encouraged her to study by giving her school supplies and a book of stories. At that time her mother supported the literacy campaigns, and she helped women in the care and completion of the academic activities of their children. She did this with Maggi’s help to generate some income. This was the start of a small school, which was part of her mother’s adjustment to the Nuevo Milenio neighborhood in the municipality of Soledad. Maggi also worked there part time; she is a very productive young woman. Maggi has her own business, which she started with the help of a government program. She started with a computer, which she learned to operate. Then she got a loan with the same entity to buy other equipment and access the Internet. Then she gradually added a photocopier, a developing machine, and a photography machine. At first she used a computer and a lot of books to offer librarian services from her house to neighborhood students. Most of the neighbors are displaced due to the armed conflict, just like her family. Although it may appear to be part of the story, Maggi does not want to return to Casacará like many people, who are supported by the state, have done. She says that with their businesses she and her mother have gotten ahead, helped her younger brother, and helped with the income her father brings home. This has given them some stability. At the same time that Maggi has worked she has always gone to school. She has been focusing on pedagogy since high school. She is currently studying for her degree in basic education from the Atlantic University. She is looking to win a place in the formal education system. Therefore, she studies hard everyday, just like she did with her mother. They prepared themselves together to have the pedagogy tools that applied to their work in the school. This allowed her mother to be close and take care of her. Magi got her high school degree at 15. Maggi is a multi-faceted young woman. She loves the art of photography. At her place she does more than photo montages, photos for documents, and social photos. For example, she does baptism photos, birthdays, and communions, etc. She helps people access the technology of the internet, make job resumes, or to find information about a program they are using. It is unusual in this community for the people to know how to use information tools, and even less common for them to have the use of the internet at their disposal. It is less likely that they know how to access the internet. Maggi’s main business is a large internet café, where she also offers photocopy, photography, photo montage, collages for children, editing, and transcription services. She is an exemplary young woman because of her great sense of responsibility, her work capacity, her studies since childhood, and her aptitude for accessing the services that strengthen her personal and business growth. That is how it was when they recommended that she go to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to get a loan to increase her working capital and to get an advisor to formalize her small business. She immediately got a counselor, Milgen Sanchez, who is currently advising her in this procedure. Maggi plans to expand her business using her current first loan for 1,500,000 COP. She will equip her internet café with the ability to take photos and make publicity banners. She will do this to become better known in nearby communities. She considers her business to be very stable. She does not have competition in the neighborhood, and many times her neighbors wait at her door for their turn to get the services they wish to access. Her main challenge is the same as with all families. She works intensely to support her father’s treatment. He suffered a work accident, and his health program does not cover the medications he needs to overcome the situation. She also dreams of helping her brother develop his potential and study for a career he would like in the university. Meanwhile, she dreams of climbing the ladder in the educational system and legalizing her mother’s school. Maggi and her mother describe their neighborhood, Nuevo Milenio, as a community where most are displaced. But, underneath it all, they are united and hard-working people. She explains that they had to organize themselves so that their streets would stop being a garbage dump into what it is now. It was a product of an invasion that the state is legalizing. Everyone has contributed to establishing community public services. Through her business she is contributing to bringing technology to the poorest homes. There are a lot of people who still cannot access the internet and do not know how to work with computers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Equip her photographic space and invest in publicity, especially banners that she designs

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Pedro viviendas surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser :  venta de mercaderías comestibles, despensa,  venta de lencerías, olería, modista, despensa , venta de comidas   etc. 
Cada señora realiza una actividad independiente para aumentar sus ingresos con el fin de ayudar a su familia.
La señora Analía trabaja con mucho esfuerzo en la venta de ropas esta actividad lo realiza de manera ambulante visitando a clientes para ofrecer sus productos, en ocasiones lo acompañan sus hijos para cargar con las mercaderías ya que resultan muy pesadas para ella sola.
Actualmente piensa surtir sus mercaderías con uniformes de colegios ya que la temporada escolar ya esta en curso.
Por ello quiere aprovechar la ocasión para sacar ventajas vendiendo sus mercaderías, así las demás integrantes también están organizando actividades similares ofrecer para la venta.
texts.en:
This group from the “Barrio San Pedro” apartments was formed following an information campaign in the neighborhood. All of the women are involved in productive activities, such as: food sales, pantry, linen goods, pottery, dressmaking, etc. The ladies run their own businesses in order to supplement their incomes and help their families. Analía puts a lot of effort into her clothing sales business. She sells on foot, visiting customers to offer them her merchandise. Sometimes her children go with her and help her carry her bundles, which are too heavy for her to carry alone. She plans to supplement her merchandise with school uniforms, now that the school year has begun. She wants to take advantage of this time in order to sell her merchandise. The other women in the group are also planning similar activities to increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine C. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Josephine is the group leader of a 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Josephine is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector managing a direct selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal use products such as cosmetics,clothes and apparel in the local community. Josephine has been managing her business for over a year and she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for this activity. 

In 2010, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Genesia Jacob Group

texts.en:
Genesia J., from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, is the 48-year-old leader of a five-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Genesia, who is married and has four grown children, owns and operates a general store that sells a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Genesia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, Genesia is requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 10000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Refugia

texts.es: Refugia E. quedo viuda hace años por lo que quedo sola. A pesar de su dolor ella ha podido salir adelante, esforzándose cada día. La Señora E. desea enjarrar una vivienda que esta construyendo  para poder habitarla necesita unos arreglos como poner piso cerámico y enjarrar las paredes por lo pronto. Ella se dedica ala venta de terrenos que se le heredo por sus padres.
texts.en:
Refugia E. has been widow for several years and lives alone. Through all the pain she has been able to get ahead and continues to strive each day. Sra. E. wants to plaster her house, which is currently under construction, so that she can make it livable. She wants to undertake a few projects, such as installing a ceramic floor and plastering the walls, sometime soon. Refugia is considering selling the land that she inherited from her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of her house (plaster the walls & install a ceramic floor)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa C. is from the village of Miputak. She is 37 years old. Rosa is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Rosa owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Segundo Jose

texts.es:
Segundo N. de 37 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín (barrio muy humilde, con casas de caña y  caminos de tierra y asfalto) de Guayaquil. Su casa es de caña y no cuenta con los servicios básicos. Su esposa le ayuda en la tienda cuando el sale a vender mariscos en una bicicleta. Ellos tienen dos hijos de 9 y 3 años. 

Segundo vendía mariscos en todo fortín repartiéndolos en bicicletas, pero como el era el único ingreso económico en su hogar decidió invertir sus ahorros en arroz, azúcar y construyo con caña la parte delantera de su casa para hacer una tienda. Poco a poco con la ayuda de su esposa pudo tener una pequeña tienda. 

Ahora el trabaja con su esposa en la tienda desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días, también vende mariscos en su tienda pero para tener mejores ingresos en ocasiones  el sale a vender mariscos en su bicicleta mientras que su esposa atiende la tienda. Venden arroz, bebidas, enlatados, mariscos etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas y azúcar para su tienda. En el futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento y que sus hijos puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Segundo N. is 37 years old and lives in a suburban area of Guayaquil called Fortín (a very humble neighborhood with reed homes and both dirt and asphalt roads). His house is made of cane and does not have have basic services. His wife helps him in the store when he goes out on his bike to sell shell fish. They have two children ages nine and three. Segundo used to sell shell fish all over Fortin on his bicycle, but since this was his only way of earning a living for his home, he decided to invest his savings in rice, sugar, and building a store in the front part of his home with cane. Bit by bit, with the help of his wife, he was able to build a small store. He now now works with his wife in the store from 6 in the morning until 9 every day. He sells shellfish in his store, but to earn more he occasionally goes out on his bike to sell while his wife looks after the store. They sell rice, drinks, canned food, shell fish, etc. He will buy rice, drinks, and sugar for his store with this loan. In the future, he would like to build a cement house and help his children study.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar, drinks

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Stela L. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Manolo Fortich Bukidnon. She is 26 years old and married. To make a living, Stela owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Stela has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Stela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Stela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Stela is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which also will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Stela from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Flamencos Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Collpani, se reúnen cada 28 días la  Asociación Comunal FLAMENCOS. Su presidenta es Gregoria Q. de 60 años, ella se dedica a vender productos de chifleria (medicina natural a base de yerbas), hace dos años y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. Gregoria tiene su puesto de venta en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto, en la zona 12 de Octubre y vende todos los días, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija. 
Las demás  integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios que se dedican a la comercialización, producción y servicio.
texts.en:
The FLAMECOS community group meets every 28 days at Collpani, a Pro Mujer office. Its president is Gregoria Q., 60, who has operated a business selling "chifleria" (a herbal medicine) for two years. She needs the loan to buy merchandise. Gregoria operates her business at the La Ceja market in the Bolivian city of El Alto. Her daughter helps her and they work there every day. The other members of the community group have various sales, production and service businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Essential supplies for various businesses

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda M. is a widow who lives in the Golden Rosary zone of Jonobjonob village, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. 

Veneranda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Veneranda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000 - uplifting her family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store, so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Veneranda M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz S. is from the village of Bug-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 20 years old and single. To make a living, Paz owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling cell phone electronic loads in different networks and also selling cellphone accessories in the local community. Paz has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Paz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Paz is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Paz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Alice E

texts.en: Alice E T. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 45 years old. Alice E is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Alice E raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice like "bordagol" and "mimis" for sale. Alice E has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Alice E joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alice E has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Alice E is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Alice E from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa Isabel U. tiene la edad de 54 años, es soltera y madre de 4 hijos, los cuales todos ya están casados y ninguno bajo su cargo.
Doña Rosa se dedica al comercio desde hace 20 años en el mercado municipal y hasta la fecha permanece con su negocio.
Ceprodel le ha otorgado seis créditos los cuales han sido para invertir en su negocio y hasta hace muy poco ella se dedicaba solamente a la venta de gaseosas, ya que decidió invertir también en abarroterías lo cual le ha permitido incrementar sus ventas.
Cabe mencionar que doña Rosa ha sido muy responsable con sus créditos y esto le ha permitido mantener un buen record crediticio.
texts.en:
Rosa Isabel U. is 54 years old, she is single and mother of 4 children, who are all already married and not in her care. Rosa has been in business for 20 years at the municipal market and has remained with her business to date. Ceprodel has granted her six loans which have been for investment in her business and until very recently she only sold sodas, then she decided to also invest groceries which has led to an increase in sales. It is worth mentioning that Rosa has been very responsible with her loans and this has enabled her keep a good credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, soap, oil, cookies, different flavors of coca cola, juices)

loans.name: Afiswa

texts.en:
Afiswa N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.  Afiswa has a business selling cooked food.  She has been in this business for 6 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Afiswa sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Afiswa has requested a loan of 40000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more  bunches of bananas, rice, Irish potatoes, cassava and maize flour for her restaurant. She also generates additional income through plaiting ladies hair.

The main business challenge(s) for Afiswa include; seasonality and the transportation of food staffs from the market to her restaurant.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are; improving her standards of living and to own a fully stocked restaurant.  

Afiswa lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies like rice, bunches of bananas, cassava,  Irish potatoes and maize flour

loans.name: Mariejo

texts.en:
Mariejo P., from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental, is 27 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mariejo owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mariejo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, Mariejo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unidos y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen sus compañerismo.
Asi ademas de los trabajos que relizan en forma conjunta para recaudar fondos, cada una tiene una activdad indepediente.
La mayoria de las integrantes se dedica a la cria de animales y hortalizas en la huertas que tienen en sus  casas.
Una de las ellas es la señora Veronica quien se dedica la cria de animales y rubros agrícolas.
Entre los animales que cria se encuentran, gallinas, patos, cerdos, y vacas.
Ella recurre a la venta de los animales en varias ocasiones durante el mes, cuando necesita dinero para su familia ya que el marido es agricultor y los dos ni cuentan con ingresos fijos periodicos.
Comenta que esta actividad es lo que en muchas ocasiones pudo salvar a la familia y que por ello es muy importante manten esta actividad.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de tejidos de alambres para la construccion de un corral para sus animales ya que facilitara el manejo de los mismos.
texts.en:
The members form a very unified group, and are capable of working together in activities that strengthen their camaraderie. In addition to their jobs, they work together to collect funds. Each one has her own independent business activity. The majority of the members raise animals and grow vegetables in the gardens that they have in their houses. One of the women is Veronica, who raises animals and agricultural items. Amongst the animals that she raises, you can find chickens, ducks, pigs, and cows.

She sells the animals on various occasions during the month, when she needs money for her family, since her husband is a farmer, and neither one counts on fixed periodical income. She says that this activity on many occasions was able to save the family and for that reason, it is very importan to maintain the activity. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of wire fencing in order to build a corral for her animals, since it will make it easier to handle them.

loans.use: To buy wire fencing

loans.name: Cecilia Margarita

texts.es: Cecilia Margarita Z. D. M. D. 42 años D. edad, es una persona muy responsable  y trabajadora la cual posee su propio negocio el cual se encuentra ubicado en el mercado D. San Martín, mismo municipio en el cual vive junto a dos hijos. Celia comercializa embutidos como: salchichas, jamón, chorizo y así mismo, alitas D. pollo congeladas, así mismo venD. carne D. pollo y bolsas D. aceite para cocinar. Cecilia solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo D. poder surtir aún más su negocio, ya que el mayor sueño D. ella es el D. poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que como ella es madre soltera, es la única que vela por el bienestar D. sus dos hijos, por lo que es D. mucha importancia obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Cecilia Margarita Z. D. M. is 42 years old, a very responsible and hardworking person who owns her own business in the San Martín market, the same town she lives with her children in. She sells cold cuts such as: sausage, ham, chorizo (highly seasoned pork sausage) and likewise sells frozen chicken wings, chicken, and bags of cooking oil. Cecilia requests the loan with a great desire to supply her store even more since her biggest dream is to improve her sales. Since she is a single mother she is the only one who can watch over all of her children’s welfare making it even more important to make profits.

loans.use: To buy cold cuts to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 32 years old. He is married and blessed with a three-year-old child.  For five years, he has been operating Shalom kiosk.  He sells foodstuff and other household goods in his shop.  He is able to employ two people in his business and he hopes to employ more people in the future.  In five years, he wants to open two more branches of his business.  He has requested 20,000 KES to buy rice and soda.

loans.use: To buy rice and soda

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more body cream, spray, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and mother. He has been working as a men's hairdresser for the past fifteen years. In 2005, he opened his own barber shop and started working independently. Due to his long experience in this occupation, he has a good number of clients passing by his shop. In addition to his haircutting service, he also sells gels and men’s perfumes in order to reinforce his business and his income. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Ameen s.a.l., a Kiva field partner, to increase his merchandise of perfumes and hair supplies. In the future, he hopes to open a new salon in order to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise of perfumes and hair supplies

loans.name: Kandahar Cluster Group A-Lugazi

texts.en:
34-year-old N. Marion says she has been operating her retail shop in Kandahar-Lugazi for 3 years. It is an enterprise she says she began with her own capital, mostly from the agricultural business she runs.  She says the inspiration to start the business was from her husband, who also helps her at her shop. 

Marion is a hardworking and devoted lady who belongs to Kandahar Cluster Group-Lugazi. Marion is happily married with 3 kids and she says her weekly profits total up to 100,000 shillings. For the future, she says she is looking to giving all her kids a worthwhile education. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more retail general merchandise to resell.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to resell

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zoraida; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de flores, ella tiene un puesto pequeño en el mercado El Molino, ella atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de flores. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar flores al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Comuzone I" communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Zoraida, who is 32 years old, single, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and a business selling flowers.  She has a small stand in the El Molino market, which she tends from 9:00 a.m to 5:00 p.m.  Zoraida would like to improve and expand her business, so she has requested this loan in order to buy flowers wholesale.

Ms. Zoraida is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy flowers wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy new carpentry tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more slippers, bags, blouses, jeans, trousers and other clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Yerlin Antonio

texts.es:
DESCRIPCION: Yerlin  trabaja como tecnico desde hace  3 años en el ministerio de educaciòn de Nueva Guinea, tiene 28 años de edad, este joven todos los fines de semana viaja  a su comunidad y regresa los lunes para incorporarse a su centro de trabajo, estudia en la universidad cada quince dias, vive con su mamà, este joven es un hombre bien responsable, honesto y bien trabajador  que ha luchado para  cumplir sus sueños el de brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones y que no le falte lo basico en el hogar.                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Por primera vez esta solicitando  crèdito con esta instituciòn atravez del apoyo de Kiva, el cual lo invertira en terminar de construir una habitaciòn asi gozar  de mejores condiciones junto a su  familia. 
Su sueño en la vida es tener salud y estabilidad laboral lo que le permitira ser cumplido con sus compromisos y llegar a terminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
DESCRIPTION:  Yerlin has worked as a Technician for the Ministry of Education for the last three years in Nueva Guinea.  He’s 28 years old.  He goes to his community every weekend and returns on Mondays to go to work.  He studies at the university every two weeks.  He lives with his mother.  This young man is quite responsible, honest and hard working. He has fought to make his dream of providing his family with better living conditions and that they not want for anything come true.

This is his first loan request with this institution through Kiva support.  He will use it to finish building a room thus enjoying better living conditions together with his family.

His dream in life is to have good health and job stability which will make it possible for him to meet his commitments and finish his university studies.

loans.use: To remodel a room.

loans.name: Ober

texts.es: Ober, de 28 años, es un hombre responsable y cumplido. Vive en compañía de su esposa Noemí y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Desde joven aprendió el trabajo agrícola, desde entonces siembra papa, olluco (tubérculos), productos que constantemente fertiliza, y en la que su esposa los cuida con mucha dedicación; obteniendo así una buena cosecha que son comercializados en el mercado central de su ciudad. Sin embargo hace medio año que incursionó en el negocio de compra y venta de frutas, en un mercado de la capital del país,  según menciona los días de mayor venta son los martes, viernes y domingos, ya que la venta es gran proporción de diferentes frutas que se producen en la selva del Perú. Ante esto, desea comprar un terreno en el mismo mercado, para iniciar con este negocio de frutas y no tener que pagar alquiler. Él pertenece al grupo comunal “nuevo amanecer renovado”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, y como único hombre, es responsable y trabajador. Ober, maneja un capital diario de 2 mil a 3 mil soles, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar toda variedad de frutas para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Ober, 28, is a responsible, dependable man living with his wife, Noemí, and their two children in a rented house located in the city of Tarma.  Since a young age he learned farming and since then has farmed potato and olluco (a tuber), products he constantly fertilizes and his wife cares for very diligently thereby obtaining a good harvest that’s sold in his city’s central market.  However, half a year ago he went into buying and selling fruit in a market in the nation’s capital.  According to what he tells us, the days of greatest sales are Tuesdays, Fridays and Sundays because sales consist, in large measure, in fruits produced in Perú’s jungle.  Because of this, he wants to buy a space in that same market to start this fruit business and not have to pay rent.
