He is a member of the “Nuevo Amanecer Renovado” (New Renewed Dawn) and this is his fifth loan with MFP.  As the only male member, he is responsible and hard working.  Ober handles a daily capital of around 2000 to 3000 soles so he’s planning on using the loan to buy a great variety of fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Mrs. Soem was born in 1946.  She has two children, one of whom is a construction worker and the other does housework.   Mrs. Soem is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell as well as to feed her family.  Her husband, Mr. Sariem, is a consultant.  Mrs. Soem has a problem because her husband’s work place is far away from her home.  To improve this situation, Mrs. Soem is applying for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for his transportation.

loans.use: buy a new motorcycle for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Emiliano Zapata Jicayan Group

texts.es:
Emiliano Zapata Jicayan este es un grupo solidario perteneciente a la población de San Juan Jicayan un lugar donde la gente es raza indígena, la mayoría de la gente de esta población se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas y al campo. Este grupo esta integrado por 5 mujeres que se conocen entre si ya que son vecinas de la misma calles que lleva por nombre su grupo. 
La representante de este grupo es la señora María Mejía López de 53 años de edad quien esta casada con el señor José C. R. que se dedica al trabajo en el campo, ella tuvo 10 hijos de los cuales 3 están muertos y 7viven. María se dedica  a la venta de dulces como: paletas de diferentes colores, caramelos, chicles, bombones, frituras, entre otros. Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar más productos y tener más surtido para así tener más ganancia para los gastos familiares.
Soledad H. M. de 42 años esta casada con el señor Perfecto C. López quien se dedica a trabajar en el campo. Tiene 3 hijos de los cuales  2 estudian la secundaria y 1 estudia la primaria. Soledad se dedica a la elaboración de pan para la venta, ella inicio este negocio desde hace dos años debido a la necesidad que tenia, ya que sus hijos necesitaban mas dinero para los gastos de la escuela, había ocasiones en que no tenían para comer ya que todo se iba en los gastos de los útiles escolares. Es por ello que se animo a elaborar pan y así sacar un poco de ganancia para apoyar con los gastos familiares.
Soledad comenta que ah tenido buenas ventas, ya que siempre acaba sus productos todos los días. Ella solicito el crédito para comprar azúcar, harina, manteca, levadura ya que tiene un pedido de 1000 panes y no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprar los productos que le hacen falta. 
Soledad agradece a FRAC por el préstamo otorgado y a las personas de KIVA que prestan dinero.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
María Mejía López: De 53 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes para la venta.
Soledad H. M.: De 42 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de pana para la venta.
Guadalupe T. Guzmán: De 31 años de edad se dedica a la compra de dulces para la venta.
Amada C. R.: De 46 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes para la venta.
Fabiola C. Mejía: De 20 años de edad se dedica a la compra de dulces para la venta.
texts.en:
The Emiliano Zapata Jicayan support group is from San Juan Jicayan, a place mainly inhabited by native indians who make table linens and have agricultural related activites.  This group is comprised of five women who all know each other and live on the same street which gives the group its name.

The group representative is Mrs. María Mejía López who is 53 years old and married to Mr. José C. R., a farmer.  She had ten children, three of whom have already passed away.  María sells sweets such as lollipops, caramels, chewing gum, bon-bons,  and fried products.  She has requested a loan to buy more products to expand inventory and increase her income to cover family expenses.

Soledad H. M. is 42 years old and married to Mr. Perfecto C. López, a farmer.  They have three children, two of which are in high school and another in primary school.  Soledad makes and sells bread.  She began her business two years ago out of necessity and in order to cover her children's school costs.  There were even times when there was not enough money to put food on the table because the money was spent on school supplies.  Making bread was a way of earning enough to help with the family expenses.

Soledad says sales have been going well and by the end of each day all of her products have been sold.  She is requesting a loan to buy sugar, flour, lard and yeast for an order of 1,000 loaves of bread since she cannot afford to buy all the ingredients she needs.  She is grateful to FRAC and to the KIVA lenders for the loan.

The members in this group are:

María Mejía López: 53, who buys and sells groceries  
Soledad H. M.: 42, who bakes and sells bread
Guadalupe T. Guzmán: 31, who buys and sells sweets 
Amada C. R.: 46, who buys and sells groceries   
Fabiola C. Mejía: 20, who buys and sells sweets

loans.use: To buy soap, sugar, toilet tissue, detergent, etc. for retail sale

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida B. is from the village of Mimbunga, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Elida is married and has one infant-aged children. To make a living, Elida owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, biscuits, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. Elida has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Elida is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory like canned goods and junk food. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Elida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory like canned goods and junk food for sale

loans.name: Blanca Yolanda

texts.es:
Blanca de 21, es una joven emprendedora que inicio en su negocio de venta de Cd para ayudar económicamente a sus padres.

Ella trabaja con esfuerzo y dedicacion diariamente vendiendo películas en Cd. Con el préstamo desea compras mas Cd de películas para mejorar sus ingresos y así comprar una maquina copiadora para aumentar sus ganancias y darle lo mejor a sus padres y en los estudios.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 21, is a young entrepreneur who began selling DVD's to help her parents economically.

She works hard and dedicates every day to selling her movie DVD's.  She plans to use the loan to buy more DVD's so she can improve her income and buy a copying machine.  This will help increase her earnings for education expenses and to give her parents a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy DVD's to increase sales

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica es una persona soltera de 50 años de edad,  tiene casa propia que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz y desagüe),  la cual está ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo. Esta  zona se caracteriza por ser  muy comercial, turística y dedicarse a la agricultura en los distritos cercanos.

Angelica se dedica a vender comida en el mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo, cuenta con un puesto propio donde su clientela  llega a degustar sus ricas comidas que prepara. Sus clientes son los mismos vendedores de dicho mercado, con  los ingresos que le genera la venta de su comida puede mejorar su calidad de vida.

Angelica ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para mejorar su puesto de comida (comprando inmobiliario como: sillas, bancas y utensilios de cocina), quiere hacerlo un poco más grande ya que por la cantidad de clientela que tiene, desea brindarles  un mejor servicio y comodidad, permitiéndole  generar más ventas y poder solventar todas sus necesidades diarias.

Angelica es una mujer dedicada a su trabajo que con esfuerzo y empeño desea tener más adelante poder tener un restaurante grande y bonito.
texts.en:
Angelica is 50 years old and single.  She owns her own home which has basic services (water, electricity and sewerage) and is located in Chiclayo province.  This area is noted for being a very commercial area with a lot of tourism.  The residents of neighboring districts work in agriculture.

Angelica sells food in the Mercado Modelo market, in the city of Chiclayo.  She has her own stall where her customers come to taste the delicious food that she prepares.  Her customers are other market traders.  She uses the income from her food business to improve her quality of life.

Angelica has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can improve her food stall (buying furniture such as chairs, benches and also cooking utensils).  She would like to make her sales location a little larger so that she can provide her customers with a better service and greater comfort.  This will allow her to make more sales and cover all her daily needs.

Angelica is a woman who is committed to her work and she works with effort and dedication.  In the future, she would like to own a large and smart restaurant.

loans.use: to improve her food stall

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Segundina; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el restaurant, ella vende desayunos y también almuerzos, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, también la socia vende chicha (bebida a base de maíz), la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO" which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Segundina, age 50, has a live-in partner and two children.  She alternates her daily activities with running a restaurant where she offers breakfast and lunch.  Her work hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.  She also sells "chicha" (a corn-based drink).  She wants to expand and improve her restaurant business and is requesting a loan to buy cooking ingredients such as meat, vegetables and chicken.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients such as meat, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Luz 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Luz II" debido a que consideran que la luz siempre está presente en sus corazones. Está ubicado en Hidalgo, México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes y es la cuarta vez que solicitan un prestamo. 

La señora Alfonsa es integrante del grupo. Ella tiene 57 años, estudió la primaria y es cocinera. Tiene una cocina económica desde hace tres años, por su experiencia de cocinera ahora es las mejores que guisa. Sus clientes nos comentan que Doña Alfonsa es una excelente cocinera pues sus guisos son tradicionales y con gran sazón. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta. Quiere este prestamo para comprar insumos y materia prima como lo son verduras, especies, carnes, gas, etc. También espera que aumenten sus ventas y así poder comprar más mesas y así hacer más grande su negocio. Con las ganancias qeu obtenga seguira invirtiendo en insumos, ampliar su negocio y apoyar a su familia en los gastos economicos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Luz II” (Light II) because the members believe that light is always in their hearts.  They meet in Hidalgo, Mexico.  There are nine members and this is the fourth time they have applied for a loan.  

Sra. Alfonsa is a member of the group.  She is 57 years old, has an elementary school education, and works as a cook.  Alfonsa has managed a diner for three years and her experience in the kitchen has now brought out the best in her cooking.  Her customers say that Doña Alfonsa is an excellent cook because her recipes are traditional and have great flavor.  She was very pleased at the time she requested her loan.  Alfonsa wants to use the funds to buy supplies and ingredients such as vegetables, spices, meats, gas, and other items.  She also hopes to increase her sales so that she can buy more tables to expand her business.  With the profits she earns, Alfonsa will be able to continue investing in supplies, expand her business, and support her family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, spices, meats, gas, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic bowls, buckets and kitchen utensils for her business inventory.

loans.name: Aliceson

texts.en:
Aliceson’s motivation for starting her daycare center, Kingdom Kidz Academy, was that, as she says, “providing young parents with affordable and reliable daycare services is the only way to put Texas back to work.” She started Kingdom Kidz because she saw a need in her Katy, Texas community for young, working parents to have access to reasonably priced daycare services. Without this access, she says these parents could not afford to go to work each day.

What makes Kingdom Kidz special doesn’t end there, however, because walking into the Kingdom Kidz is less like walking into a playpen and more like walking into a school. Aliceson splits the children’s time into activity time, during which students are able to play and interact freely with each other, and what she calls curriculum time. During curriculum time, the young students work with math, reading and computer literacy tasks. “I have a big, loving heart, but I also have very high expectations for education,” she says.

Aliceson feels that her biggest business success to date has been seeing children as young as one beginning to read. Though Aliceson has seen impressive success with her current location, she hopes to extend her reach by opening multiple locations that provide the same excellent service as her current center. “My goal is to see an excellent academic rate, with the children under my care more than ready for elementary school when they leave my center.”

Along the impressive results her program produces, Aliceson attributes her business success to the joy she brings to her children. She says that one of the biggest challenges in her business is becoming a household name that parents can trust. She built this trust by creating a comfortable and stimulating environment for her children – one which they are sometimes reluctant to leave. “By the end of the day, the children don’t want to go home, and they are excited to come back the next morning.”

With this loan, Aliceson will build an even stronger learning environment for her young students. She will purchase arts and crafts supplies, a laminator, a computer (with which children can learn basic computer skills), and blocks. With the remainder of the loan, she says she will buy things she can utilize to make her curriculum better, such as printers and planning documents.

Without this loan, Aliceson would not be able to obtain the resources necessary to reach the high expectations she holds for her children’s education. She reached out to the Kiva partner Accion Texas-Louisiana after being denied a loan at a commercial bank. Not only will this loan allow Aliceson to continue her mission of putting Texas back to work, it will help her to continue building a bright future for the children under her care and for her community.

loans.use: to pay for arts and crafts supplies, a laminator, a computer, and curriculum materials.

loans.name: Piter

texts.es:
Piter es Técnico en mantenimiento de computadores y desde que terminó sus estudios realiza a domicilio trabajos de reparación y mantenimiento en quipos de computo.

El quiere poder un negocio que le permita tener los repuestos necesarios para ofrecerles a sus clientes un mejor servicio, además así podría mejora su clientela y su nivel económico.

Piter quiere que sus 4 hijos tengan estudio y un buena calidad de vida, por esto trabaja muy dura para poder brindarles las comodidades básicas que su trabajo le permite darles.
texts.en:
Piter is a computer service technician.  Since finishing his training he's been providing in-home computer repair and maintenance services.  He’d like to have a business stocked with the necessary replacement parts to be able to offer his customers better service.  Besides, this will improve his clientele and his economic standard.

Piter would like his four children to have an education and good quality of life.  This is why he works so hard to provide them the basic comforts that his work allows him to give them.

loans.use: to buy computer spare parts.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.en:
Eulogio is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is separated and has 6 children. 

Eulogio has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Eulogio is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Eulogio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is married with one child. Ester is 55 years old and lives in Ozamiz City.

Ester sells fashion jewelry to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 25,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase more beads for her fashion jewelry sales business.

Ester has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more beads for her fashion jewelry sales business

loans.name: Yabar

texts.es: Yabar tiene 44 años, es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de dos años y otro de un mes de nacido, vive en casa propia. El trabajo de Yabar consiste en salir temprano de su hogar en busca de cargamento en el mercado de Bellavista. Ahí él tiene clientes a quienes presta el servicio de transporte de mercaderías, y por las tardes él se va al mercado mayorista para seguir con ese trabajo, Lleva haciendo este trabajo ya por aproximadamente cinco años, y lo hace solo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene su tiempo a disposición, además que siempre tiene clientes ya que es un muy cuidadoso cuando le toca hacer transporte de la mercadería. Espera poder mantenerse como hasta ahora ya que tiene un trabajo fuerte y por el momento no puede exigirse mucho. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, está contento con el grupo que conforma y espera poder seguir recibiendo más préstamos de la institución ya que gracias a los desembolsos recibidos comprar un vehículo ya que antes  trabajaba en triciclo. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, el realizará el pago de su moto y hacerle algunos ajustes técnicos.
texts.en:
Yabar, 44, is a hardworking and very responsible man, who lives in a committed relationship with his partner with whom he has two children, two years old and the other a newborn of one month. He lives in his own home. Yabar's work consists of leaving his home early in search of cargo in the marketplace of Bellavista. There he has customers to whom he provides transportation services for merchandise. In the afternoons he goes to the wholesale market to continue working. He has been doing this work now for approximately five years, and works alone. What he likes about his work is that he is on his own time, and also that he always has customers, since he is super careful when it comes to transporting merchandise. He hopes to keep on the way he has been up to now, since he has a lot of work and for the time being is not able to demand much mO. of himself. 

This is his fourth loan with MFP. He is happy with the group he belongs to and hopes to continue receiving mO. loans from the institution. Thanks to the disbursements he has received he bought a vehicle, since befO. he was working by tricycle. With the 1,000 soles he has requested he will make payments on his motorcycle, as well as some technical adjustments to it.

loans.use: to finish paying off the vehicle he uses to transport wholesale merchandise.

loans.name: Clara Janet

texts.es:
Clara de 30 años es madre de familia, vive con su hija en casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.    Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Clara se dedica a la venta de ropa de damas y caballeros negocio que a colocado en un puesto en el interior del mercado de Cayaltí desde hace unos 4 años, su mercadería lo ofrece a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
30-year-old Clara is a mother who lives with her daughter in her own home which only has water and electricity.  Her house is located in Cayaltí district, in Chiclayo province.  This area is noted fro its farming and livestock raising.

Clara sells men's and women's clothes.  She set up her business on a stall inside Cayaltí market four years ago.  She sells her merchandise to her customers and also sells to order, trying to gain more customer demand so that she can make more income with which to cover her family expenses.

Noting that her business was doing very well, Clara decided that it was necessary to request a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy a larger quantity of merchandise and stock her store with the very latest products.  Her aim is to continue increasing her number of customers so that she can repay her loan and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of merchandise for her business

loans.name: Kimatullo

texts.ru: Киматулло проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него трое сыновей. Его жена предоставляет услугу, занимается шитьем платьев. А его дети учатся в средней школе. Сам Киматулло занимается животноводством. В этой области он уже четыре года. Он берет кредит для закупа телят, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Kimatullo lives in the Bohtar district.  He is 36 years old, married and has three sons.  His wife provides a service and is involved in sewing dresses.  And their children attend a secondary school.  Kimatullo is involved in animal husbandry.  He has been in this business for four years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves in order to increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: C5664 Umucyo Group

texts.en: Thomas is 27 years old and he is single. He owns a business for selling soap and cooking oil. Thomas is the leader of this group, which is called "Umucyo" in the local language. He is the first person on the left side. Thomas has been in this business for about one year and his business is open from 6 am until 6 pm every day. He employees one person to help him. Thomas and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to increase their quantities of soap and cooking oil to sell. Thomas and his team will reinvest their profits into their businesses and save for their future.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Jonathan's Group

texts.es:
Jonathan's group está conformado por tres personas (hombres). En este grupo el presidente es Jonathan, que tiene 21 años es soltero y tiene un hijo de 3 años. Vive en San Gabriel con sus padres y su hijo. Se considera una persona muy trabajadora.

Trabaja con sus padres en su negocio de Tapicería, empezó a trabajar desde que tuvo a su hijo ya que necesitaba cuidarle y mantenerle. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de cuero para realizar los tapizados, que le ayudará a tener una productividad y mejores ingresos.

Su sueño es poder tener sucursales de su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y así mantener a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jonathan's group is made up of three men.  This group's president is 21-year-old Jonathan who is single and has a 3-year-old son.  He lives in San Gabriel with his parents and his son.  He considers himself to be a very hard-working person.

Jonathan works with his parents in an upholstery business.  He started working when his son was born as he needed to care for him and support him.  This is the first loan that he has requested from Fodemi and he will use it to buy leather for making upholstery.  This will help him to improve his productivity and his income.

Jonathan's dream is to be able to have more branches of his business so that he can improve his income and thereby provide for his son.

loans.use: to buy leather for making upholstery

loans.name: Silina

texts.en:
Silina is 26 years old.  She is a married woman and has five children, three of them are in school.  She has had food stall business in Yei, South Sudan,  for four years.

Silina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and tomatoes.  She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: buy tomatoes and onions for her food stall

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, none of whom go to school. She has two additional family members (her grandchildren). She lives in a rented house and the family doesn’t have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent.

She sells tomatoes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She works seven days a week. Agnes has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes and vegetables. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to start selling different types of vegetables at the market.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: La señora Zaida nacida en santa Cruz, es casada con el señor Antonio tienen  dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando,   viven en la zona del kilometro 9 por mas de 20 años, ella se dedica a  la venta de ropa que ella confecciona, y miércoles y sábado  entrega la ropa que ella elabora  a distintos puestos de venta que le hacen pedidos, entrega al por mayor pero también vende por menor, ella trabaja junto a su hermana  quien le ayuda dos veces por semana a la entrega de los pedidos, y los demás días le ayuda en lo que es la confección de prendas de vestir, con el dinero del crédito comprara tela por rollo e hilos para la confección de prendas de vestir, la Sra. Zaida es una persona muy trabajadora se esfuerza cada día par dar un futuro mejor a sus hijos, su deseo es poder tener un taller mas grande y emplear mano de obra y poder expandir sus prendas de vestir a las ciudades de Cochabamba y Tarija.
texts.en:
Señora Zaida was born in Santa Cruz.  She is married to Señor Antonio; they have two children who attend school.  They have been living in the Kilometer 9 area for more than 20 years.  

She works selling clothes that she sews, and on Wednesdays and Saturdays she delivers the clothes that she has made to several sales locations that have placed orders.  She makes her deliveries at wholesale, but also sells direct.  She works together with her sister, who helps her out twice a week with delivering the orders, and on the other days helps her with sewing the clothing.

With the money from the loan, she will buy rolls of fabric and thread for sewing clothing.  

Señora Zaida is a very hard-working person who strives each day for a better future for her children.  Her desire is to have a much bigger workshop and employ workers, and to be able to expand selling her clothes to Cochabamba an Tarija

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric and thread for sewing clothing.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis es jubilado y recibe renta al igual que su esposa. El crédito lo requiere para un tratamiento médico general  para su esposa, pues necesita hacerse el chequeo anual y no tienen seguro médico. José tiene dos hijos .Vive en casa en anticrético la misma queda ubicada en la zona  de Achumani  de la Ciudad de La Paz. El  cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con el crédito otorgado ya que le ayudara a su esposa a estar mejor de salud. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Impro y también con kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. José Luis is retired. He and his wife receive a pension. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for general medical treatment for his wife who needs her annual checkup. They do not have medical insurance. José Luis has two children and lives in a rented house in the District of Achumani in the city of La Paz.

He is very pleased with the loan that has been granted because it will help his wife stay healthy. This is the first time José Luis has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical checkup.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Edna has a shop that sells food seasoning, spices and vegetables like cabbages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy food seasoning, spices and vegetables to sell.

Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasoning, spices and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fuelwood and feed for chicks and fowl.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelia is 39 years old and four of her children are in school.

Nelia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Nelia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 41 years old and resides in Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is married and has five children. 

Raquel owns farmland and operates a business, planting and harvesting rice to sell to earn a living.  She has been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

In 2010, Raquel joined GDMPC on order to gain access to financial services to help improve both her business and her living situation.  In the future, Raquel wants to make improvements to her house and increase her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Jamieleh

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Jamieleh prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Jamieleh is a 46-year-old married woman who has five family members. She is from Al Koorah, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new electronics. In the future she hopes to repaint her home.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Sharifamo

texts.ru:
39 летняя женщина Шарифамо. Она живет в городе под названием Куляб. Шарифамо замужем и имеет троих детей. Шарифамо у себя дома предоставляет услуги портнихи. Она шьет "курпа" и "курпача.    
"Курпа" и "курпача"- это ватные матрасы. "Курпа" шьют стандартно квадратном размере, ее используют в качестве одеяла. Курпача длинные матрасы используется как диваны. Шарифамо более 10 лет занимается изготовлением "курпа" и "курпача". 
Ее муж опытный мастер, он занимается ремонтом дома уже 20 лет. Муж Шарифамо честный и ответственный человек. Ее муж хочет купить строй инструменты, чтобы улучшить и расширить деятельность.  Но для приобретения строй инструментов у него не хватает денег. Шарифамо решила помочь мужу приобрести строй инструменты. По этой причине Шарифамо обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить строй инструменты для мужа. Шарифамо верит и надеется на поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
Sharifamo is 39 years old.  She lives in Kulob.  She is married and the mother of three children.  She works as a seamstress from home and sews "kurpas" and "kurpachas".  Kurpas and kurpachas are cotton mattresses.  The kurpa is usually made in a square shape and used for bedding. The kurpacha is a long mattress used as seating.  Sharifamo has been sewing both items for more than 10 years.

Sharifamo's husband is an experienced foreman who's been renovating houses for 20 years.  He is an honest and responsible man.  Sharifamo's husband wants to buy construction tools in order to improve and expand his activity.  However, he doesn't have enough money to buy these tools.  Because of this lack of funds, Sharifamo is taking a loan.  She confidently awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and increase her activity.

loans.name: Chan To

texts.en:
S. Chan To manages a busy household. She takes care of her three sons, two daughters, and her mother-in-law while she runs her vegetable sales business. S. Chan To earns about $2.50 per day from her vegetable sales. She also rents out a room in their house and earns about $60 a month from this. S. Chan To's husband runs a hardware and used goods store. He earns about $75 a month from this store. 

S. Chan To is requesting a loan for $1,000 in order to purchase a tuk tuk and to repair their home. She plans on using $800 to purchase the tuk tuk (a passenger taxi cart attached to a motor bike), and $200 to repair their home. The tuk tuk will provide them with additional income, as well as provide a way for them to better transport their goods when needed. The repairs to the home will allow them to make the room they rent nicer, so that they may earn a greater income from it in the future.

loans.use: Purchase tuk tuk and prepare home for renting.

loans.name: Hidayat

texts.en:
Hidayat is 62 years old, married, has 4 children and lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region.
He works hard for the success of his children. He likes to breed pedigree ewes.
Hidayat has had his business for 10 years and it allows him to support his family. He wants to offer  an education to all  his children that allows them to continue their own lives and to be an honest and hard-working people.
Now he needs a loan of $500 to buy 10 pedigree ewes.

loans.use: To buy 10 pedigree ewes

loans.name: Taofi

texts.en:
Taofi has ten years' experience in operating a grocery store but she now wants to expand the commodities available on her shelves to attract more customers.

From the village of Aele, a settlement for Solomons and Papua New Guinea people in the olden days, her village is cut off from town. Taofi’s store is one of two operating stores in the small village.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the store, such as boxes of chicken, turkey tails and herring

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: O. Ismayil started his business in 2001 with a loan from Aqroinvest CU when he purchased a calf.  This calf is now a milk cow. Ismayil is 36 years old, married and has one child. Because of the difficult economic conditions of his family, he would like to broaden his business and borrow 1200 USD to purchase one cow and a calf.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Azad

texts.en:
Azad H. is an Internally Displaced Person from Fuzuli. He now lives in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan with his wife and three children.  He runs a potato-selling business, in which he purchases potatoes from other regions of Azerbaijan and brings them to the Beylagan city bazaar. He currently sells to both families and to other bazaar shopowners and has two employees. The demand for his potatoes is so large that he sells out very quickly and is not able to work a full day as he has no products left.
He would like to borrow $1,000 in order to make a bulk purchase so that he can maximize his sales and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.es:
Cleotilde is a very hard-working married mother of two children, ages 15 and 22. Due to the lack of steady work for her husband, she repaired household appliances to help when times were tough. She started selling jewelry five years ago with the help of her husband, who supplied the first orders. Now her sales have increased a lot and she wants to keep growing the business and see her children finish their studies so they can have a better future.

Currently, Cleotilde is requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to purchase supplies so she can cover the demand for her products. She plans to repay the loan within six months. Play a fundamental role in the development of her business and help Cleotilde and her family. They are very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Cleotilde es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene dos hijos, de 15 y 22 años de edad, ante la falta de empleo su esposo se dedica a la reparación de electrodomésticos por su cuenta y en ocasiones la escasez de trabajo le impide recibir un ingreso, para apoyar a su esposo Cleotilde comenzó a vender joyería hace cinco años con ayuda de su esposo para surtir los primeros pedidos, ahora sus ventas han mejorado mucho y ella desea continuar creciendo con su negocio, pues desea que sus hijos culminen sus estudios para que puedan tener un mejor futuro.

En estos momentos Cleotilde necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía y se compromete a devolver en 6 meses, con esto ella espera poder cubrir la demanda por sus productos. Se parte fundamental en el desarrollo de este negocio, decídete a ayudar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abra S. was born on January 7, 1954 in Kouvé (province of Yoto); she is married and mother of two children. She is a typist by training. Not being able to find work in this field, she used her small savings to open a little grocery store. To better serve her customers, she is asking for a loan of US$ 300 to expand her business. This amount will allow her to stock cooking oil, rice and such.

Madame S. Abra est née le 07 janvier 1954 à Kouvé (P/Yoto), mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Elle est dactylographe de formation. Ne trouvant pas d’emploi, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits alimentaires avec sa petite économie. Pour mieux répondre aux désirs de ses clients, elle sollicite un crédit de $300 pour agrandir son commerce. Ceci lui permettra de faire un stock d’huile, de riz et autres.

loans.use: Adding cooking oil, rice and such to her inventory  Stockage d'huile,de riz et autres

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mrs. Yun Y., 39, is the mother of four children and works selling flowers at an open-air market, earning typically around US$ 3/day in revenue. Her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and makes about US$ 5 per day. Mrs. Yun Y. hopes to use this loan to invest in her flower business and to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business as transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business as transportation

loans.name: Antonia's Group

texts.en:
Flor de Maria, Antonia, and Martha have been part of the community bank “Retoño” for 1, 2, and 11 years respectively.  In their community bank they have learned to be punctual, responsible, how to invest their money, and above all to save.  FurthermO., the loans that they have received make it possible for them to start and expand their businesses.
Flor de Maria is 35 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Flor de Maria owns a car and uses it to transport people between towns in the region of Vilcas Huaman.  She has had this business for five years.  Previously, she ran a small stO. in her town, but now her mother is managing it for her.  During the upcoming carnival Flor de Maria will bring beer, paper beads, and face paints to her town and sell them.  In the future Flor de Maria hopes to buy a second car.
Antonia is also 35 years old.  She is separated and has two children.  Antonia travels to different markets around the region where she sells food staples such as sugar, and flour.  From the markets she buys whole grains and cheese that she sells in the city of Ayacucho.  Antonia is thinking of starting a new business selling roasted potatoes.
Meanwhile, Marths is 39 years old.  She lives with her partner and seven children.  Martha processes grains, which she buys from the countryside, in her home and then sells them in Ayacucho.  In addition, with the help of her children she makes and sells roasted potatoes.
Flor de Maria, Antonia, and Martha need loans of 1600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying beer, paints, beads, rice, sugar, potatoes, wheat, and barley.
The community bank emphasizes saving and each associate has an interest earning account. Flor de Maria, Antonia, and Martha plan to use their savings to buy land and improve their homes.  Their dreams are to eventually have a nice home, buy a house, see their businesses continue to develop, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Flor de Maria, Antonia, and Martha need loans of 1600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying beer, paints, beads, rice, sugar, potatoes, wheat, and barley.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Mrs. O. Sona and her husband have been married since 2002 and have one daughter.

Sona has been a tailor for one year. It’s a skill she learned in Phnom Penh.

Meanwhile, her husband has sold second-hand cars in Phnom Penh for nine years. Sona and her family live with her parents across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

She is requesting her sixth loan in the amount of $1,000 from MAXIMA. She will use this money to purchase cloth and a machine for sewing.

loans.use: To purchasing cloth and a machine for sewing.

loans.name: Silvia Gonçalves

texts.pt:
Silvia Gonçalves D. V. was born in Boane in 1982. She studied until the 9th grade. She had to quit school because she had children. She has 2 daughters the oldest one is 5 years old. She married when she was 20. In 2004 she started her business. Silvia learned about HLUVUKU ADSEMA through friends. She had never worked with credit institutions before but this is already her 3rd loan. Her first loan was of 7.200,00MT, the second 10.000,00MT. These were used to increase her inventory and both repaid in full.

Silvia is requesting a loan of 16.000MT to buy more products. With his loan she wants to increase her monthly income and have different products to attract more clients. In the future she wants to have enough credit to improve her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 03 – Boane Cliente: Sílvia Gonçalves D. V. Actividade: comercio Valor de Empréstimo: 16.000MT Aplicação: Compra de produtos de primeira necessidade Inicio:11/03/2008 Fim: 31/08/2009

Sílvia Gonçalves D. V., nasceu em Boane aos 23/11/1982. Estudou ate a 9ª classe. Parou de estudar ceD. porque teve filhos precoce e não tinha com quem deixa-los para continuar com os estudos. Tem 2 filhas a mais velha com 6 anos de idade, Casou com 20 anos. 2004 foi o ano que começou a exercer a sua actividade. Conhece a HLUVUKU ADSEMA Graças as amigas tambem comerciantes da zona. Nunca trabalhou com instituições de credito é pela 1ª vez que lida com credito atraves da HLUVUKU, senD. 3ª vez que solicita emprestimo nesta instituicao. Teve o seu primeiro credito no valor de 7.200,00MT e o segunD. no valor de 10.000,00MT, todos foram para aumentar o stock no seu negocio, tenD. pago todos sem problemas e agora pretende outro no valor de 16.000MT para aplicar no mesmo negocio na compra de produtos diversos.

Com este credito espera aumentar a renda mensal e vai aplicar uma parte no melhoramenta da sua residencia, uma vez que com diversificacao de produtos ira atrair mais clientela. A sua perspectiva Futura e ter outro credito para aplicar no melhoramento e apetrechamento da sua residencia.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Matha's Ngarani Group

texts.en:
Matha is 49 years old and is married with 6 children whose ages range from 9 to 20 years old. Matha owns a small shop, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (like sugar, salt, blue band) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in food vending, fish sales, and soap sales.

loans.use: To buy more items (such as sugar, salt, and blue band) for her business.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.ru:
Rajab H. is a resident of the Rudaki region. He is 35 years old, is married and has 3 children. He has a high school education. Rajab purchases and sells small horned livestock. This business is the sole source of income for his family. Since Rajab’s parents are pensioners he needs to support their family as well. Today, he would like to purchase a small herd of goats an to send them to graze. This will allow him to earn a small profit. He has decided to take out a 7 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанов Раджаб житель района Рудаки. Возраст 35 лет , женат , имеет 3 детей. Образование средние. Раджаб занимается куплей продажей мелкого рогатого скота. Эта деятельность является единственным источником дохода его семьи.Так как родители Раджаба пенсионеры ему приходится содержать и их семью.Сейчас он хочет закупить небольшую отару коз и отправить на пастбище . После чего он сможет получить неплохой доход . Поэтому клиент решил взять кредит сроком на 7 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase goats

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es:
For more than ten years, Irma Yolanda has dedicated herself to raising chickens at her house. She buys them when they are small, feeds them, then sells them either from her home or at the San Martín Jilotepeque market.

Thanks to her business, she has prospered. She also works as a primary school teacher in a village of San Martín Jilotepeque.

She wants to buy more chickens and take advantage of the busy commercial seasons in her locality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma Yolanda desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica a la crianza de pollos en su casa. Ella los compra pequeños, los alimenta y después los vende en su casa, en el mercado de la localidad de San Martín Jilotepeque, y algunas personas la buscan en su casa. Gracias a su negocio, ella ha prosperado y además trabaja como maestra de educación primaria en la escuela de una aldea de San Martín Jilotepeque. Ella quiere comprar más pollos y aprovechar las temporadas de negocio en la localidad.

loans.use: Raising chickens.

loans.name: Rose's Ushirikiano Group

texts.en:
Rose is 49 years old and married. For the last year, she has made a living selling milk. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 1 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140.

In the past, Rose took out two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business and was diligent about paying them back. She has now applied for a new loan to buy more milk to sell to her customers. She will share this loan with Janeth, the other member of her loan group, who has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy more milk and clothing to sell to their customers.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina T. is 40 years old. She is a widow and the mother of six kids. Augustina is very resourceful for her family in provision of food and payment of bills. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey as well as plastics. She sells kenkey in the mornings and switches over to the sale of plastic materials in the afternoon. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey at breakfast, lunch, and supper.

Augustina wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called "Yesu ne yen anidaso" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Saada's Mpaji Ni Mungu Group

texts.en:
Saada is 47 years old. She is divorced with two children aged 18 and 11. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7.30am to 4pm, earning a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Saada now seeks a loan to buy more clothes for re-sale. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, Mosi and Zainab, who have businesses dealing with clothes sales and perfumes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra was born in 1986 and she lives in Brijesnica Mala, a small town in Bosnia. Her parents are low-income farmers and former refugees, but they managed to put her through college. She just graduated with a degree in law, but she is struggling to find work and is currently unemployed. While she hopes to some day practice law, in the meantime she is living with her parents, brother and grandmother and helping them in the field to raise cows and chickens.

Azra has started using her computer skills to prepare and format documents for local schools and businesses. These documents include contracts, inventory lists and diplomas. She requests a loan of 600KM from Women for Women International, which she will use to purchase a new printer and scanner, allowing her to offer more products for her customers. She hopes to use the income from this business to pay back her parents on the farm, who paid for her to attend college.

loans.use: To purchase a printer and scanner.

loans.name: Apu Siwina Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “APU SIWINA”, se fundo en septiembre del 2005, actualmente se encuentra en el III ciclo D. la segunda etapa, esta conformada por  15 socias, 11 mujeres y 4 hombres, lleva el nombre D. la montaña que es el símbolo del centro poblado D. ACCHA, el “APU SIWINA” montaña que representa la figura D. una mujer. 
El distrito D. Accha D. la provincia D. Paruro, Dpto D. Cusco, se encuentra a 3 horas  D. la ciudad del Cusco, por carretera afirmada.
Las socias son mujeres campesinas, que provienen D. unidades económicas familiares dedicadas a labores agropecuarias, donD. ellas participan activamente en la venta D. los excedentes D. las principales cosechas, maíz, papa y habas. Otra actividad es la venta D. animales menores, como cerdos, aves D. corral, cuyes. Actividades desarrolladas en los principales mercados del distrito.
En relación al servicio financiero valoran, la facilidad, los requisitos mínimos, la entrega y devolución en la misma comunidad. Sin embargo la valoración D. la cultura D. ahorro promovida por la Unidad D. Microfinazas tiene mayor importancia.
texts.en:
The Apu Siwina village bank was founded in September 2005. It is currently in the 3rd cycle of the 2nd stage; it consists of 15 members, 11 women and 4 men. It carries the name of the mountain which is the symbol of the city of Accha; the Apu Siwina mountain represents the figure of a woman. The Accha district in the Paruro province of Cusco, Peru is 3 hours from the city of Cusco by highway. The members are women from the country-siD. whose families are generally involved in agriculture and farming activities; these women actively participate in the sales of their harvests--corn, potatoes and beans. They also sell small animals like pigs, poultry, and guinea pigs in the central markets of their district. They value the financial services offered through the village bank, mostly due to the ease of use, the minimum requirements to qualify, and the fact that the money is delivered and returned in their own community. What they value most is the culture of savings that is encouraged through the Unity of Microfinances.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sales of agricultural products in the main markets of their district

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en: K. Zulfiya is 38 years old. She is married with two adorable children. Zulfiya and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds for educating their children, so that they become highly employable in the future. Zulfiya sells perfume and cosmetics in a store that she rents. She has been in this business for 20 years. Zulfiya is dreaming of expanding her business. She wants to open her own store and establish contacts with the suppliers of well-known products. Today Zulfiya requests 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) in order to purchase new perfume and cosmetics such as hair color, nail polish, and lipstick to increase the variety of goods in her store. She would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her cosmetics store.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora María B. se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio de elaboración de tortillas las cuales son preparadas por ella misma todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Se ha dedicado con tanto empeño a esta actividad que se ha convertido en una excelente elaboradora de estas deliciosas tortillas y por esta razón es muy visitada en su establecimiento por clientes que compran dichas tortillas. 

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra del maíz y la leña para llevar a cabo dicha actividad que es su medio de sustento.
texts.en:
In the La Terminal market in the city of León, María B. has worked making tortilllas that are prepared by her everyday, from early in the morning until sundown. She has been so hard-working that she has become a excellent maker of these delicious tortillas and for this reason is much visited in her locale by clients seeking her products. Today she has come to Ceprodel for the purpose of receiving a loan that will allow her to purchase corn and firewood to continue with this activity, which is her means of support.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and firewood

loans.name: Grupo Amelia Group

texts.es:
Este el grupo Amelia que reside en la Ciudad de Masaya en el barrio La Reforma, está compuesta por tres señoras que son: Eveling del Socorro E. E., Miriam del Socorro L. G. y Mercedes Concepción Z. M.. Ellas iniciaron a trabajar con la institución por recomendación de clientas que trabajan con Adim y les hablaron del tipo de crédito y las capacitaciones que reciben, esto las animó a solicitar un crédito.
Doña  Mercedes Concepción Z. mujer de 34 años, casada, madre de dos hijos pequeños, con un negocio de venta de cosméticos ambulante y en su casa, vende productos de marca reconocidas como Avon, Zermat y Vogue ; les ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos y les da asesoría en belleza, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Su esposo trabaja de conductor en transporte colectivo, pero ella expresa que quiere conseguir por su cuenta sus propias cosas y sentir que es dueña de su propio negocio, El crédito lo necesita para comprar mercadería que no ofrecen estas marcas como ropa interior y  zapatos. Sueña algún día poder tener su propia tienda y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Meet the Amelia group whose members live in the city of Masaya in the neighbourhood of La Reforma! The members are three women: Eveling del Socorro E. E., Miriam del Socorro L. G. y Mercedes Concepción Z. M.. They started working with the institution on the recommendation of customers who worked with Adim and spoke to them of the types of loans and and the training they receive; this convinced them to ask for a loan for themselves. Mercedes Concepción Z. is a 34-year-old married mother of two young children who sells cosmetics in the street and from her home; she sells well-known brands such as Avon, Zermat and Vogue. She offers her customers a wide variety of products as well as beauty accessories. She has been in this business for five years. Her husband is a public transportation driver, but she tells us that she wants to be able to buy her own things and feel that she is in charge of her business. She needs this loan to buy more goods which she does not now have, such as underwear and shoes. She dreams of one day having her own store and therefore making a higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand and stock their business with new products which their customers are asking them for.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 26-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Abdallah has been working as an aluminum installer for four years. He repairs doors and windows. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase aluminum for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his income. Abdallah is special in his work because of his good reputation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Abdallah will use the loan to purchase aluminum for his work.

loans.name: Halim

texts.ru: Холмуминов Халим проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 51 год, женат и имеет восьмерых детей.Имеет среднее образование . По профессии шофер. Занимается перевозкой грузов. Имеет свою грузовую автомашину , которую и использует для перевозки. Кроме этого занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Имеет хозяйство , где в наличие имеет двух коров и одного бычка. Кроедит планирует использовать для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Halim H. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 51 years old, married and has eight children. He has a secondary education and is a driver by profession. He transports goods. He has own pickup truck which he uses for the transportation. Besides this he also breeds cattle. He has own stock where he has two cows and one calf. He plans to use the loan to increase the head count of cattle. He plans to pay off the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase head count of cattle

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 3 Group

texts.en:
The members of Group 3 from the Nuevo Progreso Bank of Hope are requesting their sixth loan with Esperanza International. This group formed in 2006. The businesses in this group are extremely varied: some sell clothes and accessories, some sell fried pastries, and Rodolfo, the only male member, is a fisherman.

Robertina T. is the group representative and her business is making and selling juices. Her specialty is orange juice, which is why she will use this loan to buy oranges to make her very refreshing juice. She is also going to purchase foam cups so her customers can get their juice "to go." When she has some spare time, Robertina likes to relax by watching TV. She has a 13 year old son, which is an advantage for her business because she doesn't need to be with him all the time. She would like to have a larger space for her business so she can set up a cafeteria, and maybe make some sandwiches to sell with her orange juice at breakfast time!

Please help us support Robertina and her group through this Kiva microloan. Thank you!

loans.use: To buy sugar, oranges, and foam cups for juices.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida J. manages a small sari-sari (variety) store business in her village. She is 43 years old and has two children in school. Her husband, Wilfredo J., is a farmer. They work together to support their family's growing needs. Aside from having a store, they own a 2-hectare rice farm. They have grown rice since they were married. Most of their harvest is intended for family use; the rest is sold in their sari-sari store for additional income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI (a Kiva partner). She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. The loan will help her attract more customers and increase her sales. Some of the loan also will be used to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

CEVI is reaching out to more people to help start and have their own business. CEVI gives their clients not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ma. Azucena

texts.en:
From the start of their married life, Ma. Azucena P. and her husband have been partners in raising hogs. Ma. Azucena is a 59-year-old woman and a resident of Pandan, Antique. Her husband, Feliculo, is a hired laborer. They are blessed with two children. Their older son is a 24-year-old college graduate and the younger is a 3rd-year Criminology student. Proceeds from the business have been used to meet their daily needs and pay school fees for their children.

The need for capital is always an issue for them; however, and this has impelled her to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.). Now on her third loan cycle, she is requesting 15,000 pesos for the purchase of feed and vitamins for the hogs.

Ma. Azucena is looking forward to the growth of this business which is helping bring them out of poverty. Building a more durable house is her greatest dream.

loans.use: To pay for feed and vitamins for hogs

loans.name: Liem

texts.en: Liem T. is 50 years old and his wife, Thai, is age 47. They live in the province of Siem Reap. To cover the family's daily expenses more sufficiently, the couple has rented a store in the local market where they sell fresh fish for a profit. They have five children, one of whom is married and is ready began a new family. The others are single. Because the family lacks the capital to expand their business, Liem T. has requested a loan of $600 to be used to order additional fish from their supplier to sell.

loans.use: To order additional fish from their supplier to sell

loans.name: Bekpulat

texts.ru: Таджиев Бекпулат проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 39 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Бекпулат по профессии является агрономом. В данный момент он более 25 лет занимается земледелием. Он в основном выращивает бахчевые растения. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения.
texts.en:
Bekpulat T. lives in the Rumy district. He is 39 years old, married and has 5 children. Bekpulat is an agronomist by profession. He has been involved in agriculture for over 25 years and mainly grows melon plants. Our client is requesting this loan in order to purchase mineral perticides.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral pesticides

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O. is twenty-nine years old and a married mother with two children. The children are currently in school. She says selling of ladies' slippers is very profitable and therefore she has been selling ladies’ slippers by hawking for a year now to help her husband in taking care of the family’s needs.

Esther wants to use the loan to buy stocks of different kinds of slippers to increase her inventory and sales for good income. She believes this loan would help her save some money to start paying part of the children’s school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy slippers for resale

loans.name: Amessi

texts.fr:
cette dame exerce comme activité  la boulangerie, ce commerce lui réussit bien et elle est très connue dans son quartier, beaucoup de gens viennent acheter chez elle pour revendre ou consommer. Les matières nécessaires à la fabrication de pain sont   épuisées alors qu’elle a des commandes de ses clients. Pour satisfaire ses clients  elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 04 sacs de blé, 02 sacs de sucre et des bois de chauffage. 
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns revenues from a bakery business, which is doing well. She is renowned in her district. Many people, resellers and consumers, come and buy from her. Her necessary supplies for making bread are exhausted, yet she has orders from her customers. To satisfy them, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy four sacks of wheat, two sacks of sugar, and some firewood. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and firewood

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Progresivas II”,  Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años; 06 hijos que ya son independientes.

Anteriormente Lucia se dedicaba a la Venta de Abarrotes y sus ganas de salir adelante, con sus propios medios le ha valido para implementar su propio negocio de Alquiler de habitaciones, ubicada en su misma casa.  

En la actualidad tiene cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, tiene muchas ventajas ya que se encuentra ubicada cerca de un Instituto y sus inquilinos en la mayoría son alumnos y docentes, que vienen de otras zonas por estudio o trabajo. Sus ganancias los obtiene cada fin de mes, en los pagos de sus habitaciones, nos cuenta que es muy responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así e implementarse en otro tipo de negocio. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 600.00, comprará accesorios, para modificar los servicio higiénicos (baños y duchas) de los cuartos y valdes de pintura, para dar una mejor infraestructura a sus habitaciones.

Lucia, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una vejez tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lucia belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresivas II” (Progressive Women II), in the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province and state. She is married, 42 years old, and has 6 grown children. Previously Lucia sold groceries and her desire to succeed, with her own means, enabled her to open her own business renting rooms in her own home. Today she has a faithful client. She has many advantages in that she is located near an Institute and her renters are primarily students and teachers who come from other zones to study or work. She receives her earnings at the end of each month, in the form of rent payments, and she tells us that she is very responsible with her payments and is thinking of opening another type of business. With the loan for S/600.00, she will buy accessories, modify the bathrooms in the rooms and paint in order to give a better infrastructure to her rooms. Lucia has great strength to continue working and moving forward, assuring herself a tranquil old age and she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fruition of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy accesories and modify the bathrooms

loans.name: Llanilda

texts.en:
Llanilda D. is 30 years old and is married with two children.  Llanilda sells vegetables outside the main market of Yarinacocha, a small suburb of the city of Pucallpa.  Her husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver.

Llanilda has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for four years and belongs to the communal bank “Madres Coraje” (Mothers with Courage).  She used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to purchase vegetables for her business.  Llanilda plans to invest this loan of 1000 soles in maintenance work for the two motorcycle taxis that she and her husband own.  Llanilda is pleased to be able to use her loans to also support her husband in his business.  

Since she began working with Manuela Ramos, Llanilda has always been punctual in her loan payments.  Llanilda enjoys the business education sessions given by the organization’s loan officers at the monthly meetings of her communal bank.

Llanilda’s goal is to eventually have her own spare parts shop for motorbikes and motorcycle taxis.

loans.use: Maintenance work for two motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying tires for resale

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita G. is already 43 years old. She is engage in managing her rolling store with the aid of her motorcycle. Her vending activity daily is being made easily through her motorcycle compared to her previous vending of which she just walks around their village to retail her vending products. According to her, she had sacrifices a lot for the development of her business. And because she still was not contented in her business income, Anita wanted to request for additional business capital amounting to PHP20, 000 from the KIVA lenders. 
	Anita is able to support the education of her children through her patience and hard work maintaining her rolling store. She hopes to give them their complete education so that they will able to acquire better job in the future. Anita is also hoping that someday, she can be able to uplift their living situation into progress. Anita is anticipating that soon, KIVA lenders will lend her the assistance she is asking from them.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.fr: H. Isabelle est née en 1974 au Bénin.  Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Isabelle n'a jamais fréquenté. Isabelle  produit et vend des amuses gueule (fait à base de farine de blé, sucre, lait, huile végétale, etc.) à de nombreux clients à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. A côté de cela, Isabelle a ajouté à son activité, la vente de boissons (bières et sucreries). Isabelle achète tous ces produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à la Société Béninoise de Brasserie du Bénin. Isabelle est à son deuxième crédit et sollicite un troisième crédit pour s'approvisionner et produire davantage les amuses gueule en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Achat de farine de blé et huile végétale

loans.name: Lucy Wanjiku

texts.en:
Lucy is a married lady, 34 years old, with two children (Douglas, age 8, and Caleb, age 3 1/2). She was introduced to Kiva Partner KADET through an existing client. She is applying for her 1st loan with KADET. With it, she plans to increase her stock of baby clothes, pullovers, shirts and napkins to sell in her shop. With the extra profit she hopes to earn, Lucy wants to purchase a sewing machine (to make cardigans)  and a computer.

Her dream is to open a wholesale shop selling clothes. Lucy is determined to grow her business; she is challenged by the fact that her clients prefer competitors with a greater selection. She believes that if her shop is well-stocked, she can attract more buyers who will like a wider variety of items to select from. She describes herself as hard-working.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase her stock of baby clothes

loans.name: Muhamadjon

texts.en:
D. Muhamadjon is 23 years old. He has been running his business for about two years. He rents a retail store where he sells different kinds of housewares. His business is his main source of income. As a rule, Muhamadjon travels to the neighboring city to purchase his goods. His goal is offer a wide range of high-quality goods to meet the requirements of his customers. He hopes to satisfy the needs of a wide base of clients with different levels of income.

Today, Muhamadjon is requesting a loan in the amount of $2,600. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan through IMON. It will be used to buy more housewares in order to increase the range of goods offered for sale. He has qualified for this loan due to his determination, his experience, and the profitability of his business.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy more housewares in order to increase the range of goods offered for sale.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo F. is from the village of Cabu-an, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. He is 45 years old. Wilfredo is married and has adult-age children. To make a living, Wilfredo owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transport services to local community members using his motorcycle. Wilfredo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years, and he earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Wilfredo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. Wilfredo is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide services. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Wilfredo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide services

loans.name: Los Manzanos Group

texts.es: Es el primer ciclo del grupo, es decir primera vez que participan en banca comunal de Agrocapital  y se caracterizan porque son personas muy unidas y pertenecen a un solo sindicato de comercio de la localidad son muy trabajadores, muy puntuales y muy responsables en cuanto a las obligaciones que tienen cada uno de ellos. La mayoría de este grupo se dedica a lo que es la venta de ropa (toallas, colchas, poleras, pantalones para damas, varones, y niños), porque en la localidad es una zona de mucho movimiento económico (es sobre la carretera principal) y es lo que las socias aprovechan para hacer sus ventas. La zona es de mucho movimiento económico, lo que hace que sea de un potencial enorme, la competencia es media pero por el crecimiento demográfico existe una tendencia a crecimiento de la demanda. El mercado no esta sectorizado por completo y en un pequeño espacio se pueden encontrar diferentes tipos de negocio. El destino del crédito solicitado por este grupo fue directamente para la inversión de todo lo que es la compra de mercadería que traen de las ciudades principales y así poder hacer crecer sus negocios. En cuanto a la experiencia de las socias de este grupo en su gran mayoria participan en lo que son los créditos relámpagos de otras entidades financieras donde también demuestran la puntualidad en cuanto a sus pagos. Es decir créditos en los que las instituciones no solicitan grandes garantías.
texts.en:
This is the first loan cycle for the group, meaning it is the first time they have worked with Kiva partner Fundacion AgroCapital. The members are known for being very united, as they belong to the only labor union in their town, and are very hard-working, punctual and responsible with their obligations. The majority of the members make a living selling clothes and other items (T-shirts, pants for men, women and children; towels, bedspreads). Their area is known for its busy economic activity since it is on the main highway, and the members take advantage with their sales.
