Because of the economic activity there is enormous business potential and the amount of competition is average, but with the growth in population in the area there will be a growth in demand. The market is not fully utilized, and in a small space a lot of different types of businesses can be found. This loan will be directly used to invest in all the merchandise the members bring in from the main cities, and thus they will be able to grow their businesses. As for the members' experience with the process, the vast majority of them have participated in loan programs from other financial institutions that did not require large guarantees and have demonstrated punctuality with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Adela  Albina

texts.es: La Sra. Adela, es cliente antigua, trabajo desde el año 2002 con credito individual, ella se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, salchipapas, y otro tipo de comida rápida, a la vez tambien se dedica a la repostería, elaborando alfajores, queques, etc, La Sra. Adela estuvo en contrato mucho tiempo en el Colegio Loretto, atendiendo servicio de té y comida, ahora tiene contratos con empresas particulares, colegios, ella tiene dos hijos jovenes, quienes ya trabajan independientemente, el esposo que es mecánico y electricista siempre se encuentra de viaje por trabajar en una empresa constructora, es una cliente muy trabajadora y cumple con sus pagos de manera regular.
texts.en:
Sra. Adela is a long-time client of Emprender. She has been receiving individual loans since 2002.

Adela sells hamburgers, salchipapas (sausages & French fries), and other types of fast food. Sometimes she also sells sweets such as shortbread, sponge cakes, and other items. Adela has an extended contract with Loretto High School, where she sells food and tea. Now she has contracts with other businesses and schools.

She has two teenage children who already work independently. Her husband is both a mechanic and an electrician and always travels for his job at a construction company. Adela is a hardworking client who always makes her payments regularly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. She is 38 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Flora owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling ready-to-wear items like pants, shorts and shirts in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Flora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Amigas Solidarias De Miguel Grau Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "AMIGAS SOLIDARIAS DE MIGUEL GRAU"
Josefina es miembro de la alcancía comunal AMIGAS SOLIDARIAS DE MIGUEL GRAU, ella lleva trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por más de 3 años.
Su familia esta formada por sus 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella, y su esposo, con quien comparte los gastos, viven en una humilde casa propia que fue comprada gracias a los ahorros que ambos juntaron.
Josefina se dedica a producir y vender artesanías desde hace más de 5 años, todo gracias a una amiga q le enseñó a bordar, coser, hacer las artesanías en especial pulseras y correas, productos que actualmente vende al extranjero.
El sueño más grande de Josefina es ver estudiar a su mayor hija que tiene el deseo y aspiración a estudiar periodismo, también terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "AMIGAS SOLIDARIAS DE MIGUEL GRAU" Josefina is a member of the communal bank, AMIGAS SOLIDARIAS DE MIGUEL GRAU. She has been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for more than 3 years. Her family is made up of her 3 children, all still her dependents, and her husband, with whom she shares expenses. They live in their own humble house that they were able to buy thanks to the savings that they put together. Josefina has worked making and selling arts and crafts for the past 5 years. Thanks to a friend who taught her how to embroider, sew, and to make crafts, she now produces bracelets and belts for export. Her biggest dream is to have her oldest daughter study. She wants and hopes to study journalism. Josefina would also like to finish building her house. .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Noel Antonio Pavón López, labora como Técnico de Computación en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería, el tiene a su cargo dos hijos y estos se  encuentran en edad escolar, esta casado, es el segundo crédito que a Trabajado con CEPRODEL, estos los ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: pintura y brocha para pintar su casa de habitación, para darles una mejor condición de vida a su Familia. 

Noel dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel a podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Sr. Noel Antonio Pavón López works as a computer technician at the National University of Engineering. He is married and has two dependent children who are in school. This will be the second loan he has received from CEPRODEL. His previous loan was used to improve his living conditions.

The loan he is currently requesting will be used to buy the materials needed to paint his house. This will provide better living conditions for his family. Noel expresses his thanks to CEPRODEL for providing the loans that enable him to make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paint & paintbrushes

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: At the every, Mrs. Ya T. is very busy caring for her grown pigs in the pigpen next to her house. This action is to earn money in order to contribute to her family. She can sell all her pig to buyers every three or four months after she begins breeding. She has been engaged in this sector since she was single. Ya T. was married a lot of years ago to Khoeun, 39, a building worker. They both have seven teenage children who are students and are also temporarily laborers. Ya T. will use her first loan to buy a small plot of land in a good location for farming. She will plant a variety crops on her new land for extra income.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of land

loans.name: Beverly Galarion Group

texts.en:
Beverly G. is from the village of Silongon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old and the leader of a five-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Beverly is married and has four school-aged children. She has a business raising crops, cultivating fruit trees and harvesting its fruit for sale. 

In 2006, Beverly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to pay for services to increase crop yield. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Beverly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz D. is from the village of  Kinoguitan,  Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Flordeliz is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Flordeliz owns & operates a business selling specialty food products in the local community. Flordeliz has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flordeliz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Flordeliz is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Flordeliz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en: Shamshad is the wife of S. S. and they live in the city of Borewala, in Pakistan. (Borewala is famous for its shrines.) She is an active lady who embroiders and sells shawls. Her clientele is made up of her neighbors. They give her shawl orders and she obtains them from Lahore and Faisalabad. Her income allows her to share the family's financial burden with her husband who sells vegetables in the market from his four-wheeled cart. He earns approximately Pak Rs.10,000 per month. Shamshad successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a new loan to purchase seasonal vegetables for her husband’s business.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Gueraline is the coordinator of her group Mujeres en Progreso 1, 2 (Women in Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty, industrial area north of the capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She lives in a simple, rented structure with her husband and child.

Gueraline is excited to be taking out her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear, creams, and detergents as well as other products by purchasing more goods in the main market and then reselling them in her community at a profit. She will use her profits to purchase medications and save towards having her own home and vehicle. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: increasing her inventory

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou T. is from the village of Capatan Tuguegarao City. She is 41 years old. Marilou is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 50,00 PHP a month for these activities. Marilou said that it is really difficult to become a mother and at the same time a father but she is really striving for the benefit of her children.

In 2007, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
señor Edgar R. de 33 años de edad está casado hace 11 años con la señora Maria Rodriguez de 36 años, el matrimonio cuenta con 1 hijo de 8 años que está cursando el 3er. Grado de la primaria.
El señor Edgar se inició en este negocio de ventas de huevos hace 7 años, empezó a distribuir por los negocios de los barrios de la ciudad en una moto  y con el tiempo transcurrido aumento sus clientelas tuvo la necesidad de cambiar su medio de transporte , por eso motivo compró una  camioneta, mientras él esta afuera su señora igualmente en su casa comercializa los productos que tiene, tambien cubre otras ciudades como Yhú, Vaquería por eso lleva otro producto como fiambres, chorizos, chorizos.
Solicita este préstamo para la  compra de huevos, salame, chorizos y de esta forma poder aumentar sus ingresos  y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edgar R., age 33, has been married to Maria Rodrigues, 36, for 11 years. The couple has one child, age 8, who is in grade 3. Edgar started this egg sales business 7 years ago. He started to distribute to various businesses in the neighbourhoods of the city in a car. With the passing of time, his customer base expanded and he needed to change his mode of transportation; so he bought a truck. While he is out, his wife sells their products in their home. He also covers other cities such as Yhú and Vaqueria, where he brings other products such as cold cuts and sausages. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of eggs, salami and sausages, to be able to increase his income and satisfy his customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of eggs, sausages, cold cuts, ham.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 62 years old. He is married with 8 children between the ages of 11 and 29. Six of his children are currently attending school.

He is a farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been practising mixed farming for 33 years and has employed five people from his community. His main produce is tea, pineapples, and milk which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from his rental shops and houses in the same area.

His major challenge has been lack of tapped water and this has made it hard for his dairy herd since the cows have to go to the river to take water.

Joseph has requested this second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase a dairy cow and expand his farm under animal feed. He says that this loan will bring in more income for the family through the sale of milk and thus improve the living standards of the family and ease payment of school fees.

In the future, he would like to increase efficiency in his farm by owning machines like chaff cutters for animal feed and purchase a vehicle to aid in the transportation of his products to the market. He is also grateful to Juhudi for making available loan facilities for farmers like himself.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and expand his farm

loans.name: Noeu

texts.en:
Mrs. Noeu T., aged 55, is a widow with five children – three sons and two daughters. Her eldest daughter assists Noeu in her business, her next son is a chef, and the other three children attend school. They live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Noeu is a farmer. She grows vegetables on her farmland in the village. In addition, she wants to run a coffee shop as she will be able to earn extra income from this business. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of $500 to build a shelter and buy materials to operate the business.

loans.use: To build a shelter and buy materials to run a coffee shop

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice A. sells provisions at Takoradi.  Alice has received junior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Alice has been selling provisions for some time now. She helps her husband in providing the basic needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy additional varieties of provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to open another shop in a different locality.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of provisions for sale

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie I. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 42 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosemarie also cooks food that she sells to their community. She has a small sari-sari store where she displays her cooked food and other products.

Rosemarie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and ingredients for making food. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Rosemarie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her family's living conditions. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and ingredients for making food

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en: Sobirjon is 28 years old. He is married and the father of two children. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. He is a hardworking young man and he has been providing taxi services for nine years. The most important thing to him is that his children enter school and successfully finish it, so that they will have a better tomorrow and be professionals. Sobirjon wishes to keep his taxi business growing and for this he needs to have his tools in good working order. He needs to buy spare parts and that is why he is requesting a loan. Thanks to this work, Sobirjon has been able to stabilize his quality of life. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for repairing his car

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a thirty-two-year-old man who is married with three children and lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

As a civil servant working with local government for five years now, James has been able to upgrade his qualifications. However, as a salary earner, he needs some income-generating activities to boost his income to meet the needs of his family.

James wants to construct a house for his domestic and commercial needs so that he saves rent while, at the same time, he earns it from the tenants he will have.

James intends to use the loan to purchase a plot on which to construct a house for domestic and commercial purposes.

loans.use: To purchase a plot on which to construct a house for domestic and commercial purposes

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is an active member of the Jitahidi Group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for 15 years and employs three farmhands. Her mixed farm produces tea, coffee, maize, beans and vegetables which she sells locally and through Kenya Tea Development Authority and Coffee Board of Kenya.

Anne is 37 years old. She is married with one 10-year-old child who attends school.

She has requested this loan of 30,000KES to expand her cereal business. She says that her income base will improve with the profits from this loan and this will enable her pay school fees for her child. Her major challenges have been transportation, low market prices and hailstones which affect the growth of her crops. She hopes that in five years' time, she will have expanded her cereal business and ventured into new markets. She also plans to lease more land and plant vegetables in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business.

loans.name: Muhidin

texts.en:
Muhidin is a responsible father of 5 children. From the time he was young, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock. These activities were passed down from his parents and today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Muhidin hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Succès Plus Group

texts.en:
Papy N. is the president of the Community Bank “Succès Plus”, which is composed of 22 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Papy runs a telephone booth and a games room for children in his area located west of Kinshasa. He began his business in 1997. His beginning capital was $10. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Papy is now well known and liked in this area. He has already received seven MFI HOPE DRC loans and fully repaid them. Since that time his business has prospered, and the loans he has received have helped him rent a well-located business place. He makes $90 profit each week. Papy intends to use the next loan to purchase more prepaid cards to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. His ambition is to open a cellular phones’ shop in his area. He is 33 years old and single. He also takes care of his younger brother.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid cards to meet customer demand and generate additional profits

loans.name: Kalamba Tukore Group

texts.en:
W. Yusuf is the leader of his lending group of Kalamba Tukore in Mubende. He is 48 years old and married with five children of whom three are in school. He also takes care of other dependents. Yusuf has a laundry business where he cleans and washes clothes, shoes and bags for his clients in Kalamba Town. 

Yusuf says that his customers are all people with laundry needs and he is able to make 50,000/= as weekly profits. The cleaner is his only business and hence he puts all his dedication into it. Before his current business, Yusuf was working for a construction company and he does not regret the move he made. He needs a loan to be able to buy a cow that will later give him milk for sale. He is straight-forward and open-minded and this is crucial in his business.

loans.use: Buy a cow that will give him milk for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora, de 37 años, es un responsable madre soltera de 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos Yerson, de 17, Gina, de 13 y Kelly, de 8 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos vive en su casa propia, ubicada en Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (selva central peruana). Está trabajadora mujer, se dedica a la agricultura sus principales cultivos constan de piña y una variedad de cítricos, ya tiene 15 años de experiencia, y según ella eso le valió para poder abrirse al mercado de la capital, donde los productos de buena calidad y buen precio son los más adquiridos. Una vez al año Aurora, cosecha en gran escala sus frutos, mientras que cada semana cosecha su producción de piña, por ello constantemente tiene que viajar a la capital. Pero la tenacidad que la caracteriza hace que invierta en la mejora de sus cultivos. Ahora ella ya comenzó con al abono constante y escalonado, con ello asegura que su producción dará frutos similares, con la misma calidad y sobre todo muy nutritivos. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y espera seguir trabajando con los miembros de su banco comunal, que son personas serias y muy responsables. Con el crédito solicitado, ha pensado comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Aurora is 37 years old.  She is a responsible single mother with 4 children.  She lives with three of her children: 17 year-old Yerson, 13 year-old Gina and 8 year-old Kelly.  They live in their own home in Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (in the Peruvian central jungle).

This hard-working woman is a farmer.  Her main crops are pineapples and a range of citrus fruits.  She has 15 years' experience and she says that this helps her to sell her products in the market in the capital where good-quality and well-priced products sell the best.

Once a year, Aurora harvests her fruit on a grand scale whilst her pineapples are harvested every week.  This means that she constantly has to travel to the capital.  However, the tenacity that characterizes Aurora means that she invests in improving her crops.  She is currently starting with constant, staggered applications of manure.  With this, she is certain that she will produce similar fruit of the same quality and, above all, fruit that is very nutritious.

This is Aurora's sixth loan with MFP and she hopes to continue working with the members of her community bank who are serious and very responsible people.  She is planning to use her loan to buy several sacks of organic manure for her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Sam-Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-ol T. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sam-ol Yong, have been married since 2006 and have two young children: one son and one daughter.

Sam-ol is a scarf weaver. Her husband is a barber. She requested a $150 Kiva loan one time already. She hopes to continue her business, so she asks for another loan of $150 to purchase scarf-weaving materials, such as cotton thread.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her scarf-weaving business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC WATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; ella tiene 57 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de panadería, la socia hace panes de diferentes formas, ella atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de panadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, sal, y mantequilla para hacer los panes y pasteles.                    
        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SUMAC WATA" communal bank, which is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.  

Her name is Elizabeth, and she is 57 years old. She is married with one child. Alongside her usual daily activities, she runs a bakery business: she makes different kinds of bread, and works in her bakery from 6am until 8pm. This work allows her to provide a future for her child. She would like to expand and improve her bakery business and is requesting the loan to buy raw materials such as flour, salt and butter for making breads and cakes.               
        
The member is very grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan in order to buy raw materials like flour, salt, and butter for making breads and cakes.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es: Victoriano, de 30 años de edad, natural del distrito de Anco,  convive con Faustina de 25 años y  tienen 03 hijos;  viven en su casa propia en la comunidad de Santa Rosa  departamento de Ayacucho. Victoriano, es un hombre de mucho provecho, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y cuenta con una parcela, donde ha cultivado, plantas de cacao, hojas de coca, café y barbasco. Ha trabajado durante 12 años y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros; de esa manera podrá rápido comercializar dichos productos a las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo de cada productos que vende. El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos, que perjudican a sus plantaciones, pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar en su producción. Este es  su primer  crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo. Se siente muy agradecido con la institución por facilitarle el préstamo solicitado. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para mejorar sus cosechas.
texts.en: Victoriano, who is 30 years old, is a native of Anco District.  He lives with 25-year old Faustina, and they have 3 children.  They live in their own home in the Santa Rosa community of Ayacucho Department. Victoriano is a very resourceful man who applies himself very carefully to the work that he performs.  He works in the fields.  He lives in the country and has a plot of land on which he has grown cacao plants, coca leaves, coffee and barbasco (an indigenous plant used as a fishing aid).  He has been working for 12 years and during harvest times has the help of day laborers.  With their help, he is able to sell his products more quickly to the whole sale companies, who pay him very well per kilogram of product.  The difficulty with his work lies in being unable to fight off the insects that damage his fields.  But for now his priority is to purchase additional land to expand his sow-able fields and increase his production.  This is his first loan with MFP.  He knows that he is responsible for punctually re-paying his loan, and he is prepared to do so.  He is very thankful to the institution for facilitating the requested loan.  With the 3000 PEN ($1100 USD)  that  he has requested, he will purchase fertilizer which will improve his harvests.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan Ramón P. Mora, tiene la edad de 46 años, está casado y tiene 6 hijos que son su mayor prioridad al igual que su señora esposa. El con el dinero pretende comprar chatarra a personas particulares y luego venderla a las exportadores de estos recurso para su fundición. El tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien por lo cual pretende aumentar la cantidad de estos materiales a su posesión y asi a la hora de venderlos seran mayores las ganancias. El pretender brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y seguir para adelante con sus metas como persona y jefe de hogar.
Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  ha tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales como el Banco de Costa Rica, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón P. Mora is 46 years old, married, and has six children. His wife and children are his highest priority. He intends to use this loan to buy scrap metal from individuals that he can later sell to exporters who supply these materials for smelting. Juan has been in this business for several years and has done very well. He is looking to increase the amount of these materials in his possession so that he can generate more profit. Juan wants to provide his family with a better quality of life and move forward with his goals as a person and as a head of household.

This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has had previous loans with state banks such as the Bank of Costa Rica, but FUDECOSUR is offering this loan with better services and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: Purchase scrap metal for eventual resale

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline, 27, is a mother of four children aged between 1 and 10 years. She has been doing mixed farming in her native Town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya for five years, producing milk, tea and eggs which are sold to the local market.

Evaline has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo for poultry farming. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children and improve the living standard of her family. She is focusing on having more than 500 hens in her unit in the next five years.

She reckons poultry diseases are quite challenging to the farming business. Evaline is however optimistic about the future and sees herself requesting more subsequent loans.

loans.use: to do poultry farming.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester C. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 34 years old. Ester is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of selling ready to wear clothing, sandals and shoe products in the local community. Ester has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional blouses and t-shirts. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional blouses and t-shirts to sell.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife A. is from the village of Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Marife is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Marife has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marife joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Marife is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Marife from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Ourn

texts.en: Ourn B., 48, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. B. sells vegetables, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. Her husband is a farmer who earns an income of USD 0.5 per month. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses. B. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more vegetables to expand her current business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to expand the business.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants Mme Ayaba est mariée à un commerçant. Elle a 37ans et a commencé le commerce de charbons, d’arachide, d’huile et de riz depuis 2003, ce prêt sera destiné à s’approvisionner en charbon de bois à ATAKPAME (une ville située a 160km de la ville de Lomé. Elle fait la revente de tous ses produits à domicile. Elle aimerait plus tard avoir un magasin pour son commerce.
texts.en: Ms. Ayaba is married to a merchant and has two children. She is 37 years old and started selling charcoal, peanuts, oil, and rice in 2003. This loan will be used to supply her with charcoal from Atakpame (a city located 160km from the town of Lomé). She re-sells all of her products at home. In the future, she would like to have a store in which to sell her goods.

loans.use: To buy and sell charcoal, rice, maize, and oil.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yovana; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de servicios de llamadas telefónicas, ella tiene celulares y presta servicio de llamadas en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeño trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere terminar de construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como yeso, cemento y arena para hacer el acabado de su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Madres Trabajadoras" (working mothers) community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Yovana. She is 40 years old and is single and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with telephone call services. She has cell phones and loans calling service in different streets in the city of Cusco. She works from 5AM until 10PM. Through this small job, this member gets her children ahead. She wants to finish building her house. She is requesting the loan in order to buy construction materials such as plaster, cement and sand to finish her house.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as plaster, cement and sand to finish her house.

loans.name: Faxraddin

texts.ru:
Faxraddin jenat i imeyet 3 detey. On jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i drujnimi detmi. Faxraddin rodilsya v 1961 qodu. 
4 oda nazad Faxraddin otkril sebe malenkoye kafe v kotorom samje rabotal povoram, no 2 qoda kak on izmenil eto malenkoye kafe uvelichiv yego i poetomu seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit stoli is tulya dlya kafe. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego druqa kotoriy i posovetoval yemu otkrit svayo kafe.
texts.en:
Faxraddin is married and has three children. He lives in the Absheron Region together with his beloved wife and children. Faxraddin was born in 1961.

Four years ago, Faxraddin opened a small café, in which he works himself as a chef. Two years ago he improved and expanded his café, and now he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy tables and chairs. He learned this business from a friend of his, who had encouraged Faxraddin to open his own café.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for his cafe

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Beatrice is 45 years old, widowed, and has two children. In 2006, she established her drinks business. She started the business to help her provide a livelihood for her children. Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 600,000 SSL a month. Beatrice is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 SSL, which she will use to buy additional drinks such as soft drinks, beer, stout, and wine. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SSL. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant which she will operate alongside her drinks business.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks, beer, stout, and wine for her business.

loans.name: Elsi Lorena

texts.es: Elsi Lorena de 28 años de edad, reside en su casa con compañero de vida quien trabaja como motorista y sus dos pequeñas hijas de 7 y 12 años de edad. Para Elsi sus hijas lo son todo y es por ellas que trabaja duramente para sacarlas adelante y darles mejores oportunidades a las que ella ha tenido. Elsi posee una tienda en su hogar de residencia, en la que últimamente a incluido la venta de artículos para el cuidado personal y ropa, y de hecho le ha ido bastante bien con ello, dado que además atiende con mucha amabilidad y dedicación, esto ha generado que muchas personas la prefieran y cada vez los clientes sean más. Su pequeño negocio es su principal fuente de ingreso y esto es lo que la hace luchar para mantenerlo activo y poder sacar adelante a su familia gracias a los beneficios que genera. Elsi sueña con tener una tienda grande y surtida en la cual los clientes puedan encontrar todo lo que necesitan. Para esto necesita hacer una reinversión en el área en donde ella a notado que mejor le está yendo que es con la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Para comprar éstos artículos solicita crédito a Integral y poder cumplir su sueño de ver su negocio florecer y poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elsi Lorena is 28 years old. She lives in her house with her life partner who works as a driver and her two small daughters who are 7 and 12 years of age. To Elsi, her daughters are everything and she works hard so that they can get ahead in life and to give them more opportunities than she has had. 

Elsi has a store in her home where she has recently included the sale of personal care products and clothing. In fact, this has gone very well for her given that, in addition, she attends to her customers with great friendliness and dedication. This has resulted in a preference for her and her clientele is growing. This small business is her principal source of income, which is why she fights to keep it operational, to be able to allow her family to get ahead thanks to the benefits this business generates. 

Elsi’s dream is to have a large and well stocked store where her customers can find everything they need. To do this she needs to reinvest in the area where she has noticed things going well, the clothing and cosmetics sales.  She is requesting a loan from Integral to buy these products, see her business flourish and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: La señora Flora tiene un negocio de abarrotes, vende dulces, refrescos, sabritas, pan, yogurth, vende un poco de todo ya tiene poco mas de 20 años con su negocio, nos comenta que en todo este tiempo ha sido muy dificil poder levantar el negocio por las pocas ventas que tiene, entre semana se vende poco y los fines de semana se vende mejor, otro problema que enfrenta es que los proveedores no pasan tan seguido ya que la carretera no es muy transitable, y esta un poco alejada de la comunidad, la señora Flora vive en la comunidad de San Pedro barrio, y es una comunidad alejada del centro, por ejemplo no hay transporte para llegar a la comunidad la mayoria de la gente sale a pie y regresa a pie, es un poco largo el camino pero los taxistas solo hacen viajes especiales para el barrio, doña Flora tiene 3 hijos, dos de sus hijos son grandes, ella es madre soltera tiene su casa propia pero quiere tambien arreglarla para que sea bonita, la señora acaba de cumplir 36 años y su hijo mayor le ayuda con los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Flora has a grocery business where she sells candy, soft drinks, snack foods, bread, and yogurt. Basically she sells a little bit of everything and has already been in business a little more than 20 years. She says that it is always difficult for her to wake up to keep her business running because she generates few sales. During the week she sells very little, but her sales get better on the weekends. Among the other problems that she must deal with are the infrequent visits from her suppliers because the highway is not passable and is located some distance away from her community.

Sra. Flora lives in the community of San Pedro, a neighborhood that is far from the central part of town. There are no transportation lines that run through this community, so most of the residents leave and come back on foot. Due to the long distance, taxi drivers only make special trips when coming to this neighborhood. Doña Flora has three children, two of whom are grown. She is a single mother and has her own house. Flora wants to remodel her home to make it beautiful. She is about to turn 36 years old and her oldest son helps with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, oil, soft drinks, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 24 years old, married, and had two children aged three and one. He operates a boutique at a local market in Kakamega. He has been in this business for three years now and employs one person. He says the business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is financial constraints. 

Peter plans to use this loan to purchase clothes to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business to wholesale. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his clothing store

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Elma has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy snacks and beverages to sell.

Elma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a 48-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 26 years old. Eufemia's husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Eufemia has been engaged in farming for 10 years. She grows rice and sells her harvest at the market. Eufemia works hard to help provide for her family's needs and send her children to school. She has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Willdrin

texts.es: Willdrin vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 7 años. Él es un emprendedor que ha logrado generar ingresos mediante su propio negocio,  a través del cual fabrica galletas que comercializa en diversas tiendas de la ciudad. Su actividad productiva la inició cuando el anterior propietario de este negocio,  decidió no continuar con su actividad y Willdrin se lo   compró a crédito y lo pagó poco a poco;  así fue como inició:  con un horno industrial, una vitrina para pan grande y las latas , activos con los que se dio a la tarea de empezar a producir y especializarse en galletería, pues no contaba con una infraestructura para la producción de panadería, que es su meta actual. Poco a poco, y mediante extensas labores de promoción, fue creando su propio mercado, hoy cuenta con 50 tiendas y espera agregar nuevos productos como los de panadería, lo cual incrementaría sus  ingresos, pues cuenta con un potencial de tiendas como mercado cautivo, que hoy le compran galletas y en el cual,  ya ha hecho su preventas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva porque necesita comprar una cilindradora  para iniciar su producción de panadería e ir agregando uno a uno nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Willdrin lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias with his wife and two children, ages 2 and 7. He is an entrepreneur who has been able to generate income through his own business where he produces cookies that are sold to different stores in the city. Willdrin started in this business when the previous owner decided not to continue. He purchased the business on credit and repaid the debt a little bit at a time. Willdrin started out with an industrial oven, a display case for holding bread loaves, and oil cans. With these assets, he was able to begin producing and specializing in cookies since he does not have the infrastructure for a formal bakery, which is his goal at the moment. Over time and after extensive marketing, he was able to create his own market. Today he serves 50 stores and hopes to add new products, such as other baked goods, to increase his income. He has the potential to gain more stores and captive markets that will buy cookies through pre-sales.

For this reason, Willdrin is requesting a Kiva loan because he needs to buy a rolling machine so that he can start producing bread and adding new products one at a time.

loans.use: to purchase a rolling machine for making bread.

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
This is Clarissa, 40, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Eddie, her partner in business, and is mother to their four children. She, together with husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Clarissa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 450 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Clarissa dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a forty-six-year-old married woman with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in clothes and tailoring for ten years. She started with one sewing machine, and now has four. Her challenge is the seasonal nature of her business, and her vision is developing a big tailoring workshop plus educating children. Stella wants the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, 41 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a village chief who earns $5 per day. They have three children. One is studying and two are working, earning $10 per day in all. 

Every month Phally has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

Phally would like to request a loan of $400 to buy a motorbike for her husband so he can travel to work. She doesn’t have any plans yet for a career because she doesn’t have enough money.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 66 años, es una señora buena, amable y muy responsable, es viuda y madre de tres hijos quienes ya son mayores y tienen su propia familia. Su corazón es muy grande, ya que por ahora tiene a su cargo un niño de 10 años a quien cría por que su familia lo abandono. Juntos vive en su casa. El trabajo de Norma consiste en diversas actividades, pero tiene dos principales, la primera es la costura, por lo que tiene un pequeño taller en su casa, ahí llegan sus clientes en busca de remendado en sus prendas; y la segunda es la venta de cosméticos. Ambas actividades lo realiza desde hace 15 y 10 años respectivamente y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de tiempo para dedicarse a otras actividades y a su hogar. Le esta yendo bien en todo y tiene buenos ingresos, gracias al esfuerzo que hace en colocar sus productos y remenndar las prendas de sus clientes lo más rápido que puede. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, y espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con sus negocios. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales para continuar con la costura, entre ellas, telas, hilos, elásticos, blondas, cierres. Asimismo comprará cosméticos y productos de belleza para tener en stock y ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Norma  is 66 years old. She is good woman, friendly and very responsible. She is a widow and mother of 3 who are already adults and have their own families. She has a big heart as at the moment she is taking care of a 10 year old boy who was abandoned by his family. Together they live in her house. Norma has several business activities but the two main ones are sewing from a small workshop she has at home where she serves the cutomers who call on her to have their clothes mended, and selling cosmetics. She has been doing both jobs for 15 and 10 years respectively and up until now she has worked alone. What she likes about her work is that it allows her time to pursue other activities and to take care of her house. She is doing well with all her activities and has a good income, thanks to the effort she makes in placing her products and mending her customers clothes as fast as she can.This will be her 3rd loan with MFP and she hopes to receive the support of all of you to continue with her businesses. With the money requested she will buy what she needs to continue sewing such as fabrics, thread, elastic, laces, zippers. She will also buy cosmetics and beauty products to have them in stock and offer them to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastic, laces, zippers and cosmetics.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, 29, married and blessed with five children, is a hardworking business woman who has been running a beauty salon for the last four years to support her family. She has been able to develop her business because of the good reputation she enjoys with her customers.

Caroline, who has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair braids, shampoo and a blow dryer, wants to expand her business in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy hair braids, shampoo and a blow dryer.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a café business; her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of theft because of the lack of security in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing her business to earn more income.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and utensils for cooking. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and utensils for cooking.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Kossiwa est une femme âgé(e) de 44 ans. Elle est mariée å un coiffeur et ont ensemble 04 enfants.
Kossiwa travaille comme revendeuse de céréales et SODABI (boisson locale faite à base de palmier à huile) depuis 1991. Elle vend à domicile après achat.
Kossiwa a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales (Maïs, haricot et autres)
Dans les prochaines années, Kossiwa voudrait agrandir son activité et assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is a 44-year-old woman. She is married to a hairdresser and they have four children together.

Kossiwa has been working as a cereal and sodabi (local drink made with palm sap) vendor since 1991. She sells from her home after buying her products in Anie.

Kossiwa has requested her fourth loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals (corn, bean and other). In the coming years, Kossiwa would like to expand her business and ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama girasol y se integra de tres señoras quien cada una se dedica a su respectiva actividad.

   Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama  Magdai ella es viuda  tuvo cuatro hijos quienes ta estan casados y a su resposnabilidad tiene a una nieta que  vive con  ella desde pequeña.

    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes  donde comenta que le va bien  ya que con ellos lleva trabajando hace siete años y cuatro meses.
  
   Quien la inspiro en esta actividad  fueron su hijos quienes le dieron unos ahorritos para poner algún negocio el  cual   le deja ingresos  para sostenerse   con un poco mas de ingresos.

    Lo que la desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el  préstamo ella pueda seguir mejorando  cada  día más  su negocio para apoyar a su nieta que está creciendo.
 
    Quienes integran en el grupo  son la  señoras  Yareni quine invertirá  el préstamo en la compra y venta de   cosméticos y la señora Rosa Lidia invertirá en la compra y venta de  borregos.
texts.en:
The group is called "Girasol" [Sunflower] and is made up of three women, all of whom make a living doing different things. 

The women in the group who was interviewed is named Magdai. She is a widow with four children who are all married. She is responsible for a granddaughter who has lived with her since she was a baby. Magdai requested a loan to invest in inventory for her grocery store. She says that it is going well as she has been working with them for seven years and 4 months.   

Her children inspired her in this business. They gave her a small amount of funds to start a business. The business generates an income that supports her and also produces a little profit. Her hopes for this small business and the loan is that she can continue improving her business, each day a little bit more, so that she can support her growing granddaughter.  
  
The other two group members are Yareni, who will invest the money to purchase cosmetics for resale, and Rosa Lidia, who will invest the money to purchase lambs for resale.

loans.use: to buy groceries that they will then resell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has had a business of selling from a food stall in Malakiya yambio, South Sudan for two years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase groundnuts, beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts, beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Mbah

texts.en:
Born on  May, 1974, he is married and has two children, both younger than 15. He lives with his children in Azire old church, a quarter in the Bamenda Mezam division of the North West region of Cameroon. He has faced challenges in life such as the death of his father, poverty, no money to pay rent and unemployment.

He joined GHAPE in 2009 and has borrowed and repaid one loan, which was used to purchase palm wine and for farming. He used the profit from the loan for his children's education and to improve his farm by purchasing and applying fertilizer. He promises that he will use this loan to expand his palm wine sales by buying  glasses, manure, yams and palm oil. The profit generated from this loan will be used for medication, his children's education and farm products. He strongly believes his business will succeed because of his longevity in the business, his regular customers and their satisfaction. The community will benefit from his regular supply, low prices and other discounts offered.

He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment times and the education of members before loan disbursements.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, yams, seedlings and manure

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 44 years of age. He is married and blessed with two school-age children. He lives is Carangan, Ozamiz City. His wife is a housewife who cares for the children. 

Samson plants and harvests rice to sell in order to earn a living. The harvested rice is delivered to his contract buyer in the town. He has been in this business for 2 years, and he earns an income of approximately 1,800 PHP a month to support his family.

Samson joined GDMPC currently and has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer to enhance the growth of his crops. 

Samson hopes that the business he operates will be successful because his goal is to buy another piece of farmland to cultivate.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosemarie Group

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 47 years old and lives in Mabini, Baliangao. She is married and has 4 children. 

Rosemarie works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP24,900 to purchase a fishing boat for her fishing business. Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. 

Rosemarie is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat for fishing.

loans.name: Hubert

texts.fr: Hubert habit au Sénégal âgé de 28 ans , chauffeur de taxi de brousse , marié père de 2 enfants une fille un garçon . L'ainée la fille âgée de 5 ans fat le jardin d'enfant le plus petit reste avec sa maman à la maison . Pendant la saison des pluies , Hubert gare son taxi pour la culture des champs car le route devient impraticable en cette période à cause des fortes pluies. Il a préféré cette année de faire la culture des pastèques dont la durée de la campagne est de 3 mois . Il avait bénéficié dans l'un des guichets de l'u imcec de 2 crédits de 350 000f et de 500 000f qui ont été remboursé à échéance sans problème .Hubert sollicite une 3eme foi un crédit de 250 000f pour acheter des semence et engrais pour cette campagne pour mieux gagner et épargner de l'argent . Son ambition est d'avoir une maison dans sa localité et aller en aventure .

loans.use: ACHETER DE LA SEMENCES ET ENGRAIS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock.

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin is the resident of Beylagan town. As with most people in rural areas, he is engaged in cattle and sheep breeding. Since 2004 he borrowed four loans from Normicro Beylagan branch. He uses the loans to increase his number of livestock. He has 25 sheep now and he wants to increase this number. For this he needs $1,200.

loans.use: To increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will use the credit to buy ingredients (flour,sugar, yeast, butter, etc.) which will let her expand production and raise her income.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther B. lives in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone).  She is married, forty-four years old and the mother of three children.  Esther contributes substantially towards the family’s monthly income with the profits from her small business.  Her previous loan from SMT enabled her to purchase the fish wholesale and she was able to increase her income.  With this second loan she will increase her stock even more. Esther is determined to have enough income to properly educate her daughters.

loans.use: Increase stocks of fish

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Sra. Francisca is 52 years old. She is married and has 5 children. Three of them still live at home and are going to school.

She makes homemade jam and all sorts of homemady sweets (candy) traditional to the area. She says that she inherited her talent at making sweets from one of her aunts who taught her everything she knows since she helped her aunt for many years until she decided to go on her own.

Sra. Francisca has been making and selling candy for the past 25 years. Some of the candy flavors are guayaba, apple and whatever fruit that's in season.

She works from home. She already has all the ingredients/supplies necessary to do her work. She makes candy twice a week. Her primary clients are the ones at the local market located in the city of San Lorenzo which is about 45 Km from Caacupe.

Sra. Francisca tells us that with the previous loans she has received from Fundacion Paraguaya (Paraguay Foundation), she has been able to buy the main ingredients and main supplies for her business. She is hoping to display and sell her candy at the local arts/crafts expositions in the cities of Altos, Tobati and Aregua which are located about one hour away from Caacupe. This is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 USD so that she can purchase a big table, a chair and some sort of sunshade in order to go to these expositions.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca tiene 52 años, está casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales tres de ellos aun viven con ella y van al colegio. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y producción de dulces (mermeladas) caseros, nos comenta que el arte de elaborar dulces artesanales lo adquirió de una tía quien le enseño las técnicas de elaborado y de quien fue ayudante por varios años hasta que decidió independizarse. Ya van 25 años desde que Francisca trabaja de forma independiente vendiendo sus dulces, algunos de los sabores que podemos citar tenemos dulce de frutilla, guayaba, manzana y frutas de estación. Trabaja en su propia casa, ella cuenta con todos los elementos necesarios para la elaboración de los mismos. Prepara sus dulces dos veces por semana y sus principales clientes son los negocios ubicados en el mercado de San Lorenzo, ciudad distante a unos 45 Km de Caacupé. Francisca, comenta que los préstamos que le otorgo la Fundación Paraguaya con anterioridad le han sido de mucha ayuda ya que de esa forma obtuvo capital para comprar las materias prima y los elementos necesarios. Tiene en proyecto mostrar sus productos en las exposiciones artesanales en las ciudades de Altos, Tobatí y Areguá, las mismas quedan a menos de una hora de la ciudad de Caacupé.; para ello solicita el préstamo de $ 100 de manera a poder comprar la mesa, silla y el toldo que necesita para estar en estas exposiciones.

loans.use: To purchase a table, chair and a canopy

loans.name: Enersida

texts.en:
Enersida is 32 years old. She has three children, ages 17, 14, and 13 (this means she had her first child at 15!). Two of them are still in school. Her three children and her husband all live with her in her home.

Enersida buys fruit (such as mangos, guavas, plantains, and bananas) in bulk from the surrounding local farms and sells them in the nearby city markets, such as in La Romana and El Seybo. With her loans she is able to pay for her produce upfront, which allows her to have larger profits. Before she received a loan, she had to buy smaller quantities and wait to sell that before she could, with those earnings, buy additional fruit to sell.

Enersida took out her first loan with Esperanza 2 years ago for 3000 pesos (US$ 90). This is the 4th loan that she is going to take out from Esperanza, and she has successfully paid back the other 3. Esperanza typically offers smaller loans initially and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can borrow larger and larger amounts. She is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

With this loan, Enersida wants to keep investing in her business, buying her produce in ever greater quantities to be able to sell in the markets for increased profit.

loans.use: To allow her to pay cash for bulk fruit purchases from local farms

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born on December 19, 1956 in Lomé, Madam Adjo K. lives in the neighborhood called Djidjolé. She sells second-hand bags. She is married and a mother of two children of whom she takes care. Her husband is retired, and does not manage to provide the necessary means for the family. She tries in every way to take care of the family, but her profits are always insufficient, and she is asking for a loan of $400 to buy a large quantity of bags which will allow her to make a greater profit and to be able to care for her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 19 décembre 1956 à Lomé, Madame Adjo K. réside dans le quartier djidjolé. Elle est revendeuse de sacs de friperies. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants qui sont à sa charge. Son mari, retraité, n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle se bat dure pour prendre en charge la famille, mais étant toujours insuffisant, ce qu’elle réalise comme profit, elle sollicite un crédit de $400 pour acheter une grande quantité de sacs lui permettant de faire un peu plus de bénéfice afin de pouvoir bien prendre soins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying second-hand bags

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: I am Sonia M.. I am married and a mother of three: two boys and one girl. All of kids study at a local school. My husband sells LPG gas cylinders on partnership basis in a nearby gas store. He is able to sell eight cylinders daily. He needs a loan of $175 to expand his business. We both husband and wife are determined to educate our children to a maximum so that they can find better employment for themselves and do not have to do menial jobs.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Rufina's Group

texts.en:
Rufina and Cirila have been members of the community bank “Dignidad” for four and five years respectively.  In the community bank they have learned how to invest their money, how to manage their business, to be responsible, respectful, and generous.  They mentioned how much they like having a savings account, and how much help the loans are for their businesses.

Rufina is 47 years old.  She is married and has four children.  Together with her husband Rufina buys cattle in the town of Luyanta, raises them, and then sells them at the Sunday market in San Juan Bautista.  In addition, Rufina buys pigs and butchers them for restaurants.

Cirila is 45 years old.  She is married and has five children.  Cirila sells coca leaves.  This is a medicinal herb that has many uses.  She buys the leaves in Ayacucho and travels several hours to sell it in the region of Huancavelica.  Sometimes she buys cheeses in Huancavelica and later sells them in her neighborhood.  

Rufina and Cirila need loans of 600 and 1000 soles, which they will invest in buying cattle and coca leaves.
They plan to use their savings to buy a motorcycle taxi, build a house, and pay their children’s school fees.  Rufina and Cirila dream of owning a home with all of the modern conveniences, that their children will be professionals, and that their businesses will continue to prosper.

loans.use: Rufina and Cirila need loans of 600 and 1000 soles, which they will invest in buying cattle and coca leaves.

loans.name: Bimalika

texts.en: P. Bimalika is 50 years old. She and her husband have raised three children. Two sons of Bimalika are helping her in the business. She is baking the national bread, lepeshka. The family is working hard; they start baking the lepeshka from early morning so that their customers will have fresh bread in the morning. And they go to bed late in the night after making dough and preparing the firewood and coal for baking for the next day. Bimalika is selling the majority of her products just from her place. However, she also is running the a storefront in the central local market, selling the lepeshka. Thus, keeping the business stable, Bimalika helps her husband in supporting their family and allowing her sons to have the source of significant income. Now Bimalika requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. She is planning to purchase the flour wholesale that is required for her business. Bimalika is grateful for all supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Purchasing the flour wholesale for baking the national bread, lepeshka.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job A. is a trader who buys cocoa from farmers and sells to a company called OLAM GH Ltd Co. He is married and has nine dependents. Business is booming and he wishes to increase sales but lacks funding.
