Her husband is a farmer. She responsibly assists her husband in taking care of the family. Her loan will be used to buy additional palm fruits to expand her business. She hopes to reinvest her new profits. In this picture she is pouring the palm kernels into the nut cracking machine.

loans.use: to buy additional palm fruits to expand her business.

loans.name: Resalyn

texts.en:
Resalyn is 34 years old and lived in Catadman, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married lady and mother of one school-aged child.

Resalyn own and operates a boarding house. She has been engaged this type of service for more than five years. Each month she earn approximately PHP 15,000 from rental fees. She established this service as a way of generating  extra income.

Resalyn requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase materials for boarding house repair.

Resalyn has been member of GDMPC for more than one year. In the future Resalyn hopes that she will have a other boarding houses and a subdivision.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for boarding house repair.

loans.name: Paula Isidora

texts.es:
Doña Paula es una mujer trabajadora, tiene dos trabajo, uno como conserje en una empresa privada, y venta de comida en la misma empresa teniendo el permiso para realizar sus ventas. y en su casa de habitacion su hermana le ayuda con el negocio de comida en el dia y en la noche,  ella cuando llega siga en  movimiento de venta ya que le ha ido muy bien con su negocio, el cual inicio con una pequeña pulperia que no cuenta ya. 
Paula se siente sastifecha ya que ha logrado salir adelante con sus tres hijos, los tres estudiantes, lograndolo junto a Afodenic el cual ha sido el medio para la inversion en su venta de comida.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo comprara una cocina industrial, otro exhibidor de comida, asi como la compra de platos, vasos, cucharas, tenedores, saleros, azucarera entre otros producto que ayude a realizar mejoras a su negocio.
texts.en:
Paula is a hard working woman.  She has two jobs: one as a caretaker at a private firm and another selling food at that same firm having permission to do so.  She also sells at home with help from her sister who helps her sell food day and night.  When she returns home sales continue.  She has done very well in business which she started with a small grocery store that she does not have any longer.

Paula feels satisfied that she’s managed to get ahead with her three children, all of them students.  She’s attained this with Afodenic which has been the means for her investment in food sales.

Today, with this new loan, she will buy an industrial stove, another food display case and she will also buy plates, glasses, spoons, forks, salt shakers, sugar dispensers, among other products that will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove, a display case for food, dishes, glasses, forks, etc.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Primitiva; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de leña y venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz, la socia trabaja en forma independiente, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de leña y venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar leña al por mayor y para comprar insumos para preparar la chicha como maíz y jora.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This borrower belong to the "Mama Simona" communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco. This borrower is Ms. Primitiva. She is a 45 year-old widow and has four children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her businesses selling firewood and chica, which is a corn-based beverage. She works independently, from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. Through these small businesses, Primitiva has helped her children to get ahead. She would like to expand and improve her businesses of selling firewood and chicha. She is requesting a loan to buy firewood wholesale and to buy ingredients for preparing chicha, such as corn and jora [germinated, dried corn kernels]. Primitiva is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy firewood wholesale and to buy ingredients for preparing traditional Peruvian corn beer

loans.name: Mhark

texts.en:
Mhark, age 30 and unmarried, owns and operates a shop that sells electronic loads for several networks like GLOBE and SMART. He has had this business for three years. 

He has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000, which he will use to buy additional electronic loads to sell.
 
Mhark has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mhark hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic loads to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 56 years old and married with 5 children. With 1 child in school, Teodora works very hard to provide for them.

Teodora is an ambulant vendor of tobacco in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Teodora has been in this business for 23 years.

In the future, Teodora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, 39 years old, is a married woman with two adult children. She lives in the province of Isabela. 

She is a hard worker and owns a mini-grocery located in front of their house. When she started her business, it was a small store but it has grown and improved. Her mini-grocery is completely stocked. Her customers come to buy all types of products and different groceries such as sugar, rice, noodles, and other items that sell well. This helps her to continue improving and reinvesting in her business. 

On this occasion, her loan will be used to buy snack foods, drinks and spices that her customers have requested so that her business will be complete. She will also expand her business to make it larger and more comfortable for her customers. She is hoping that in the future her business improves so that her family can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase snack food, drinks, candies and spices.

loans.name: Katiana Paola

texts.es: Katiana de 24 años de edad es una joven muy emprendedora, conciente de las oportunidades de negocios y bien educada. Ella  vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanos en la ciudad de Barranquilla, estudia  secretariado ejecutivo sistematizado  y tiene varios negocios: comercializa productos de tocador y cosméticos, ofrece sus servicios como estilista de belleza y vende mercancías variadas a través de guías especializadas de productos, Sus  negocios los inició  hace 2 años apoyada por su tía para que ella se ayudara pagando sus estudios y para responder a sus gastos personales apoyando la gestión de bienestar, que hacen sus padres en la familia.. Su negocio funciona en la casa de sus padre y también ofrece domicilios,   en su mercado le encargan champó, sombras, labiales, bases para el cutis, que comercializa a diferentes clientes, ubicados en el sector donde vive y en otros barrios de Soledad, y Malambo, municipios área metropolitana de Barranquilla. En su negocio maneja un  margen de utilidad promedio no menor del 40%, sus ventas las realiza en un 40% de contado y un 60% a crédito, y la recuperación de su cartera es de  8 días. Sus compras las realiza al por mayor, su trabajo lo desarrolla en las horas de la tarde de lunes a domingos , en un promedio de horas invertidas de 6 hora diarias, su mayor fortaleza en el negocio es su capacidad de trabajo, mientras su gran oportunidad es la inexistencia de competencia, pues no hay negocios con estas mismas características en su  mercado objetivo, ubicado alrededor de su barrio; Y su mayor desafío es lograr un amplio capital de trabajo para satisfacer la demanda creciente de clientes que requieren precios competitivos, como los que ella ofrece al manejar sus compras en volumen. Su credikiva es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una lava cabezas, sillas para blowers, generando así cada día más, un ambiente confortable, elegante, atractivo para sus clientes y desde allì una inversiòn exitosa.
texts.en:
Katiana, age 24, is a very enterprising young woman.  She gives the nod to business opportunities, and she is well educated.  She lives with her parents and her two siblings in the city of Barranquilla.  She is studying to be an executive secretary, and she has several businesses.  She sells toiletries and cosmetics.  She works as a hair stylist, and she sells varied merchandise through catalogs.

She started her businesses two years ago.  Her aunt supported her in order to help pay for her studies and her personal expenses.  This supports the family’s well-being that her parents provide.  She conducts her business in her parent’s house, and she also goes to homes.  Shampoo, eye shadow, lipstick, and foundations are ordered in her market.  She sells these items to different customers located in the area where she lives and in other neighborhoods in Soledad and Malambo.  These are metropolitan municipalities in Bararnquilla.

In her business she has an average profit margin of no less than 40%.  She makes 40% of her sales for cash and 60% on credit.  She recovers her expenditures every eight days.

She buys wholesale, and she works in the afternoon Monday through Sunday.  On the average she works six hours a day.  Her greatest strength in the business is her capacity to work.  Her great opportunity is the absence of competition.  There are no businesses like hers in her target market around her neighborhood.

Her greatest challenge is obtaining enough working capital to satisfy the growing demand of her customers.  They want competitive prices like those that she offers by making her purchases in volume.

This is her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will buy a shampoo chair and dryer chairs.  This way she is generating a more comfortable, elegent, and attractive atmosphere each day.  From there it is a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy a shampoo chair and dryer chairs.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a 53-year-old mixed crop farmer for the past 10 years, is married to John, also a farmer, and they have been blessed with three children. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

Having been introduced to KADET by an existing KADET customer, Lucy is requesting her first loan to buy manure and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will venture into pig-keeping. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses which will help her improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm manure and seedlings.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is married and she is an active housewife who performs her tasks very efficiently.
 
Her husband is a computer technician who runs a repair and maintenance shop.  He also sells CDs and DVDs. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her husband’s business.  With the loan, he will buy computer spare parts, CDs, DVDs and repairing tools to make his business more profitable.
  
He recently started his business and Saima hopes that a loan will make it profitable.  She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: to buy computer spare parts, CDs and DVDs for husband's business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Gina owns a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mónica María

texts.es:
A sus 30 años de edad, Mónica es madre de 3 hijos, desde que estos estaban muy pequeños le ha tocado ser madre cabeza de hogar, ya que el padre de estos falleció estando los niños muy pequeños. Al verse en esta situación Mónica se vio en la necesidad de buscar un sustento para su familia. 

Desde hace vaR. años Mónica es una emprendedora consagrada a su negocio, donde vende productos por catálogo. Mediante este oficio espera tener su propio almacén con mas clientes y mas posibilidades económicas para tener aumentar su surtido y con gran variedad.

Actualmente Mónica necesita un préstamo para comprar mercancía y así incrementar su capacidad de comercialización mejorando proporcionalmente sus ventas, sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
At 30 years old, Monica is the mother of 3 children.  Since they were very small she has had to be the breadwinner, since their father died when they were very young. Upon finding herself in that situation, saw the need to support her family.  

For several years, Monica has been a dedicated entrepreneur in her business, where she sell products via catalogue. With this business, she hopes to have her own store with more customers and financial possibilities to increase her stock and have more variety. 

At present, Monica needs a loan to buy merchandise and thus increase her selling capacity, increasing her sales, her income and her family's quality of life proportionally.

loans.use: to buy more varied merchandise and thus increase her sales capabilities.

loans.name: Duo Nuevos Horizontes Group

texts.es:
Duo Nuevos Horizontes.
Este grupo esta formado por dos personas las cuales luchan dia,a dia para salir adelante.Doña Ana Marina, quien es la lider D. este duo se dedica a la confeccion D. tejidos,desD. hace años pero tambien en sus ratos libres se dedica a la crianza, D. animales como pollos,ella esta contenta porque siente que se pe pueD. dar ese apoyo que ella nececita para salir adelante en su negocio,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos,al igual que el señor Leonzo el se dedica a la crianza D. animales como pollos,y tambien esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. mas animales y agrandar su venta.
texts.en:
The "Duo Nuevos Horizontes" ("New Horizons Duo") group was formed by two people who strive on a daily basis to move ahead in life.

Doña Ana Marina, who is the leader of this pair, has been working doing weaving for the last several years.  In her spare time, she also works raising animals such as chickens.  She is happy, because she feels that she can use this help that she needs to advance her business.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of raw materials for her weaving.

The loan will also be used for Señor Leonzo who works raising animals like chickens.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of more animals to increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving.

loans.name: Rehoda

texts.en: Rehoda is 38 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 10. They live at home and her husband has been a driver for three years now. Rehoda has been operating a cement dirt port in her community and she has more customers. One problem she faces is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase cements bags for her business. She plans to give her children business skills and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cements bags for her business

loans.name: Helver

texts.es: Helver, de 29 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su mamá Rosa, su papá Hilario y sus 3 hermanos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Los Libertadores de Huari. Su vida se centra en cuidar y velar por sus padres y hermanos. Por ello nunca pensó en casarse ni tener hijos. Su principal actividad económica es la ganadería, cuida ovejas, vacas y llamas a las cuales alimenta muy bien, pues cuenta que ahí está el secreto de su éxito. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus ovinos, hasta convertir a todos sus ejemplares en animales de reza. También trabaja como albañil en construcción de casas en la ciudad de Huancavelica, donde recibe un dinero adicional de acuerdo al contrato que realiza en cada vivienda. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “galpón al éxito” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Helver de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 ovejas reproductoras para aumentar sus ganados.
texts.en:
Helver, age 29, is a hard-working man. He lives with his mother, Rosa; his father, Hilario; and his three siblings, whom he takes care of. They live in their own home in Los Libertadores de Huari. His life centers around taking care of his parents and siblings. For this reason, he has never considered getting married or having children. His main job is in livestock. He cares for sheep, cows, and llamas. He feeds them very well, and tells us that this is the secret behind his success. He now wants to improve the quality of his sheep, in order to make them exemplary examples of their breeds. 
He also works as a bricklayer, building houses in the city of Huancavelica. He makes an additional income from this based on the contract for each home.
He belongs to the “Galpón al éxito” communal bank and this is his first loan with MFP. He is grateful for the support that he is receiving; it will allow him to progress with his business. He promises to be punctual in the payment of his quotas. His group is made up of responsible and united people. Upon receiving your support, Helver will invest this money in the purchase of two breeding sheep to increase his flock.

loans.use: to buy two sheep.

loans.name: Johana Isabel

texts.es:
Junto a su esposo han venido mejorando su  vivienda, con el credito anterior, invertio, mas en su negocio y encargos hechos por los clientes, aumentando sus ganancias, gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic otorgo, asi mismo con el apoyo de sus hijos dos de ellos trabajan y dan para los gastos del hogar. 
Con este nuevo prestamo comenzara la construccion de un cuarto, comprando materiales de construccion como:piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, logrando tener mas espacio y comodidad para su familia, el cual espera terminar a largo plazo ya que tiene que equilibrar sus gastos, y los materiales estan ah altos costos. Pero que espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Together with her husband, Johana Isabel has been improving her house. With the previous loan she invested in her business and orders made by her clients, increasing her earnings thanks to the funding from Afodenic. Her children also helped - two of them work and contribute money for household expenses. 

With this new loan she will start building a room so that her family will have more space and comfort. She will buy materials like rocks, sand, cement and re-bar. She expects it will take awhile to finish, since she has to balance her expenses and the materials are costly, but she hopes to meet her objective.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to begin building a room to give her family more space and comfort.

loans.name: Golibjon

texts.ru: Голибджон умный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и имеет двое детей. Пять лет назад он начал заниматься выращиванием арбуза, вначале ему было трудно работать на земле, а потом постепенно привык, и добавил участок земли и выращивал лука. Голибджон хочет хорошо обеспечить и кормит своих детей и с этой целью он продвигается вперед. Голибджон хочет расширить выращивание лука и его собственные средства не хватает на это и поэтому он запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Golibjon is a smart and hardworking person.  He is married and has two children.  He started to grow watermelons five years ago, and at first, he found it difficult to work on the land, but then, he gradually got used to the work and added a plot of land to grow onions.  Golibjon wants to provide for and feed his children well, and continues to move forward to achieve this goal.  He wants to expand his onion production, but does not have enough of his own means to do so.  This is why he is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000.  Golibjon relies on your help and is grateful to you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to expand onion production

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María de 33 años de edad, vive en la comunidad El Jicarito  en las afuera de León  tiene 3 hijos de 14, 10 y 5 años de edad respectivamente están estudiando, es casada. Se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y a la siembra de hortalizas en la comunidad. La crianza de cerdos ha sido su primer negocio ella comenzó comprando un cerdo para reproducir y poco a poco se ido especializando con este tipo de actividades además de sentirse independiente y generar ingresos por ella misma aportando a su hogar. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para compra de cerdos y reproducir para vender. Uno de sus planes es tener una finca reproductora de cerdos de raza y sacar adelante la siembra de hortalizas que ella misma siembra.
texts.en:
María, aged 33, lives in the neighborhood of El Jicarito on the outskirts of León. She is the mother of three children who are 14, 10 and 5 years old, respectively, and attend school. María is married. She breeds pigs and grows vegetables in her community. Breeding pigs has been her first activity; she began it by buying a pig to breed and gradually she became specialized in this type of activity. It gives her a feeling of independence and generates an income, which she spends on household needs.

María applies for this loan to buy pigs to breed and sell. One of her plans consists in owning a farm for pig breeding, where she would also continue growing vegetables herself.

loans.use: to buy pigs to breed and sell.

loans.name: Milcent

texts.en: Milcent, 34 years old, is married and has two children, aged four and seven years. She describes herself as a determined woman. She provides printing services to frequent and new customers. She has been in this business for two years. Previously, she was employed at a supermarket. Her business challenge is insufficient funds to improve the business. She will be using the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy more printing materials. Milcent's hope and dream is to run a cyber-cafe.

loans.use: To buy printing materials.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married with one child. Norma is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Norma is a farmer and grows assorted crops such as vegetables in order to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 in order to purchase fertilizers and pesticide. 

Norma has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizer pesticides.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina received some education until the end of middle school. Currently she sells provisions like milk, sugar, tin tomatoes, milo, etc. at Abura located near Cape Coast. Paulina is married to a farmer and has two children. She has been in this business for two years. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase an increased amount of sugar, milk, tin tomatoes, milo, etc. for sale. Paulina hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her children’s education and to give them a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of sugar, milk, tin tomatoes, milo, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Mirgul

texts.ru: Миргул, 25 лет, не замужем, есть трех летний сын. Миргул, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и выращиванием экологически-чистых кукурузы и клевера, начав свой бизнес с 2012 года. Благодаря упорному труду Миргул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется лошадь, также есть 1,74 ГА поливной земли. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Миргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и удобрений для полеводства, с целью выращивания органических, экологически чистых кукурузы и клевера. Доходы от кредита Миргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и покупку земельного участка.
texts.en:
Mirgul is 25 years old, unmarried, and has a three-year-old son. Mirgul is the main breadwinner for her family. She is engaged in animal husbandry and the cultivation of maize and clover, having started her business in 2012. 

Thanks to the painstaking work of Mirgul, today, her farm has a horse, as well as 1.74 hectares of irrigated land. In order to further develop her business, Mirgul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 Som (KGS). This will help her to buy seeds and fertilizer for crop cultivation. Mirgul plans to invest the revenue from the loan in the further development of her business, as well as to buy land.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers in order to grow organic clover and maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Regina wants to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa O. lives in the town of Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a taxi driver, but his income was not enough to pay for the education of their children and so Felipa decided to start her own business 2 years ago. She sells shoes to ensure that her children can finish college. Felipa has worked hard and needs a loan of $475 to buy merchandise and provide better service to her customers. She is committed to repaying her loan in 5 to 10 months. You can support this business and improve this family’s standard of living. They thank you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Virgilio Russi, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, es donde vive Felipa O., ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es taxista, pero con el ingreso que obtiene no podían cubrir los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos, por lo que Felipa decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace dos años, vendiendo zapatos, para de esta manera obtener los recursos que necesitaba para sus hijos y que ellos puedan concluir su carrera universitaria con éxito.

Felipa se ha esforzado mucho por sus hijos, ahora requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, para poder brindarles un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 5 a 10 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, así como en la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu K. is forty years old with two children.  She lives in Momunta, one kilometer away from Magburaka town in Sierra Leone.  Married to a subsistence farmer, Isatu runs a small business at her home by the roadside selling foodstuffs.  That income supplements the food from her garden and provides for other family expenses.  Isatu would like to access a loan of $200 in order to expand her inventory and diversify into additional items.

loans.use: Increase and diversify her stock of foodstuffs

loans.name: Juana De Jesus

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Juana de Jesús. My occupation is making bread and nacatamales (a type of Central American tamal). I make them at home and sell them in the street. I have been doing this for several years and it generates income to cover my family’s expenses, while also allowing me to take care of my family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Juana de Jesus, mi actividad principal es la elaboración de pan y nacatamales ( productos para consumo Humano) los que elaboro en mi casa de habitación y los distribuyo de manera ambulante, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, al mismo tiempo que me permite atender a mi familia. tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, shortening, sugar, and margarine

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long D., 46, lives with her husband and three children in Bathambong Province, Cambodia. To support herself and her two school-aged children, Mrs. Long Daroen works making and selling traditional cakes at an open-air market, earning around US$5 a day in revenue. Her husband and one of their children work in construction, each earning US$3 a day. Mrs. D. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase a motorcycle for trasportation, and to invest in business expansion.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle and of supplies for business expansion

loans.name: Nanah

texts.en: Nanah is 37 years old and a mother of a 13 year old daughter. She has a small shop from which sells some snacks. She usually earns $8 per day. Her husband J. is a driver who earns $2 income per day. She has to work to earn more income for the family and requests a $100 loan to buy more goods for her shop and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the shop

loans.name: Enayat

texts.en: I am Enayat B. from a historical city in Pakistan, Lahore. I am a mother of nine: four sons and five daughters. My husband is a scrap dealer and I run a grocery store. I have made a store in my house to serve my neighborhood clients. I need a loan of $250 to buy some required items such as sugar, oil, flour, etc. for my store. I hope to generate good profits from my store.

loans.use: Buy items for her grocery store

loans.name: Thi Chuyen

texts.vi:
Mrs Chuyền is 23. She is married and has 2 young children who are attending school. She sells meat at the market. Her husband runs a motorbike repair shop at home. Their daily income is 100000 VND (6.25 USD). She has contracted loans from lenders before but has repaid. She likes SEDA because she can pay in installments. She's requesting a loan of 150 USD to stock up her inventory thus raising her revenue in the long run.

Translated fron=m Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Chuyền, 23 tuổi, có 2 con đang còn đi học. Hàng ngày, chị đi chợ bán thịt còn chồng chị thì sửa xe máy tại nhà. Thu nhập bình quân hai vợ chồng chị là 100000đ/ngày. Chị đã từng vay vốn ở ngoài, nhưng nay đã trả hết. Chị thích vay theo Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc hơn vì được trả dần hàng tuần. Với số tiền 2006000đ vay được, chị dùng để đi chợ, mua thêm nhiều thịt về để bán, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.

loans.use: buy meat

loans.name: Gladness

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Gladness Machocho. She is married with three children, aged 2, 15, and 17, and has two other dependents, who are her nieces.

In 2002 Gladness established a poultry and clothing business, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional chicks to raise and sell, as well as stocks of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may have read about kuku many times. Who or what are ‘kuku’, you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

Firstly, they require little start-up capital, you can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. There are probably hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow!

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks as well as stocks of clothing.

loans.name: Muhamed S.

texts.en:
Muhamed S. C. is 37 years old and married with 3 children. He grows rice and vegetables. With his first SMT loan, he was able to harvest 1200 heads of cabbage and earned a good profit. His rice production also increased by 5 bags and he is planning to sell some bags soon. C. would like to be a commercial rice farmer and is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000 for the purpose.

Mr. C. has a goal of becoming a commercial rice farmer. He needs additional inputs, land, and labourers to accomplish this goal.

loans.use: For supplies, land, and labor needed to become a commercial rice farmer

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Tạ Thị Hòa is 50 years old. She has been raising pigs for the last 10 years. She lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên with her husband and their 3 children. Before joining TYM, she did not have enough capital to invest in a business so she was only able to make enough money to live. After joining TYM, she had the opportunity to expand her pig raising business with the loans. Today, she has a few dozens pigs. Every year, she sells 5 batches of pigs worth 10000 USD. She is very confident in her business so she always applies for max loan every time. She is requesting 1200 USD this time.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tạ Thị Hòa, 50 tuổi, làm nghề chăn nuôi được 10 năm nay. Chị đang sống cùng chồng, một nông dân, và 3 người con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Công việc của chị là chăn nuôi lợn, bò sinh sản phục vụ cho người dân nơi chị sinh sống. Trước khi vào Quỹ do lượng vốn đầu tư ít nên lợi nhuận thu được chỉ đủ chi tiêu trong gia đình và để ra không đáng kể. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ chị Hòa có điều kiện mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi của mình hơn. Trong chuồng nhà chị luôn có vài chục con lợn. Mỗi năm chị Hòa cho xuất chuồng 5 lứa lợn trị giá trên dưới 10000USD. Phấn khởi trước những kết quả đạt được, chị luôn đề nghị mức vốn tối đa tại các vòng vốn. Số vốn chị định vay lần này là 1200USD.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Ibraim

texts.fr:
Ibraim I. is 36 years old, married, and has children. He sells food in general at a shop in Kpalimé, one of the biggest cities in Togo. His offers various goods and hopes to use this loan to bolster his shop. Specifically, he wants to increase the capacity of his enterprise by buying oil, eggs, rice, soap, and other items for retail sale. He hopes to continue to improve his family's quality of life through the profits he is going to earn by selling his merchandise.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Ibraim I. est âgé de 36 ans et marié avec des enfants. Il opère une boutique d’alimentation générale à Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Il vend les produits variés et espère utiliser ce crédit pour renforcer sa boutique. Spécifiquement, Ibraim veut augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en achetant de l’huile, les œufs, du riz, du savon et les autres produits pour revendre. Il espère continuer améliorer la qualité de vie de sa famille par les profits il va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises.

loans.use: To bolster his shop

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Born on August 4, 1964 in Sokodé in Tchaoudjo Prefecture, Mrs. Ablavi S. is married and the mother of four children. Since the year 2002, she has been selling "wax prints", lengths of traditional African print cloth, and handbags in the Hédzranawoé neighborhood of Lomé. Her shop is located near the neighborhood's open-air market and does a brisk business, especially on market days.

After reimbursing her first loan in a timely manner, she is requesting this loan to buy 21 lengths of "bazin" (traditionally dyed cloth) for US$ 400 and 16 handbags for $200.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 04 août 1964 à Sokodé dans la préfecture de Tchaoudjo, Madame S. Ablavi est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Depuis l’année 2002, elle exerce le commerce de pagne et de sacs de sortis dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle a son magasin proche du marché du quartier et fait de bonnes recettes par jour surtout les jours de marché.

Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit, elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 21 pièces de bazin pour un montant de 168.000FCFA et 16 sacs de sortie pour un montant de 82.000FCFA

loans.use:
Purchase of 21 lengths of "bazin", traditionally dyed cloth

Achat de 21 pièce de bazin

loans.name: Liliana Pamela

texts.es:
Liliana is single. She is 27 years old and has studied through high school. She has two young children who depend on her. She lives in the neighborhood of Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Currenty she is the director of a line of beauty products and she has 54 consultants working for her who she constantly audits to achieve better sales as the group continues to add more consultants. Separate from selling beauty products, she is dedicated to the sale of milk in her neighborhood and other nearby neighborhoods also. This is a business that she inherited from her mother. She doesn't want to give it up since she currently has several cows with very good production and doesn't want to sell to big businesses wholesale because they pay very little. The first loan she received was S/.300.00 with which she started the business selling beauty products independently, since she helped another person sell when she was very young. She belongs to the Community Bank "Las Palmeras." With this loan of S/.500.00 that she will repay in 4 months, she is thinking of buying beauty products to have better stock. Liliana works with great persistence and dedication because she has a goal of buying a house.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana es soltera, tiene 27 años, estudió secundaria completa, tiene 02 hijos menores de edad los cuales dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Actualmente, es directora en una línea de productos de belleza y tiene 54 consultoras a su cargo a las cuales capacita constantemente para la mejor realización de las ventas a pesar del grupo que tiene continúa captando más consultoras. A parte de dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza se dedica también a la venta de leche en su distrito y otros distritos aledaños, este es un negocio que lo heredó de su madre y no quiere dejarlo ya que tiene algunas vacas con muy buena producción y venderlo al por mayor a empresas grandes no le conviene porque pagan muy poco. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 con los cuales se inició en la venta de productos de belleza de manera independiente ya que desde muy joven había vendido ayudando a otra persona. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS”. Con el préstamo de S/.500.00 que cancelará en 4 meses tiene pensado comprar productos de belleza para tener mayor stock. Liliana trabaja con mucho empeño y dedicación porque tiene como meta comprar su casa.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Alejandro Adolfo

texts.es:
Alejandro lives in the municipality of Veracruz. He is 31 years old, married, has two children in elementary school and his wife is a housewife. Alejandro is a bus driver with 11 years of experience. He started in that line of work with the support of his parents. He wants to provide a better life for his family and says that because he’s young, he has to work hard for them.

The loan that he is requesting is for purchasing construction materials to add a porch onto his home to begin to improve it little by little. He hopes to be able to see his home finished and his family living in a decent house.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandro habita en el municipio de Veracruz, tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando la primaria, su esposa es ama de casa. Alejandro es transportista, conduce un bus de transporte y tiene once años de experiencia, inició en esta actividad con apoyo de sus padres. Desea darles una vida mejor a su familia, ya que cómo él mismo dice es joven y tiene que trabajar fuerte por su familia. El préstamo que está solicitando es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer el porche de su vivienda, y así empezar a mejorar su vivienda poco a poco. Espera poder ver su vivienda terminada y a su familia con una casa digna.

loans.use: Construction of a porch for a private home

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Phan Thi P. is 55 years old. Her three children are all grown up and have stable jobs. She joined TYM Fund in 1997 to borrow loans for animal raising. At present, besides animal raising, she has a rock grinding machine and grinds rock for people in her area. For the next loan cycle, she is applying for VND 10 million to buy a threshing-machine to serve local people.

loans.use: to buy a threshing-machine

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem C., 38, is a true entrepreneur and lives with four children in the Siem Reap, Cambodia. She works selling groceries and sugar cane juice from her home, making approximately US$ 5, while her husband works selling firewood and makes US$ 10 per day. One of her sons has a business selling sand and two others are students.

Chem C. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to add grocery inventory; the remainder will be used to purchase a trailer for her husband to use to transport the wood.

loans.use: To add grocery inventory and purchase a trailer

loans.name: Perpetua Felicitas

texts.en:
Perpetua is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. Perpetua is 48 years old, separated, and has four children. Perpetua sells sawdust from her home, located in Las Americas. The sawdust she sells is then used to make adobe bricks and to transport livestock and frozen fish. Her children help her with the business. Perpetua needs a loan of 1300 soles to buy sacks of sawdust. Perpetua’s dreams are to have her own car to transport her products to other places and to help her children get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Perpetua es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma. Perpetua es separada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Perpetua se dedica a la venta de aserrín en su casa ubicada en las Américas, su producto los adquiere de las diferentes carpinterías y madereras de la ciudad, el aserrín es utilizado para la fabricación de ladrillos, transportar ganado, pescado congelado, sus ventas los realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos. Perpetua necesita un préstamo de 1300 soles dinero que será invertido en la comprar de aserrín por sacos. Los sueños de Perpetua son tener un carro para transportar sus productos a otros lugares, salir adelante con sus hijos.

loans.use: Perpetua would like to buy sawdust in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Xiếp năm nay 50 tuổi. Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con đã trưởng thành tại Thị trấn Gia Lộc tỉnh Hải Dương. Cả hai vợ chồng chị đều làm nghề kinh doanh buôn bán. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang có một cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh điện thoại di động với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Xiếp trong thời gian qua.
Vòngvốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh điện thoại di động.
texts.en:
Mrs. X. Thi Hoang is 50 years old. Mrs. Hoang is currently living with her husband and two adult children in the town of GIa Loc, province of Hai Duong. Both Mrs. Hoang and her husband do business trading goods. Currently, the family owns a store that sells mobile phones with an income of 3,000,000 VND per month. This business has also been the main source of income for the family in the past. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in the cell phone store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Lev

texts.en:
Mr. Lev M. is a villager from Beong Veng village in Kampong Cham province. He is a farmer who owns 3.5 hectares where he cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he faces a problem because he does not have enough animals to plow the field. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Lev M. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow to plow the field. His wife, Mrs. Toem Ton, helps him in the plantation.

Mr. Lev M. is 53 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is a laborer while another one is a farmer and the remaining two are attending the local school. His wife is also shown with him in the picture.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to plow his field.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Juliana es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Juliana vende golosinas en la puerta del mercado artesanal de la ciudad, para lo cual tiene un triciclo. Además Juliana los días martes y viernes viaja a las ferias en donde vende ropa.
Juliana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de faldas, chompas.
Los sueños de Juliana son mejorar su negocio, tener mas capital y surtir con mas productos sus negocios.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the community bank Triomphe. She is 48 years old, and married with 4 children. Juliana sells candy in front of the city's craft market, for which she has a tricycle. In addition, Juliana travels on Tuesdays and Fridays to fairs where clothing is sold. Juliana needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles that she'll invest in the purchase of skirts and sweaters. Her dreams are to improve her business, to have more capital, and to produce more products with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase skirts and sweaters

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La familia D. Ana, D. 50 años D. edad, consta D. 4 miembros, su esposo y tres hijos. La casa donD. viven es propia. Ella se dedica a la sastrería en las instalaciones D. su casa, porque cose desD. la edad D. 14 años a raíz que aprendió D. su madre, D. esa manera estuvo haciendo lo que siempre le gusta, que es confeccionar ropa. Esta actividad la realiza con más interés desD. hace 25 años, y lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos por su buena labor, además le es muy rentable porque cuenta con una clientela selecta y exigente. En adelante Ana quiere mandar construir su propio taller textil. Este es su préstamo número 12 con MFP y se siente satisfecho por la labor que hace en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprar materiales como telas, hilos, cierres, y otros para confeccionar más prendas que pueda vender.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old and has a family of four: her husband and 3 children. They own their home. She works as a seamstress out of her home. She has been sewing since she was 14 years old, when she learned from her mother, and in this way has always been doing what she enjoys, which is making clothing. She has become more dedicated to sewing in the past 25 years, and what she enjoys about her work is that her customers feel satisfied with the good job she does, and that it has been very profitable since she has a select and demanding clientele. In the future, Ana wants to have her own sewing workshop built. This is her 12th loan with MFP and she is very satisfied with the work she does with her communal bank. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy materials such as fabric, thread, zippers, etc. to make more garments that she can sell.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make garments

loans.name: Zaria

texts.en:
Zaria S. is 20 years old, married, and has one child 5 years old. Zaria has owned a small grocery store in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for 5 years. Every day she works for 10 hours at her business. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $155. She belongs to Mjimwema "A" group loan (Group code 2029). 

Zaria is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more grocery items in order to increase her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, to get more food for her family, and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items in order to increase her current stock.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: A sus 59 años, Herminia sigue siendo una mujer con grandes fortalezas; gracias a sus hijos, quienes la ayudaron en su negocio, pueD. tener tranquilidad en D. su hogar donD. vive muy a gusto. Gracias a las oportunidades que supo aprovechar en el trascurso D. su vida pudo educar a sus hijos, quienes instalaron para su madre una tienda para que pudiera trabajar y no sentirse sola y mucho menos inactiva, que es lo que a la mayoría D. personas deprime. Es así, que desD. hace 4 años trabaja atendiendo su bodega todos los días, desD. las siete D. la mañana hasta las nueve D. la noche, pero los días que venD. comida cierra, pues hay mucha demanda en las tardes y cocinar es una D. las labores que le gusta realizar. Herminia tiene el deseo D. seguir trabajando para tener la posibilidad D. seguir cubriendo sus necesidades, pues “no lo agrada recibir, sino adquirir”; este pensamiento la motiva a luchar por incrementar su negocio e instalar un espacio para una librería y así surtir su mercadería. Trabajar con el grupo D. compañeras la llevaron a relacionarse con las personas y ayudarla en su negocio, pues las reuniones D. pago y los diversos eventos que celebran son motivos por las que sigue perteneciendo a PRISMA; pero este es su primer crédito individual, pues requiere D. capital para mejorar su negocio. Herminia comprará con los 3000 soles que solicita, grandes cantidades D. mercadería, como útiles escolares y productos D. belleza para tener una tienda muy bien surtida.
texts.en:
At 59, Herminia is still a woman of great fortituD.. Thanks to her children who help her with the business, she's able to live happily at home. Thanks to the opportunities that she's been smart enough to take advantage of over the course of her life, Herminia has been able to educate her children who, in turn, established a shop for their mother so that she would be able to work and not feel isolated, something that depresses most people. That's how, for 4 years, she's worked tending her grocery, each day, from seven in the morning until nine at night except those days when she closes to sell food. There's a lot of demand for her meals some evenings and cooking is one of the jobs that she most enjoys. Herminia would like to continue working in order to cover her everyday needs since "no lo agrada recibir, sino adquirir" [you're not grateful for what you receive, only what you buy]; this idea has led her to strive to grow her business and set up a space for bookshop. Working with a group has opened the way to friendships and help for her business and the payment meetings and other events are reasons for continuing to belong to PRISMA, but this will be Herminia's first individual loan. She will use the 3000-soles loan to buy large quantities of merchandise, things for students and beauty product, for example, to stock her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply general store.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is married to Joel and blessed with three children: Jolina, 12 years old, an elementary student; Jericho, 7 years old, also in the elementary level and Jasmin, 2 months old. The family is happily living in the village of Cabisera 5 Centro, San Antonio, covered by the municipality of Ilagan, near the Pinacanauan River.

Elena is a food vendor. She sells different kinds of cooked foods in front of her house. Sometimes she also roams around their village to sell her products. Elena is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 that she will use to buy kilos of meat and different vegetables for her vending business. She aims to expand the business through the financial assistance. She is a woman full of hopes and is dreaming to be successful someday so as to save for her family and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy kilos of meat and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.en:
X. Duong Thi (9080003111) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has three adult-aged children. To making a living, X. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. X. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, X. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous loan taken from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. X. now requests a new loan of 20,000,000 VND to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be X. 10th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Kiganda Central Nyangoma Ben Group

texts.en: N. Ben is a married lady, 34, and a proud mother of four children all at school. She sells new clothes and she has been selling new clothes for over seven years. She will use the loan to purchase trousers, shirts, kids’ clothing, traditional wear like Gomes’s, bitegi etc for sale. She is an active lady whose dream is to complete her house.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: El Hadji Madicke

texts.fr:
el hadji madické G. est un jeune marchand ambulant né en 1988 à thies;il fait du petit commerce de pantalons,de tee shirts et des  articles pour femmes qu'il achète à dakar pour le revendre sur le marché de thiès
avec ce pret ,il envisage de renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
El Hadji Madické G. is a young itinerant merchant who was born in 1988 in Thiès. He does small-scale commerce in pants, T-shirts, and women's goods that he buys in Dakar to resell in the market of Thiès. With this loan, he envisions boosting his working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A small business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca G. Hernández tiene la edad de 40 años. Es una madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella decide establecer este negocio porque es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, es por eso que decide vender productos de consumo diario, y comienza a vender jabón, detergentes y refrescos naturales, por medio de una tía decide realiza un financiamiento a Fundación León 2000, y con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio. Y ahora solicita otro financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, frijoles, aceite y sorgo. Su deseo es comprar bodega recoger todos los granos básicos y almacenarlos.
texts.en:
Francisca G. H. is 40 years old, she is a single mother to two children, both of whom are going to school. She sells basic grains and she has been running this business for more than three years. She decided to set up her business because she has an entrepreneurial spirit and she is hard working. She sells common daily-use products, now starting to sell soaps, detergents and fresh fruit juices. Her aunt connected her with Fundacion Leon 2000 (Kiva Field Partner) and with the help of these loans she has seen success in her business. She requires a loan to be used as working capital, to purchase corn, beans, cooking oil and sorghum. Her wish is to purchase a store where she can sell all the basic grains and be able to store them.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Julia Veronica

texts.es:
Julia es socio del Bancomunal Los Sureños, es conviviente tiene 24 años, tres hijos de 9, 3 y 7 meses, solo el mayor esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Julia  no termino el colegio se quedo en tercero de segundaria por que salió embarazada, se puso a trabajar como ambulante vendiendo sandalias en los mercados, pero hace un año y medio decidió alquilar un puesto  en el mercado. y se puso a vender ropa de niño y ropa interior. 
Desde que Julia esta en Finca, aprendió ha ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos. 
Julia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de mercadería ropa interior brasieres.
El sueño de Julia es tener un negocio propio para no pagar alquiler.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “Los Sureños” (The Southerners) Community Bank. She is 24 years old and has three children who are 9 years old, 3 years old, and 7 months old. Only the oldest is studying in public school.

Julia did not finish high school. She remained in her third year because she left when she was pregnant. She began to work as a street vendor selling sandals in the markets. However, a year and a half ago she decided to rent a space in the market and she began to sell children’s clothing and underwear.

Since Julia became a member of Finca, she has learned to be responsible and punctual in her payments.

Julia needs a loan of 800 PEN for the purchase of merchandise (underwear, bras). Julia’s dream is to have her own business so she doesn’t have to pay rent.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (underwear, bras)

loans.name: Lugendo Kagoya Rehema Group

texts.en: K. Rehema, a forty-five year old businesswoman, represents this group. She is married and blessed with five children, all of whom go to school. She deals in used clothes and has been in business for three years. She sells ladies' clothing, that is, skirts, blouses, dresses, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ladies' clothing, probably she wants to add value to her business. She is an encouraging lady and her future plan is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela V. T. is 53 years old and has seven children.  She is widowed and lives together with her youngest son in the city of Pucallpa.  Angela has worked in the city slaughterhouse for the past 28 years and sells tripe and other viscera from livestock.  Angela’s work has enabled her to support her children.  

Angela has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for eight years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners).  She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in timber for sale.  She plans to use this loan of 1500 soles to purchase a second-hand motorcycle taxi.  

Angela’s goal is to someday have a home-based business such as a small restaurant that serves lunch.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Shafiq

texts.en:
Shafiq is 46 years old. He is married and has six children. He is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells in the commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what he enjoys most.

Shafiq has asked for this loan to buy young cattle in order to obtain a better profit. He thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Aluma

texts.en:
Aluma H. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at the resturant and is requesting a loan to purchase more beans and rice to cook and sell. 

 Aluma is 41 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 3 children and her children go to school. 

 With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her resturant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more beans and rice to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Small grocery store and restuarant

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy J. makes a living selling charcoal, and is applying for this loan so that she can also begin selling dried cassava and sugar. She is 19 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is not yet old enough to go to school. With the extra profits generated by this loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her young family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy dried cassava and sugar to sell

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 25 años, 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.

Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio, brindando servicio de masajes juntamente con su esposo, se encuentra establecida en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes que día a día la frecuentan para brindarles el servicio. Nos cuenta que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, hoy en día se siente muy orgullosa de lo logrado.

 Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará productos como: esencias para masajes, aromatizantes, velas, comprará toallas y batas de color blanco y para brindar una mayor comodidad. Parte del dinero, también lo invertirá en esmaltes de pintura, para mejorar la infraestructura de su local, y así de esta manera ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Jesús, anhela implementar su negocio y convertirle en un SPA y manifiesta que lo va a hacer realidad  porque es una mujer, que cuando se propone algo lo logra.   Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a continuar con su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jesus is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras" (struggling women), district of Tarapoto, San Martin province, state of San Martin. She has a life partner and a 25 year old son that still depends on her for support. Her enterpreneurial spirit and the love for her family motivated her to start her own business and with her husband they offer massage services. She offers the service from her own home in a nicely conditioned area to serve her clients. She mentions that little by little her business has grown and by gaining experience in the field, she now feels very proud of her accomplishment. With the $700 loan, she will purchase products such as aromatherapy oils, candles, towels and white as well as different color robes to offer more comfort. She will invest part of the money purchasing paint to improve the infrastructure of her business area and by doing so offering better customer service to her clients. Jesus wishes to eventually make her business a SPA and expresses the conviction to make her dream come true because she is the type of woman that achieves the goals she sets for herself. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the continued help with her business and also to the many enterpreneurial women that want to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase aromatherapy products for her massage service business

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife C. is from the village of Lantay, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Marife is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, vending fish in the local community. In 2008, Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional capital for the business. Marife is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to reinvest in her business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Marife from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business
